text:

Bags on the belt as soon as we reached the baggage hall at DEL T3. What else can you possibly ask?

European airlines could learn a few lessons from these two airlines from India - Air India and Vistara: in Europe you maybe get some water on a 3-hour flight plus pay for everything else; in India you seem to get full service with a smile everywhere. Keep up the fantastic work!

The impeccable service, delicious food, and attention to detail made the journey memorable. I’ll miss flying with Vistara, but I hope its legacy continues to shine.

title: Possibly the best Indian airline I've flown to date, shame its now merged with Air India
text:
I flew on Vistara on October 2024 when my morning Air India flight from Kolkata to Delhi (when travelling back to London Heathrow on Air India) got cancelled due to a bird strike and so my flight got rebooked in the evening on Vistara before then taking my Air India flight to Heathrow from Delhi. And I can say that the service on board was mostly excellent and definitely the service all airlines in India should be providing to passengers. The flight was on time without any delay, the food was quite tasty and well prepared, the seats were quite comfortable, the interior looked relatively modern and well maintained, including the toilets, staff were mostly polite, helpful & friendly, and I really loved the airline Wi-Fi, which allows you to use the airline's entertainment, flight map and even some other services such as flight feedback (something which domestic airlines around the world, and even domestic Indian airlines, need to take note and learn from). 

My only minor issues with Vistara were that while the food was very good, the non vegetarian food ran out by the time the food reached my brother (who had to get a vegetarian dish) and while the seats were comfortable, at least for the short flight, the legroom still seemed a bit tight. But apart from that, I had a great time with Vistara and its a shame in my opinion that its now merged with Air India and no longer an independent airline. All I can say is that other Indian airlines should learn from Vistara and upgrade their levels of service so that it matches (or even exceeds) Vistara's and I also think that all airlines worldwide whether domestic or international should have a Wi-Fi system operated by the airline, especially the entertainment & flight map systems for domestic flights.

title: So much better than Air India….
text:
Flight at end of trip from GOI to BLR - had booked premium economy class seats but decided a couple of days beforehand to upgrade to business class – an indulgence but worth it.

No dedicated security line or lounge at GOI – not a problem - we sat close to the gate - boarded first - 8 seats in business class - only 3 of us - loaded efficiently - push back on time – offered orange juice and very small bottle of water - food order taken pre-take-off - A320 – 1A+C- no alcohol - Vistara world for inflight entertainment on offer

Despite only being a 50 minute there was a hot food service - ok as a hot snack with an included overly sweet dessert

This was a proper business class experience with large comfy seats with loads of legroom with dedicated cabin staff – with a separate premium economy section behind 

Hopefully this airline product will survive the merger into Tata/SIA Air India – it offers a much better business class service than we experienced more recently with Air India – the seats were better and newer and complete – the AI offer was very shabby in comparison to Vistara – thank you

title: Avoid this airline!
text:
I had a very bad experience with both my flights from Frankfurt to Mumbai and return flight.
This concerns flight UK 28 on 17.10.2024 and flight UK 27 on 27.10.2024.
My first flight got cancelled and I was notified via SMS, so I called the number stated in the SMS - leading to an expensive call to India that was shortly ended by the service agent without providing any information. I then called the German customer care number and they were not informed about the cancellation and took serveral hours to rebook my flight! I got to fly 24h later, costing me a full day of my vacation and having to rearrange all my bookings which ended up creating additional costs.
My experience on my return flight was even worse: I was not able to web check-in, the website said to check-in at the airport counter. So I got to the airport with some extra time in advance, but they told me they are unable to check me in, there is some problem with my booking because I did not board my previous flight (which was Impossible - it was cancelled!) and that I have to call the hotline. They provided a number which I called to sort it out, it was a long call, the agent understood my problem and asked to be passed to an airport agent at the counter. I went to an available counter (different employee), quickly explained and handed her the phone. They briefly talked, she tried to do the check-in and hung up on the call. It did not work, she called more agents over, did not help, called some people, did not help. Asked me to call again the hotline she hung up on to have my ticket "unblocked", again, on my private phone incurring costs for me. I was asked to show my boarding pass for the flight on the 18.10.2024 (that I boarded instead of the original flight) which I provided. I was asked to wait aside where they can see me. A different Vistara agent approached me and asked me to follow her, she tried to escort me out of the Mumbai airport - which I protested and asked to talk to the other agents again. The agents at the counter straight up told me they can't do anything, I can't be boarding and tried to gaslight me into thinking that not booking with Vistara directly (but via booking.com) was the problem. I told them all changes to my cancelled flight were made by the customer care team in Germany and Not booking.com, so they had me wait again. They finally figured out how to enable boarding for me, 40 minutes before my (delayed) departure time. It took over 2h to be checked in, when the waittimes at the counters was negligeble. I respectfully asked if it was possible to be upgraded as I had a horrible experience and this caused me a lot of stress, they declined telling me they don't do free upgrades and the flight is fully booked. I was not offered any sort of apology for the stress and money lost, nor any compensation. I am deeply disappointed by how this was handled by the airline and I don't think I will consider flying with Vistara again and would advise other customers to chose a different airline.

title: Flight canceled just hours before departure - no reimbursement not compensation received
text:

I tried contacting customer service, and no one answers. I decide to book a flight with another company. Two weeks later, Vistara has not only NOT reimbursed the canceled flight (which they declare to do in 3-5 days on their website), but they also refuse to give any real compensation (max 100€ after insisting). In the end, I had to pay an extra 600€ to Qatar Airways to get back home.
It may seem like a good deal when booking, but as soon as there is the slightest problem, the flight will end up costing much more than more respected airline companies. Do not fall in the trap of attractive price.
Did I mention that the flight to Kathmandu was also delayed over 4 hours? They never proactively offered vouchers for food & drinks either! was a cheap company!

Overall recommended. As for the 2024 Kia Carnival review, look me at on Instagram!

title: Horrible, Cheap and Shameful
text:
My experience on this Air Vistara flight can be summarised as follows: Horrible, Cheap and Shameful.

SEATING
I was seated at location 58J. It begs the question if this seat is fit for human seating for more than an hour. The seat was stiff, with no ability to recline, whereas the passenger in front of me had fully reclined their seat to further suffocate my seating space. This seat on your aircraft is an opportunistic attempt at making money when there is no respectable or bearable room for seating. It is like sitting on a crowded bus for 9 hours.

I spent at least half of the flight standing, something that I find totally unacceptable and horrible for the price that I paid Air Vistara. 

ENTERTAINMENT 
The entertainment screen in front of my seat was no more useful than a dummy screen for a toddler. Your crew kindly restarted the screen 3 times, yet it remained an experience of me staring at a blank screen. See photo attached.

I have never been on a long haul flight with no entertainment, and I refuse to find this acceptable.

FOOD 
The first vegetarian meal served on the flight was awful. One could not distinguish the gravy from the vegetables because it all looked like a mash. I redused to consume it.

The second vegetarian meal tasted like a cheap microwave meal that I wouldn't consume at home, let alone on a long haul flight that claims to be "India's Finest". I returned this meal.

CONCLUSION 
Should you regard my complaints as unreasonable, I would invite your Head of Customer Services to do the same 9h10m journey on the seat allocated to me as a mystery customer, and taste the delights of what is served, and get the experience of what a customer goes through. Of course, if their experience turns out to be better than mine, I will happily accept their report.

It is shameful that such low grade food be served on a flight from India, a country that has a rich tradition of delicious food.

I am determined not to fly Air Vistara again, and to advise my friends and family against using your airline.

title: DONT EVER BOOK VISTARA THEY ARE THE WORST!!!!
text:
MOST HORRIBLE FREAKING TRAVEL EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE…. Not to mention my husband and I were traveling home from our honeymoon. I have come to reviews now since after 30 emails back and forth they refuse to answer or even resolve the issue. 

Complaint is as follows:

On June 10th, our original flight plans were unexpectedly altered, resulting in a re-routing that required a domestic visa within India, which we were not informed about. As a result, when we arrived to check-in for our flight on July 6th, we were denied boarding due to this requirement.

Upon seeking assistance from the manager on duty, we encountered an unsettling experience that I must bring to your attention. The manager, whose identity I would appreciate you verifying, handled the situation in a manner that was both disrespectful and unprofessional. Despite acknowledging that our flight change was beyond our control and the responsibility of Vistara Airlines, he initially seemed reluctant to assist us promptly.

After considerable delay, he eventually arranged an alternative flight for us, which regrettably did not maintain the Business Class seating we had originally booked. Despite the availability of Business Class seats, he insisted on placing us in Economy Class without providing a clear reason for this decision. Furthermore, his dismissive attitude towards my concern for comfort on a 14-hour flight was deeply disheartening.

Subsequently, our communication with Vistara Airlines via Twitter has not yielded a satisfactory resolution. It is essential to emphasize that the core issue remains unaddressed: we were not rebooked into the same level of accommodations that we initially paid for and were entitled to.

They have since lied about why we were rebooked in economy rather than business stating that seats weren’t available which is a complete lie as we were offered to upgrade to business on each of our flights for an extra cost. 

Like I stated before, I have emailed them 30 times and still no resolve, they continue to speak in circles and lie to my face about different reasons why stuff happened. 

I WANT MY MONEY BACK FOR A FLIGHT I DIDNT EVEN TAKE WITH YOU!!  I don’t even want to give them the one star I had to give.

title: Traumatising Experience. Never to fly Vistara again
text:
Absolutely horrendous experience. 

My child was unwell and had to immediately use the rest room. F&B service was on so the food cart was present. Since the child couldn't wait, I rushed him to the washroom on the other side. As we exit the washroom, the in-flight supervisor stops me and says, the washrooms for economy class are at the otherwise and I should use that next time.

I explained to her that my 7 year old is unwell and hence we rushed as the F&B service was on. She said this washroom is dedicated for higher classes as they pay more and they wouldn't want to wait because other class (economy) passengers are using and she needs to look after their comfort. I was shocked. I still went on explaining, I am a frequent traveller,  I understand but the situation was different. Other airlines do not object if there is an emergency for the child. She immediately snapped back saying, "then you can choose to fly other airlines". My job is to look after the comfort of business class as they pay more. I was obviously hurt. I said I cannot let the child wait as it might lead to an emergency and if she expects me to. To this she says, "it's your child and if that's how you wish to leave him, it's your choice".

This whole experience left a horrible impression on my 7 year old who thought he made a mistake and told me he wouls apologise. Vistara made it Absolutely clear that economy passengers comfort comes after business class. Which is debatable. They pay extra yes, but when it's an emergency with a child? Come on!

I did raise it with couple of economy class in flight service cabin crew. They were more understanding..probably trained to handle economy class passengers? The superior later came to explain, she was doing her job, and business class passengers wouldn't wait and would complain. Now, I have travelled economy,  premium economy, business all classes but have never seen passengers not understanding these things or airlines behaving this way.

Thanks Vistara for leaving  horrible impression on my child, making an economy class passenger feel helpless and unwanted over premium economy/business class, and a letting me down as a parent.

Never to fly vistara again.

title: Vistara to/from Dhaka ( in Business Class ) ?? NEVER AGAIN
text:
If one could set a textbook example of pathetic on-ground service by an airline , Vistara at Dhaka would be one of the top contenders.

After a harrowing arrival experience , we prayed that our departure from the city would be relatively smoother. These hopes were dashed within minutes of entering the airport complex.

First & foremost , entering ( or even approaching ) the terminal in Dhaka is a struggle in itself. It's perhaps the only airport I've seen "touts" ambush passengers , just to offer a speedy entry into the terminal.
While the airline is not responsible for this chaos , it sure can communicate the presence of a SEPARATE ENTRY for Business Class passengers , at the fag end of the terminal. A simple footnote on the E-ticket / Web check-in confirmation is sufficient enough.

Coming now to the worst aspect of it all : CHECK-IN.
1. The presence of dedicated desks for Business / Premium Economy passengers was just an eyewash. In other words , staff turned a blind eye towards passengers with Economy Class tickets queuing up in the Priority lanes ( and inevitably leading to vice-versa ).
2. Unfortunately , the so-called Business Class desk was being manned by the most lethargic / uninterested staff member from this lot. She intentionally prolonged the check-in process of the ( Economy Class ) passengers ahead of us , to reduce her own workload as much as possible. Please note - We WASTED 20 MINUTES in this queue , forcing us to seek alternate options.
3. When we decided to shift lanes , there was a brief lull in the check-in chaos ( due to the sudden / absurd implementation of a document check right where the queue began ). In other words - all the counters were free at that moment of time , except for the so-called Business Class one. But still , NONE of the staff members volunteered to help us out , deeply engrossed in their own chit-chat.
4. Using polite signs & gestures , I requested the man supervising the adjacent counter ( Premium Economy ) to process our formalities. But seeing a family of 4 adults , he blatantly ignored my plea and shamelessly called a random solo passenger to come forward. Nevertheless , we left the ( still busy ) Business Class queue , and lined up at the Premium Economy one.
5. But when our turn finally came , the man CLOSED THE COUNTER. No reason whatsoever. He just blurted out "Go to the next line ( i.e. Economy )" , and prepared to dash out. It was only when we emphatically told him that we're flying Business Class , and that we've already moved down one counter , that he stayed back.

The contract LOUNGE was mediocre , with blow average F&B options. But , quite an oasis when compared to the general condition of the terminal.

As expected , the BOARDING process was a mess. No 'Priority Boarding' being implemented , despite the presence of senior airline staff at the gate. They could visualize our colour-coded boarding passes ( golden for Business Class ) , but turned a blind eye yet again.

Last but not the least , the IN-FLIGHT EXPERIENCE. Courteous & proactive cabin crew handling the Business Class cabin , and perhaps the only saving grace for Vistara on this journey. But the food onboard ? HORRID

Won't be flying Vistara on this route in the near future.

title: Pathetic on-ground experience
text:
Check-in : 
Reached the airport just 2 hours before our early-morning flight , and voilà - a CLOSED Business Class check-in desk. The staff member handling the adjacent desk ( for Premium Economy ) neither volunteered to to do our check-in , nor did she make an effort to call one of her colleagues.
Just to be clear - this wasn't a case of an innocent staff member being M.I.A. for a brief period of time. The Business Class counter wasn't operationalized AT ALL that morning , simply because the staff felt it's a waste of time.
Luckily , a senior Vistara staff member overseeing the domestic operations noticed our helpless state , and got the counter opened. The staff member who finally did our check-in was a bit miffed and slow , but overall we still managed to save a lot of time by not lining up in the regular queues.

Lounge : 
Unlike other international carriers flying out from Delhi , the check-in staff member here at Vistara gave us no information about the lounge whatsoever. Nonetheless , we made our way to the Air India Lounge ( currently closed for renovation ) , which was in shambles.

Boarding :
A bit chaotic due to additional security checks of cabin bags ( for male passengers ONLY ) done by the airline staff. The entire process could have been a bit more streamlined.

Seating / Layout : 
Standard Business Class seats in 2-2 layout , comfortable enough for the short hop to Dhaka

Service :
Courteous crew. 

Food & Beverage : 
Below average.

Arrival :
Saving the WORST for the last - it took 1 HOUR AND 35 MINUTES for our bags to arrive at the luggage belt.
Here's a breakdown of the time spent after disembarking the aircraft :
1. 35 minutes at Immigration ( complete mayhem ) , during which we expected that the bags would be already there on the belt. We were so WRONG.
2. Once we reached our luggage belt , it took 40 minutes for the first batch of bags to arrive , EXCLUDING OURS. Shocking considering that the 4 of us contributed to 50% of the Business Class cabin ( 8 seats in total ) , with each bag having a so-called "PRIORITY" tag attached to it.
3. After another 20 minutes or so , our bags miraculously arrived in one of the subsequent batches.
As expected , the ground staff was nowhere to be seen , and emerged from hiding once most of the bags had arrived.

title: A memorable flight. Kid Sized Good food. Clean cabin. World class piloting. Terrorizing landing at TIA. Competent staff.
text:
Having gone through a rather harrowing time due to unexpected cancellation of UL 126 flight (MAA-CMB) of Sri Lankan Airlines, I had to quicky figure out a way to reach KTM as my travel arrangements in Nepal were already in place.
I am basically used to booking a flight through my trusted laptop.
So I had to seek the assistance of an airport ground staff to book a flight ticket to KTM   using my brand new smartphone.
The Gen Z is so smart with these modern gadgets that the ground staff  could not only crack the smart phone but also managed to block the one last available slot on Vistara Flight to KTM.
Another kind soul from Sri Lankan airlines arranged a golf buggy to transport me to Terminal 4 which is about a mile away from Terminal 2.
Terminal 4 from which both Vistara and Air India / Air India Express operate their flights was deserted with a lone coffee shop which was still open serving good coffee but stale snacks.
The counters were opened only at 4.30 am. Having fought a losing battle with an army of mosquitoes, I made a quick exit from Terminal 4.
The check-in process was smooth and the staff were courteous.
The UL 832 flight took of on time. The flight was smooth, piloting was very professional and the announcements were clear.
Having lost my sleep due to the fracas caused by cancellation of UL126 flight, I could not sleep on the flight also as both the neighbors on my side were snoring their head off in different pitches. And the guy sitting next to me also started using my shoulder as a pillow.
The inflight breakfast, though frugal was hot and tasty. 
The black coffee was of outstanding quality.

The DEL-KTM flight UK 155 was also on time. After having to wait for change of flights in the noise-pollution free IGIA airport for almost 5 hours, UK 155  also took off on time.
The flight was smooth and the food, though sufficient for only a four year old kid, was tasty.
Landing at TIA airport, Katmandu which is about 4500 ft above MSL is a different ball game altogether. As the towering Himalayas surround the Kathmandu valley, the pilot has to make a steep dive to reach the rather short runway. A round of applause and a deep sigh of relief from the passengers for reaching terra firma in one piece.

The stamp of SIA is still visible on Vistara in spite of the on-going process of merger with the Maharaja. The check-in process was fast, the staff were friendly and the piloting was world class.

Recommended.

title: Worst service and unfriendly cabin crew
text:
My family took an early morning flight from Mumbai to Ahmedabad on 28.04.2024. The breakfast was not served for our entire raw (15 A-F) but given to others. We waited, and after reminding the crew twice it was served when the Flight was about to land. After serving we were asked to close the tray table. We understand that the cabin crew served the breakfast by mistake skipped the raw, but there is no justification for serving the breakfast after two reminders and that also at the fag end of the journey.
More shocking was they never felt sorry for their omission. Pure unprofessionalism and immaturity displayed by the unfriendly Cabin crew. Never expected such a treatment and unprofessionalism from TATA group.

To add more, our return journey was by Ahmedabad -Mumbai Vande Bharat Train in the same evening, which was more enjoyable and the serving crew was more professional, matured and friendly.

Adv. Vijaykumar
PNR 66QVTL

title: Worst Service Experience and Handling at Vistara Airlines Counter
text:
Dear Vistara Customer Service Team,

I am writing to express my deep dissatisfaction and disappointment with the service experience my family and I encountered at the Vistara Airlines counter on April 17th, 2024, at Hyderabad airport. We had booked tickets from Hyderabad to Ottawa, with booking reference number LN5CXX, and despite having all the relevant documents required for entry into Canada, we faced numerous challenges and obstacles at the check-in counter.

My sister, S****** Parveen Khan Pathan, holds a Canadian visitor visa and a bridging work permit, as she is currently employed by a multinational company in Canada and has her Permanent Resident (PR) status approved. Similarly, I, T******* Khan Pathan, hold Canadian PR status and also work for a multinational company in Canada. Additionally, my mother, Z****** Khan Pathan, possesses a Canadian visitor visa and is visiting Canada to meet her grandson in Ottawa. Lastly, my brother-in-law, Mohammad Sajid, who recently married my sister, holds a Canadian visitor visa and plans to return to India within the next few months. We had meticulously prepared all the necessary documents as per the requirements of the Canadian government and immigration authorities.

Despite arriving at the Hyderabad airport well in advance, we encountered several issues at the Vistara Airlines counter, which led to a significant delay and ultimately caused us to miss our flight. These issues included:

1) Staff insisting on the necessity of a Qatar visa, despite it not being mandatory for our transit through Doha.
2) Initial assurance of boarding passes only till Munich, with instructions for self-transfer, which was later rescinded due to perceived time constraints. We had a lay over of 5hrs in Munich.
3) Demand for return tickets, contrary to the regulations of IRCC, which we had to reluctantly purchase to avoid missing our flight.
4) Unwillingness to accommodate us on alternative flights, despite the availability of tickets on Air India, citing arbitrary reasons such as the need for wheelchair assistance.
5) Prolonged delays, lack of coordination among staff members, and unprofessional behavior, including making derogatory remarks and inappropriate gestures.
The entire ordeal lasted for over six hours, during which we felt utterly disregarded and humiliated by the conduct of the Vistara Airlines staff, including Mr. Majed, Mr. Shiva, Mr. Satyajit, Mr. Shubham, and Ms. Abiba, who purportedly held managerial authority.
Ms,Abiba,also made gestures to other staff,not to help my mom, an elderly lady, Got her Blood pressure shoot-up waiting at the counters for more than 7hours  just to get a boarding pass with all the required documents
6) Mr. Shiva expresses no concern regarding the company's loss if we cancel the tickets, as he firmly believes that his personal finances remain unaffected regardless of whether the company benefits or suffers.
7)Mr. Majed and Mr. Satyajit appeared lethargic, feigning assistance by suggesting booking tickets with other airlines, yet their actions were limited to idle chatter between themselves, offering no substantial help.

I'm curious whether the company finds value in retaining staff members who exhibit indifference towards the company's financial losses.

I just wonder, aren't they in service industry? Is it justified to make a sign or inappropriate gestures before passengers? How professional is this behaviour? Are the passengers travelling for free?? or is it because they don't have any other option or ?? Why the passengers have to beg for their Boarding???
Isn't it the responsibility of the airlines to check their staffs attitude and behaviour and their knowledge levels.
Who will take the responsibility for the mental harassment and humiliation that we have faced at the Hyderabad Airport Vistara Airlines counter?
This experience not only caused us immense mental distress and inconvenience but also resulted in substantial financial losses, as we had to purchase additional tickets and incurred extra expense of Rs 32,179 per passenger as we had to book last minute tickets due to inefficiency of the Vistara Airlines Staff. We ourselves booked tickets with AirIndia airlines and our experience with Air India was smooth and efficient as they did not ask for any irrelevant documents. Consistency and clarity in the boarding process contribute significantly to customer satisfaction. If vistara airlines could emulate such practices, it would likely enhance the overall experience for passengers.  
 
I urge Vistara Airlines to conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and take appropriate actions to rectify the deficiencies in staff training, customer service, and adherence to regulatory requirements. Furthermore, I request compensation for the financial losses incurred and an apology for the distress caused by the negligent and unprofessional behavior of your staff.

I trust that you will address this matter promptly and provide a satisfactory resolution.

title: Awesome airline! Food portions can be improved on 3+ hours domestic routes
text:
I've been a consistent traveller onboard Vistara both domestically (Hyderabad-Delhi/Kochi-Delhi) and internationally (London/Bangkok-Delhi) over the past 2 years. They definitely stand out in front of the others in the Indian aviation market. Crew is very kind & sweet, the food tastes great. On the London flight — they offered a lot of drinks and food to the passengers. The crew on this London flight was fantastic. They were always available for the passengers and listened to every single request that we made even though it's a long flight. They kept checking through the aisles to see if any passenger requires anything. The cabin was mostly clean. The TV worked fine. Their baggage allowance is great! 10/10 points for that. On-time performance is mostly alright. Sometimes they depart with a delay but reach on-time, somehow. 
Just one complaint: their food portions have gone down significantly in 2023. This is a disappointing aspect. For example: the flight to Kochi from Delhi was 3 hours long and the portion size was too little. I felt very hungry afterwards. On domestic routes - improvement can be done on some aspects. On international - I feel they're doing great & should keep it up. All in all - I don't think twice before traveling with Vistara.

title: Just as bad as Air India used to be
text:
Flew flight UK107, Bombay to Singapore. At the airport was informed I'd been downgraded from P. Economy to Economy since aircraft was overbooked. In this day and age of computers, I was surprised to learn that Vistara staff still use fingers and toes to count available seats!! Anyway, no apology was given at any stage!!  
 
Was also told that I'd be seated in an exit row but must be available to assist cabin crew in case of an emergency. Of course, that meant no relaxing during the flight! Although, given the deplorable standard of the meal served on board, I was unable to really relax anyway, waiting and wondering if I'd need to go to the toilet before the flight landed!

To make matters worse, although the check in person said I would be provided compensation for their stuff up, Vistara's so-called customer service dept didn't want to discuss matters, saying only that I should enter details on the Vistara website to claim compensation.  

And of course, given Vistara's inability to use computers, I wasn't surprised to learn that their website's form also does not work, so my only option now is to contact my credit card company and try to claim that way.

Next time, I'll stick to flying with Singapore Airlines instead of this third-class airline.  I suppose it will be easy for them to merge with Air India since the service standards etc will remain the same, they just have to change the name on the aircraft!

title: Horrific experience
text:
I went for my mother’s funeral.

On return, I came to the gates at 6pm on April 1, 2024 for the 7:30pm flight UK505. It’s April 2, 2024 and I’m still at the airport to board another flight as I’ve never seen such an irresponsible set of staffs.

It was a day when many Vistara flights were delayed or either cancelled.

When they were not onboarding even after 7pm, when we asked the officer at the gate, he informed that the flight is delayed and will take off by 11:30pm. Till we asked, no updates were given by the Vistara staffs. The flight status was showing “on time” and “security” even at 8pm.

The flight arranged dinner for us and by 11:50pm, we were on-boarded to the flight. But the flight didn’t take off even at 12:30am on April 2, 2024.

When checked with the cabin crew, they informed that the captain of the flight parked the flight and went away. Now only first officer is available. And they are waiting for another captain to come and take the flight.

The cabin crew also has been waiting since 6pm on April 1, 2024.

Then the first officer (very helpful and gentle man) informed us that by 1:15am he will inform us the decision of the flight is going or getting cancelled.

By 1:30am we were informed the flight is rescheduled to 5am. When we asked for confirmation that f the flight, they said they cannot confirm until 4am. Only then they can know if any captain can come and fly the plane to Kochi.

So they de-boarded us from the plane and we were sent to the arrival area to reclaim our baggage. In the flight we were informed if we need a refund, it will be done at the arrival. When we reached the arrival, we came to know that no such information is given to the arrival. So we strongly asked for a cancellation and confirmation on f refund. They were not willing to give the confirmation. I said I need the confirmation of refund. Finally the staff at the arrival got a WhatsApp message of my PNR full refund confirmation.

I booked another Indigo flight to Kochi at 10:10am and I’m at the airport since yesterday 6pm.

Just now while typing this message, I got a call from Vistara that the flight which was supposed to leave at 5am did not go yet and now they are ready to fly to Kochi. I asked what was the purpose of the call? They informed me the flight is only left with 6 passengers (it was almost a full flight) and if we are willing, they are ready to take us.

I said no.

Had they properly updated all passengers from time to time, they could have avoided this issue and such a hat-redness towards this airlines.

I was supposed to reach my home at 10:30pm yesterday where my 6 year old and another child had to stay alone at home due to this irresponsible delay. Who will take responsibility of the stress and strain I went through?

title: Bad Crew Behavior
text: We were super excited to travel in Vistara airlines but unfortunately the journey left a bitter taste in my mouth. I will narrate the situation without exaggeration. We didn’t have to wait in lines as we had a toddler and everything was going rather smooth. My daughter who is a toddler still breastfeeds. Nothing wrong in it, but I have to carry her on my lap and still we pay for her seat since she turned 2 as per the rules. So she was fast asleep as soon as we sat on our seats, still breastfeeding. As it was an early morning flight. The crew members started with the procedure and one of them noticed that my daughter is still on my lap. She brings an extra buckle for the safety purpose of my child during takeoff, which is totally understandable. Though it was a first time we were asked to do that. The problem arose when she failed to explain and got impatient. She then asked me if anything happens will i take full responsibility. I solemnly agreed. After a while another crew member comes and asks me to put my daughter in her seat while she is still asleep. Her attitude changed she started commanding rather than asking politely. All this while I wasn’t unwilling to do what they asked. It was a sheer failure on their end as they failed to explain. This second one comes again doesn’t help but acts rude and goes. Now it’s time for takeoff and all 3 crew members come 2 females from earlier and one male. All ambushed me and the second one and the guy were so rude and started accusing me for the flights delay. They said flight will not takeoff you have to fasten the seatbelt. The guy especially was angry and was extremely impolite, I kept saying please explain it to me. Then they very rudely asked me to unfasten my belt and put it over my daughter. I obliged and then the first one interrupts and asks them to stop forcing me. I was obviously furious, I said if it wasn’t an issue why did you bother me. They left and after a while the first one comes and kind of apologises without a sorry for the misunderstanding. Others didn’t even bother to make an effort. I wasn’t some drunk guy who was being difficult. I was a mother of a toddler whose safety is my top most priority. They had some sort of miscommunication about my situation. All through the flight I noticed that they were all newbies. It was a failure on their part but somehow I was the who was humiliated and had by far the worst journey as a new mom. Please train your crew members well. The free meal definitely doesn’t make up for the harassment.

title: Totally ignoring the customer
text:
I purchased tickets from Munich to Colombo for five people. In Munich, we checked in three suitcases for our entire family of five.
Upon arrival in Colombo, Sri Lanka on 15 February 2024, it was discovered that not a single piece of luggage had been delivered. Two of the three suitcases were delivered to us after five days on February 20. The third suitcase was not delivered. On departure from Colombo on March 4th, I was informed at the Vistara counter that the suitcase was not found.
While in Sri Lanka, they ignored all the emails sent asking about the luggage. The phone line is impossible to call.

On the way back from Colombo to Munich, one of the three backpacks was not delivered again. Fortunately, they brought it home to us after a few days. However, the original baggage checked in on the way there remains lost.

The airline does not respond at all to emails sent requesting compensation. Finally, they wrote yesterday:
With reference to your email, we would like to inform you that as per the investigation the baggage was delivered to you. Hence, we are unable to assist you further. We again apologize for the delay of the baggage.

Incredibly.

title: Dated cramped airline
text:
One of the most noticeable drawbacks of my Vistara experience was the lack of space. The seating arrangement felt cramped, with limited legroom that made it difficult to find a comfortable position, especially during long-haul flights. This lack of space significantly detracted from the overall comfort of the journey, leaving passengers feeling constrained and restless.

Adding to the discomfort was the absence of charging outlets. In an age where connectivity is paramount, the inability to charge electronic devices such as smartphones and laptops during the flight was a significant inconvenience. With no means to power our devices, passengers were left with dwindling battery levels, unable to work, watch movies, or stay connected with loved ones throughout the journey.

Furthermore, the entertainment screens onboard appeared outdated and poorly maintained. The display quality was subpar, with pixelation and flickering making it challenging to enjoy the available content. Coupled with limited entertainment options, including a lack of recent movies or TV shows, the overall in-flight entertainment experience fell short of expectations.

Despite these shortcomings, it's worth noting that the cabin crew maintained their professionalism and provided excellent service throughout the flight.

title: Never fly again with Vistara
text:
Only negative experience with flights with Vistara. Indian staff in Mumbai the worst between all airlines which I used.

1.	Our flight was from Frankfurt by Mumbai to Colombo (and return). In way to Mumbai connection was relatively short (3h) and Vistara staff informed us that I don’t need to go to immigration (stay in transit) and is not necessary start execution of my Visa promise (ETA) which was valid to day of arrive to Mumbai.
2.	After 2 weeks when we returned immigration office didn’t allowed us to leave the airport (connection was long – above 24 hours and Vistara not  secured transit hotel). When Vistara staff was called from Imigration to offer service for customers (we were not only one Passengers form Vistara with this same problem) staff of Vistara wanted to send us again to transit are promised us to arrange transit hotel, to organize meal, water etc. But procedure which used was clever, every 100-200 meters they sent us to another person, and last one – before secure control promised that up stairs will wait another Vistara representative who will help us….. Upstairs was duty free area without any Vistara office/ desk. Without also possibility to return....
3.	We were left in the lurch and we lost our hotel reservation in Mumbai – without any Vistara help, without any compensation. Only with negative experience with the worst, lying staff of airlines which we met in our live (and we travel quite a lot – more than 10 flights yearly)

Conclusion: if are any problems not expect help and support from Vistara staff – one thing you can count on is deception and lies. In attachment you can see pictures of Vistara staff – unfortunately nobody from their wanted to show names or identificators. 

4.	And at the end: our luggage didn’t arrive from Mumbai and we got it only thanks  Lufthansa support after 10 days.

5.	Additional comment from experience with Vistara: The meal on board in economy class maybe in teste is not bad but visually resembles vomiting, what not encourage eating….

Our recommendation is: not use Vistara, is a high-risk, negative experience and losing money, stress, nerves….. Don’t suggest also that Vistara has good shareholders – it not influenced for quality of Vistara services.

To Vistara – please not comment below my post with texts: that you sorry etc, because you were not able to answer for my official complaint during more than 10 days.

title: Pathetic experience - no ethics and values.
text:
Our flight got delayed by ~7 hr! I had 2 senior citizens and one toddler with me. We spent more than 10 hrs on airport. 
What airline offered -
- No upfront communication for this delay. They wanted to surprise us after reaching the airport.
- Basic need, food was not offered for passengers stranded at airport for ~10 hrs. 
- No lounge access, I was expecting this for atleast senior citizens.
- We requested separate seat for toddler, it was agreed at the checkin but did not happened in aircraft though they had many seats empty! After 10 hrs at airport we had to manage kid on our lap for next 6 hrs journey. Not sure what was costing them here? 
- They did not carry choclates, small juice packs for kids. If you know you have kids in plane then why can't we carry these basic things? 
- Any seat upgrades for seniors - may be i am expecting too much! 

When I had email exchange with airline customer care, I receive response mentioning this is not our fault so we cannot provide any compensation or any reimbursement. That time I understand that its all my fault of selecting airline! 
Customer care has standard reply; and for every email they just copy-paste the same, they do not understand what is the issue and what has happened on ground. In summary message will say - sorry for inconvience caused and we expect you to give another opportunity to serve again!! 
Customer care - 0 / 10
Senior citizen management - 0 / 10
Value of customer time - 0 / 10
In flight facilities - 2 /10 
Kids friendly staff/facilities - 0 / 10 
Ethics/responsibility of such miss managemnt - 0 /10

title: Verbally and Physically abused on the flight. No help from Vistara
text:
Where do I start- Woke up to the app telling me the flight was cancelled. Tried calling Vistara but offices are closed on weekend, tried to tweet them, dm on Instagram, email but no one replied. It just so happened the flight was not cancelled but infact it was delayed. Which is fine. 

Turn up to the airport at the normal check-in time and it is CHAOS and no staff there to guide or assist. All other international airlines also have separate priority queues for those traveling with children etc but not Vistara. They are far from family friendly. The entire check-in process reminded me of travelling to India back in the days when I was around 5 years old. Just utter chaos, no organisation, no staff available to assist. 

Finally make it through security and flight is delayed over an hour, spoke to someone with regards to food vouchers etc- Food vouchers/Compensation not available 

Boarding- again utterly chaotic- They announced elderly, wheelchair users etc and everyone RUNS to the gate to board blocking the way for those who genuinely need the priority boarding like the elderly/wheelchair users. And Vistara ground staff do absolutely NOTHING to stop that from happening and let everyone else board without following their own rules with the boarding process 

Flight- Awful. Not only did we depart nearly 2 hours after the scheduled departure but they ran out of vegeterian food- even though I had preordered vegeterian food, the air hostess just said "sorry, we have no veg option left, only non veg" To which I told her. I preordered veg as I am veg, surely you should give the veg food to those who preordered it to begin with before handing it out to everyone else who has a choice?

No usual drinks service etc- just a half cup with your meal and that's it- Could possibly be due to it being a red eye flight and departing so late- they just wanted to get the meals sorted and turn of the lights to allow passengers to sleep? Regardless, found it strange how drinks trolley was not available during the flight 

Call bell- pretty useless feature as no one comes when you call a flight attnedant- I was travelling alone with my child so I didn't want to leave him alone looking for an attendant due to the abusive passengers behind me 

I had an altercation with two male passengers sitting behind me. Firstly I tried to recline my sons seat and the passenger sat behind him pushed the chair back and started laughing at me, again I reclined his seat and he started muttering under his breath. I then went to recline my seat and the man behind me started pushing my seat aggressively, called me a "f****ng b***ch and started shouting at me telling me not to recline my seat. I politely explained I am allowed to recline my seat and if he has an issue he needs to speak to the airhostess. I will not be moving my seat back. The man started getting really angry, shouting and being verbally abusive and physically shaking my chair- No air steward came to diffuse the situation, other passengers were just staring, recording the altercation on their phone and eventually as it seemed things were escalating another passenger took it upon themself to try and diffuse the situation but NO AIR STEWARD TO BE SEEN even though some other passengers did even press the call bell. I spent the remaining 8 hours of the flight having to endure this awful two men constantly shake our chairs, kick them and repeatedly call me a "b***ch* etc all because I tried to recline my seat. 

Absoultely horrific experience and I would NOT book Vistara again. I have reported this to the police and I will be pressing charges against them and also Vistara for their lack of support

title: Discrimination towards passengers with kids
text:
To begin with, I made a booking via Booking.com in October to make sure everything will go smoothly because I was travelling with my wife and one year son for first time. It was our first time with our child so we wanted to make sure we got everything right. I immediately called Vistara customer service in UK after booking my flight to secure the seats in front row that we have some space for our child and we can get a bassinet. I was told that front row seats are blocked by head office and they do not issue to anyone and we need to go to the airport very early and request if we can get the seats. I still tried in January to find out if we can get seats. I was told the same thing. I was frustrated and I asked to have the seats together and I paid for the seats to be together. 

When we were flying from London Heathrow to Delhi, there was huge delay due to weather and air space taken over by Indian air force not sure if it is true. Our aircraft was taken to Amritsar and we sat inside the plane waiting to return to Delhi. After two hours, we flew back to Delhi. By this time our connecting flight to Amritsar was already departed. Upon contacting ground staff of Vistara, the manager rudely responded that there is no flight even tomorrow and we should take Indo Canadian bus to Amritsar with our own expense and he told me Vistara will refund for this flight. There was no apology for this inconvenience which was not our fault. 
I was really tired and frustrated. I had to stay in Hotel spending 5000INR for a night and further 10000INR for a taxi to my place in Punjab. It is all because of mismanagement by Vistara. I found out later that there were flights everyday and we could have travelled next day but your staff were not bothered to help. 

Anyways, I wanted to make sure my return flight is ok and wanted to know if we can get front seats. I called customer service and I asked about the seats. The lady on the phone, told me that those seats are already booked for people with the kids. I asked for middle isle seats but the lady told me that Vistara do not allow any other seats than window seats because they do not want their other customer to feel discomfort due to babies. This was really outrageous and it is a discrimination towards the passengers with kids. 

During the flight, the staff were not helpful at all. I went to the pantry to get some hot water for baby's milk and both of the crew rolled their eyes and were really unhappy because I bothered them. I did not want to make a fuss and create a scene at that time because I was with family. We spoke with other families with kids and they were told similar things. 

I have been travelling via air since 2009 and I never had this kind of experience. I am very upset with this experience and i wish i could get over with this because i really had hard time with my kid because of vistara staff behaviour.

title: Unresolved Baggage Delay for the last 23 days.
text:
Unresolved Baggage Delay for the last 24 days: A Tale of Frustration with VISTARA Airways.

THIS IS WORST EVER EXPERIENCE WITH VISTARA AIRWAYS.

I am sharing a frustrating saga  of delayed baggage with VISTARA Airways. On January 2nd, I arrived at Frankfurt Airport (FRA), and eagerly wanted to return to my home and relax. Little did I know that the next 24 days would become a harrowing experience of unanswered calls, unfulfilled promises, and two missing bags.

I have diligently followed the recommended procedures to resolve this matter:
1. I have filed a property missing report at the FRA airport.
2. I reported the missing baggage through VISTARA customer care complaint system.
3. Contacted VISTARA customer care team in INDIA via telephone few times. Each time it took 40-45 minutes of international calling.
4. The customer care number from Germany has never picked up by customer relation team.
5. Messaged on VISTARA Instgram account.
6. Sales team from VISTARA Germany refused to support me on this case and asked to call to Indian customer care number.

Despite my efforts, I have received answer to "wait for more time" each time I have communicated with VISTARA customer relations department.

This extended delay has caused considerable inconvenience and frustration. Beyond the obvious inconvenience of not having my belongings, I have incurred additional expenses due to the necessity of purchasing essential items during this period.

The lack of resolution and communication has deeply disappointed me. The purpose of this blog is not only to express my dissatisfaction but also to request urgent action to locate and deliver my missing baggage.

VISTARA Customer relation team is giving useless and hopeless impression each time when they answer. They do not answer other than WAIT FOR MORE TIME.

Considering the prolonged delay and the impact on my travel experience, I believe it is fair to request compensation for the additional expenses and the inconvenience caused since last 23 days. I trust that VISTARA Airways values customer satisfaction and will take prompt action to resolve this matter to my satisfaction.

I would appreciate a thorough investigation into this issue and a timely response outlining the steps being taken to locate and deliver my missing bags. I look forward to a swift and satisfactory resolution.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I anticipate your prompt response and assistance in resolving this situation.

I am making it clear that my intention is not to smear the airline's reputation but to bring attention to the urgent need for resolution and compensation.

VISTARA Customer relation team is UNSUPPORTIVE. They do not answer other than WAIT FOR MORE TIME.

Thank you for reading this post.

Annasaheb Magdum

title: Worst Worst Worst!!!
text:
This is in reference to the flight booking I’ve made through booking.com. It has been a nightmare to get a date change which I am trying since last 3 days. I have made several calls  to get my date change and everytime getting the same response from “Go To Gate” - Booking.com's partner that their system is down or their back office has the request  and they shall call me back. 

Three days ago when I called them to change the booking they quoted me the price of £350 ( quoted by Manuel) to which I did not have authority and had to take the authorisation from my company, so I declined for the moment, meanwhile I tried to get the authorisation. I called them back within 2 hours to get the date change at the same rate to which they kept responding they are not getting fares from airlines  and someone from back office support will call you.

I tried calling the next day but they kept mentioning their is a technical error and airlines is still not responding to their request. I kept calling the whole day talking to different agents and one of them (Mayur) gave me the fare difference of £590. I asked him to please speak to Manuel as he was the one holding the fare for me. I still kept calling and they had no solution for me.

Yesterday morning when I called them, they quoted a price of £1100, which is exorbitant. I was suggested by previous rep that they can release the booking from their end so airlines will have the authority to make changes. They asked me to call Vistara and check OSI remarks that the booking has been released from booking.com and now Vistara can make changes to it.

I, at the moment, am feeling helpless, annoyed and cheated. I booked business class thinking I will get better customer services and better response from both booking.com and Vistara. I do not want to be a part of who can handle the booking, I think Vistara should choose their partners wisely, customers and specially business class customers should not suffer because of the differences between Vistara and their partners and their incompetence. 

To make things difficult - Vistara is blaming boking.com and booking.com is passing the blame back to Vistara. Without even thinking what the customer wants. I am stuck in catfight between two companies.

title: Call centre woes ...Stranded in Delhi
text: The call centre is a joke. It's finally given up the ghost. You now get a message that "the person you are calling is not answering". 😊When you do get through, the queuing system informs you that you are number 5 and the estimated wait time is one minute...20 minutes later you get a person. Who in turn does not have a clue, says that a booking has been made in place of a cancelled flight, is there anything else I can do for you today? An hour later no confirmation. Ground staff says, Sir you should have noted down the PNR number before ending the call. So now I wait in queue (for 20 minutes) and ask for a refund. No problem Sir, it will be processed she says. Still no intimation that has happened..... Yesterday there was heavy fog in Delhi and flights were being delayed and then cancelled. Vistara demonstrated that their underlying processes and operator training have many gaps that contribute to passengers getting stranded as I was yesterday. Eventually I never did take my first flight with Vistara. BTW the website is glitchy too.

title: Stuck at Delhi airport for all day

A flight which was supposed to leave at 17h30, then rescheduled to 19h, then to 20h and for now, at almost 22h. It's been 17h since I left from Paris and I've spent same amount of time at the Delhi airport as flying all the way from Europe.
There's no email or text message for updates and I can only find out about things getting up to look at the screens (since the internet available at the airport has limited time).
First and last time

title: Great customer care and highly recommend
text: I am a Sri Lankan scientist who has worked in Japan and Sweden for more than a decade. We traveled from Sweden to Sri Lanka on December 31st with my family, transiting from Germany to Mumbai via Vistara. The ground and cabin crews provided exceptional customer service. Though there was a delay at clearance, they kindly assisted us in various ways at the last minute. The flight was very comfortable despite being in economy class. This was my first time using Vistara airline after decades of traveling. I'll definitely choose to travel with them again and highly recommend them to anyone.

title: International sectors are avoidable
text:
Took 2 return flights on Vistara in the same week on International sectors. Aircraft was A321 and flights were to and from DXB & SIN. Flew economy and the experience was very average. 
Inspite of having flown >30 flights on UK in the last 9 months and requests for upgrade, it didnt work. Had expected it based on the checkin staff’s assurance. 
Thats fine as this would have only been a bonus to a frequent flier. 
What surprised me was the food served. Had i chosen an alternate airline - EK to DXB or SQ to SIN, my dining experience would have been of a different level even in Economy. 
Clear now to avoid UK on International sectors till they play catch up to their big brothers.

title: What a great airline!

title: Terrible travel experience with Vistara Airlines
text:
Excited for the trip to Dubai with my parents who are in the 90 years plus range. Thought we had all instructions in the Vistara System about Wheelchair assistance for both of them...wrong!
Once dropped off at Airport...no sign of any Wheelchair assistance and had to walk both aged parents near the check in counter and insist that they provide wheelchairs....got 2 wheel chairs...checked in and then we were set aside  and had to wait another 30-40 minutes (after constant insistence) before a person was assigned to wheel both of them through Immigration and customs...this went smoothly and were dropped off at the gate and advised that before boarding we would have someone come and deliver us to the gate of the aircraft.
Boarding was "chaotic"...no special privilege (priority boarding due to premium economy) given to "handicap persons or people requiring additional time to board......IN FACT, my repeated requests to the gate staff to get persons to push the wheel chair went "un heeded" and until I "physically" made my parents walk (carrying my carry on items) to the gate and get 
serious" with the ground crew....that finally 2 members show up with wheel chairs to take my parents down to the gate of the aircraft!!.
Entered aircraft with some flight attendant assistance and landed in Dubai where there were 2 wheelchairs waiting...this procedure went smoothly!
Come, return to India time, I found general airport customer service and insisted they provide 2 wheel chairs...they finally obliged even though VISTARA had not informed them.
Checked in and insisted 2 wheel chairs which we got and went through Immigration and Customs without a hitch...we were dropped off at the gate and informed that someone would be there about 15 minutes prior to boarding to take us to the aircraft.
Come Boarding time....."CHAOTIC AGAIN"...absolute lack of control by "gate staff to organize boarding process"...they shold have again given priority to handicap and people travelling with children.
MOST IMPORTANT - I requested about 20 minutes prior to boarding time to gate staff to request 2 persons for wheel chair assitance...they assured me we would be taken care of....GUESS WHAT...same old issues....nobody showed up!!!
Finally, I got stern with them and then 2 persons showed up and finally took us to the aircraft.

We landed in India...and (NO fault of airline) did not get a chute to exit through....we were "luckily" assigned a ramp which made it a little easier to exit aircraft (otherwise I am unsure how this would have played out since my Mom especially has difficulty with stairs).
Anyway, we got the wheelchair in the bus through a ramp...and found out later (i was on the opposite end of the bus) that the wheelchair assistance had left my MOM standing and taken the wheelchair off the bus???
Through the "valued" help of fellow passengers we were finally able to get her off with difficulty and make her walk inside the terminal where 2 wheel chairs were waiting...question is why did they not come to the bus so that my parents (especially Mom) would not have to walk the distance?

Looks like there is "no compassion" for persons with handicap by Vistara....and this is an airline owned by Singapore Air....What a difference in service levels!!!
VISTARA was given detailed instructions at the time of booing about special assistance...but, their "CARELESS/COMPASSIONLESS ATTITUDE" definately sets them apart from the foreign carriers who towards customer service!

Maybe, we are not important or just part of the few Citizens who  may not make a significant difference as to how any review would affect such a large airline...but, not speaking up...would be even worse!!

I feel strongly that a lot of their (VISTARA) customers get treated "indifferently...especially people who are aged and have handicaps" and probably accept the this as a fact of life...but, I am hoping that VISTARA takes this as an opportunity to improve their Customer Service levels and train ground staff to enact discipline in the way they do business.

VISTARA Booking code SJWO9H
I will be spreading the word
Thank you
Fazal

title: Baggage allowance discrepancy with international flights
text:
I would like to take opportunity to submit review regarding vistara airline customer representative working at Ahmedabad airport/domestic terminal.
This is genuine concern for each and every passenger who is taking international connections. 

I genuinely feel that every customer who is taking connecting flights while travelling internationally should think twice before getting their connection through vistara airline. 
I was travelling from India to Canada and our tickets were booked through KLM in around mid December. 
When we were returning from India our first flight was operated through vistara airline and that was from Ahmedabad to Mumbai and then onwards we had connections though KLM

The reason behind giving this review is to make operational management aware that their customer representatives should respect  customers. 
First of all we all should have humanity. I felt at Ahmedabad airport the agent who was helping us ( Named Rubina Mansoori) she said as per their airline policies they only allow 7kg per hand baggage and there is no kids policy which is different than adults. 

I completely don’t understand why she should have said that. Our destination flight was through KLM and final destination was to Canada, so our baggage was prepared as per what was outlined in KLM which was as follows 
I was travelling with my 6 months old infant and my husband. 
Baggage allowance per adult as per KLM 
- 2 x 23 kg check in baggage 
- 1x carry on - maximum 12 kg 
- 1 personal team 
Baggage Allowance for infants as per KLM 
- 1x 10 kg check in baggage 
- 1x 12 kg carry on including baby care item

The agent at Ahmedabad who was working should have thought that the baggage was packed as per international/ inter continental travel and should have allowed us to keep it as it is, but she rather asked us to take 4 kya off of each hand bag and make infant’s 12 kg carry on luggage as 23 kg bag that has messed up everything as we had to
Check that in which had all baby care items which has compromised my infants routine while travelling and he was fussy quite often. The agent is 100% responsible for this. 
She was extremely rude while she was speaking to my husband and was having very stubborn attitude that she asked my husband that all carry on baggage which are weighing more than 7 kg should go in my kids 10 kg bag and make it 23 kg so we don’t have to pay extra!!!!!
Seriously first of all why we should pay extra when we have already paid our travelling expenses. 
We had to hurry ourselves and opened up 3 of the carry on luggage which were obviously weighing around 10-12 kg as per the international flight allowance. And the 10 kg bag which was not even big enough we had to put our stuff very carefully in the small bag and we were under extreme pressure and stress as our baby was being very cracky and agitated while we were waiting for the agent to figure out what she needs to do. When she is allowing us to take all the weights anyway what is the point of moving weights around in the baggage 
Please review KLM baggage allowance and make sure to follow same standards when allowing passengers to take domestic connections to KLM. 
People can not and would not be comfortable to open up their bags in front of everyone at the airport and specially when they are just taking their domestic flight for one hour just because your domestic rules are different! 
There was no common sense here! 
The heights were when she decided to tell us go to the side and make proper arrangements as per what she was telling in very bossy manner! She started helping next customer meanwhile. 

We didn’t have choice but follow what she said but why do they have such attitude at first place , I think they should have very polite conversation with all customers as we were not there to annoy them and it was not our fault that we had that many baggage because that exactly what we brought so we need to take it back ! Why would pay extra just because our domestic connection was operated by Vistara and just that silly agent was not understanding how the international connection works 

Humble request to management: please consider the baggage allowance as per the international standard and travelling airline. People would not pay extra when the they have already paid for their tickets. 

Another request please hire competent staff who can think critically and analyze the situation. 
This agent was smiling while talking, I do not understand what was so funny, someone from night authority should consider talk to her and let her know what kind of attitude she should carry while taking care of travellers at the airport. 
Have some respect and understand the situation rather being annoying and stubborn. 
Please be accommodating 

Please please don’t just book your connection through Vistara or be ready for consequences. 

I would appreciate a follow up from the team 

Thanking in advance!

title: Worst customer support and website portal/app
text:
This is the 3/4th time I’m flying Vistara and each time I attempt to upgrade the app/website accepts my card(tried multiple cards) but then the site/app throws and error with my money still deducted. This has happened quite a few times & I thought it was a one off thing but then figured the same thing can’t keep happening over and over again. My friends also have had the same experience. 

When you request customer support to help with the upgrade, there is a price difference of over 5k INR!?!? This clearly looks like some kind of scam going on wherein you’ll want the customer to directly contact you’ll for an upgrade so that you’ll can get the extra money!! If you’ll can’t fix your site, don’t send out upgrade emails to your customers! 

Apart from this, I’ve contacted customer support a few times and I’ve spoken to Puja & Nitin and both of them have placed me on hold multiple times (calls were around 25 and 28 mins) without a proper resolution. You need to learn to respect your customers time and if you can’t resolve an issue on time, just call back when you have a resolution! Both the times, I asked a callback from the supervisor as it looks like their supervisors(Nisha) don’t have the time to come online when customers call and then callback after hours! 

This review is a warning to any future customers to avoid using their scam upgrade tricks and just stick to your original booking or even better choose another airline that knows to respect their customers time and money!

title: Vistara Dows Not Care About Lost Bag
text:
I took Vistara flight from Delhi to Mumbai on 9th Dec at 12:45pm UK 993 flight reaching Mumbai at 15:00hours. PNR no W3C7UF
I checked in one bag. At the time of boarding, I was told that they held the bag due to finding power bank in there and made him sign a paper authorizing to open the bag and remove power bank and ship the bag. The bag did not make it to Mumbai. It took me 2 hours to find any representative from Vistara to file this lost bag complaint. As I have all my medicines in that bag along with all his travel needs, I continue to request Vistara customer service and ground staff to help me get this bag. They first promised that the bag will come in the later flight on the same day. It did not come. Then I was promised that everything is clear and the bag will be on board the first flight in the morning. It did not come. Even now Vistara says that they are not getting any information from the Delhi airport. 
As I am traveling further to other cities, there seems to be no one in Vistara who has taken up this case seriously. 
I  kept requesting to connect me to the manager on duty but the manager does not come on the call. 
Is this how Vistara experience is? Has others also experienced the same from Vistara and delhi Airport?
I am evaluating other options but I wanted to let people know about this experience from Vistara and hope their management takes a note of this and correct and get me my bag. Even in the same country of India…

title: Making false promises on bassinets
text:
Before booking the flight, I called customer care and asked whether we would be availaved with the bassinet or not and we were informed that the bassinet seats are given to the parents on a first come first serve basis. Once check-in was enabled we were assigned with default seats and they were not next to the bassinet so we called the customer care again to confirm. We were instructed by the customer care person to not change the default allocated seats and asked us to reach 4 hours before departure time to the airport as bassinet seats can only be assigned to parents at the airport while boarding. So we did as instructed and reached Paris airport before 4 hours departure but to our surprise all the bassinet seats were already sold out. As per ground staff there are 2 bassinets in economy out of which one bassinet is taken by a parent and other seat next to bassinet is assigned to a lady travelling alone. Ground staff assured us that they will make a request to the lady and ask her to swap the seat with one of us so we can have the bassinet for our daughter. When boarding was about to start(same ground staff present who said they will make the request) we reminded again to the staff but as per them the lady was still not there so we were again asked to go ahead and they will make a request once she board the flight and we again trusted them. Now once we boarded the flight , the crew in flight said they can not request someone to give their seats to us and it's no longer possible to have the bassinet seat.
The best thing we found in this entire scenario is that none of the bassinet seats were assigned to parents. All those seats were sold to individuals(we were lied by the ground staff saying that its given to a parent but all three person sitting were individuals and not even travelling together as a family) who paid for extra leg space so my question is why are those seats called bassinet seats at all and you even say it to parents that those seats are designed for parents travelling with kids and can be only given to the parents on first come first basis when this is not at all followed by your staff or your system anywhere? We requested multiple times from the customer care to let us choose those seats beforehand and we were even ready to pay for the charge also? I can not explain the trauma my wife and my daughter have gone through because of this. My daughter is just 5 months old and she was travelling for the first time and it was an 8 hours long journey. We called and requested Vistara staff a lot of times just to confirm about the process of bassinet seats. Even after doing this much followup a simple thing can not be done by your staff then am not sure how you are operating this big airline. We would have happily travelled with our daughter without bassinet if those seats were given to other parents with higher needs but those seats were assigned to individuals with no kids while others were just struggling with their kids.

title: Review of Vistara Airlines Flight from DED to DEL: Delay, Chaos, and Boarding Challenges
text:
My experience with Vistara Airlines on a flight from DED to DEL was rather disappointing. The flight was notably delayed, and what frustrated me more was the lack of timely announcements. Passengers were left in the dark about the delay, creating confusion and frustration at the boarding gate.

The boarding process itself was chaotic, with the airline staff seemingly indifferent to the disarray. This lack of organization further amplified the inconvenience for passengers. Instead of using a ramp for boarding, only stairs were attached to the airplane, posing challenges for senior citizens and anyone with mobility issues.

The choice to forego a ramp for boarding seemed impractical and insensitive to the diverse needs of passengers. The airline staff's apparent enjoyment of the chaos at the boarding gate added to the overall negative impression. While I understand that delays can happen, clear communication and a more considerate approach to passenger needs would have significantly improved the overall experience. Vistara Airlines has room for improvement in ensuring timely and transparent communication, as well as a more organized and passenger-friendly boarding process.

title: Premium Economy: premium seats, budget food, charter flight entertainment
text:
I flew with Vistara, an airline I had never heard of before, from LHR to Chandigarh via Delhi on business.  The premium economy cabin was only 15 PAX and the seats were excellent, comfortable with heaps of legroom.  The service was friendly and attentive, but...

My G&T was served in a cardboard coffee cup, the meals were very poor quality and worse than most long-haul economy carriers, and the entertainment was Dickensian.  The Hollywood movies all seemed to be 10-20 years old, with a very limited selection, and the earphones were cheap and nasty disposable items which meant I could hardly hear the movie over the roar of the engines.

In the end, I worked the whole flight out and back, and the seat had power for my MacBook.  I gave up on the inedible meals and stuck with drinks in cardboard cups and nibbles.  I guess if you took your own sandwiches, and noise-cancelling headphones with preloaded movies on your laptop, it would be fine.  But the seat apart, it would be much more pleasant and much, much cheaper with Qatar or Emirates in economy.

title: Amazing, but needs some minor tightening of services
text: This is the best airlines in the whole world. I have travelled a lot, and India should be proud of a service like Vistara, which is par excellence in comparison to many international flights which offer cheap economy services. Honestly, I'd choose Vistara over ANY airlines, for any journey (long or short) - because of the inflight experience, and I hope they continue to maintain this quality. The food is fresh, light, yummy, tasty. Flight/cabin crew is quick, efficient, attentive. The legroom is average/decent (depending on the class you take but I never felt any discomfort). There's inflight entertainment and games on your screen even on a domestic flight - what more can you ask for? Bathrooms are clean and really well designed. I only think that adding some more punctuality and being more proactive about providing more information in advance about the flight more clearly would make Vistara even more competitive and desirable. They should focus on doing such things, such as sending the gate number for boarding to the passenger's mobile number an hour earlier if the passenger has web-checked-in more than 24 hours ago when the gate number was unknown. I had already checked in online and could not find the gate number at the airport because it was not on my eboarding pass, which made me quite late to board the flight, and that was the only thing that turned into a harrowing experience. But in general, I love Vistara and I will always fly Vistara!

title: good airline, some short comings
text:
my wife and i flew recently on UK-105 from Bom to Singapore. 
The flight is at 1 am and lands local time Singapore 9.25 am.we flew business class, seat 3D.the seats were excellent(full flat is which is awesome for a single aisle aircraft) as was the service.however i must point out 2 salient short comings.
Being served a full dinner at 2 am , made little sense. of 12 passengers in business class only 2 opted to eat., most wished to be undisturbed and preferred to sleep.it would make far greater sense to serve breakfast on this flight at approx 8 am singapore time about 1.5 hrs before landing. most people would have had dinner at home or at the lounge/ airport prior to boarding so having a dinner served at 2 am was superfluous and pointless.
Also no amenities were offered .. no vanity kit.as everyone was asleep and since flight arrived in mid-morning, eye masks and toothbrush kit would be greatly appreciated.to be called india's leading airline i think these 2 matters must be looked into asap.

title: Vistara a new experience

The flight were comfortable and was a welcome change from the budget airline era. There was a choice of food, veg and non veg as well as  drinks with  steel cutlery and Starbucks coffee in the premium economy. Although there was no screen, Vistara has their own Vistara world entertainment system which we could log in using mobile or tablet. The sound  in Vistara world entertainment was good if you use your own ear phones. And they had special contraption where we could place the mobile to be at your eye level. Also a charging port for mobile with sufficient speed. Although it was my first trip in Vistara, I am glad that Vistara upgraded me to premium economy on two of the flights.
