title: Treat Indians like 2nd class citizens.
text:
I have recently flown from chennai to Mumbai to London. Below is my experience which I would like to share.

Check in experience at Chennai- The ground staff had very cold and robotic experiences when I or others fellow Indian were doing check In. Constantly checking my passport and visa, I lived in UK for more than 15 years but she was still asking me questions like it’s my first time going abroad. Next to me there was a foreigner he was greeted like a VIP and they were asking him about how was his experience in India and we value our culture and hospitality. 

After lending to the Mumbai I did my security and immigration (they were very nice and polite knew what they were looking for and cleared me in minutes).

Boarding experience - After the announcement we all started getting in the line for the boarding. Now one of the staff started to check passports and he segregates all the Indian passport holders to other line. Now we see UK passport holders to get in to the plane while we standing in other line to wait our passport and visa checked again. They started questioning why I am going to UK, where is the Visa, what type of visa is this (they had very lack of knowledge about types of visas it took me 15 min to make them understand the type of visa I had) they were behaving like an immigration officer, while we see foreigners going into the plane like VIP’s.

In flight experience- Again you can clearly see how less interested they are serving to us than comparing to the foreigners.  No interaction with us but asking foreigners if they need anything and serving them like they have paid extra than me.

In my front seat there were two foreigners. They were constantly getting things and getting well looked after. In whole duration I had to ask 3 times to just get a water and at the end she gave it to me like I am a bagger. 

After lending as we go out of plane we normally thanks cabin crew for the hospitality. As they were very chatty with foreigners but when I said thanks they gave me looks like I am an eve teaser.

I have only two thoughts here 

1 why airline staff behave like immigration officers while we already got cleared by Indian government officers, are they not credible enough?

2 if we don’t respect our own citizens then we will not get respect in others countries, they will take this behaviour as guidelines.

title: Tickects got cancelled while managing my booking
text:
I was managing booking (fra -ktm), I got the email at the same time saying my tickets (4 round tickets) got cancelled. I have no clue how!! There were no questions, consents or confirmations asked to be made. I just got email saying 680 euros will be deducted for cancellation, I'm struck in awe right now. I called customer care service in India, saying there might have been a mistake and they said, "this is how the system works". This all happened within like 24 -25 hrs from the ticket purchase. My argument here is there were all together 8 tickets considering its a round trip. What kind of system is that, it allows this blunder to happen, without asking if all purchases are to be cancelled or without asking which tickets to be cancelled or which dates to be cancelled. 

So your tickets can be cancelled without consent and confirmation or even with blunder and you have to pay hefty price for it. Having run international flights you have to keep your system in international standards or else it will look like organised scam. 

P.S. I didn't intend to cancel these tickets.

title: TERRIFYING EVENT
text:
The worst experience I've ever had.
We flew with Vistar from AUH to MAA Airport through BOM Airport, we flew with Vistara. 

Chapter 1: Alternate Boarding Terminal
===========================================================
Bitter experience began at the airport of origin, Abu Dhabi airport. E-boarding pass instructed to board at terminal 1. 
We called Vistara's customer service line and double-checked which terminal to go to. They will undoubtedly arrive at terminal 1. 
However, after we got to the airport, check-in had been moved from terminal 1 to terminal 3. With little children, our entire family had to sprint from airport 1 to terminal 3. The staff explained that they switched from terminal 1 to terminal 3 due to a shortage of check-in belts. 

Once check-in was finished once more, we were instructed to go to Gate 9 in Terminal 1.

30 minutes prior to departure, gate 9 was switched to gate 10. To announce this, none of the Vistara staff arrived at gate number 9.  

Chapter 2: Landing delay 
===========================

The flight arrived at the Mumbai airport after a 40-minute delay. Within two hours, we had a connecting flight from BOM to MAA. 
We had to race to the immigration checkpoint, grab our luggage, and drop it off at the domestic check-in booths in under 40 minutes.
The Vistara workers instructed us to leave our luggage trolleys at the domestic check-in kiosks and they would take care of loading them. 
Trusting them, we left our bags there.

Due to the fact that there were barely 15 minutes remaining before takeoff, vistara employees ordered us to board the aircraft. 

Chapter 3: Sarp Drop 
============================

In spite of the severe weather, the airplane took off from Mumbai. Due to turbulence, the flight experienced a fast descent from a high altitude once it had risen to about 1500 feet. Everyone on board began to scream, acting as though the plane was about to crash. 
We had no hope that we would land in one piece till we got to MAA airport. 

Chapter 4 :Discrepancy in luggage
=========================================================================

By the grace of God, we arrived at the MAA airport and proceeded to the luggage belts to retrieve our belongings. Few travelers had retrieved their bags. After waiting for more than 40 minutes, our baggage were nowhere to be seen. The luggage of nearly 20 families was not transported from BOM to MAA. 

We went to the missing baggage counter, but the clerk had no idea whether the luggage was still secure at the BOM airport. 
After an hour, they took our information and the complaint, but they did not provide a complaint reference number before asking us to go. They informed us that it would take more than two hours to establish a TIR number when we asked for a reference number.

We had no choice but to depart for the airport. MAA airport is 350 kilometers from our hometown.

We had to phone Vistara's customer service and luggage counter several times before we finally got an answer that they will be delivering us at the door step. 
Hoping that this saga will end.

title: Harassment by male baggage handler and female Vistara staff at gate 65A Mumbai airport on May 27, 2023.
text:
This whole incident occurred at 12:45 pm or 12:50 pm at gate number 65A on 27th May 2023.

I and my parents were traveling from Mumbai to Varanasi today which is May 27, 2023, and the gate number was 65A. Each of us had our trolley bags which altogether makes it 3 trolley bags. The departure time was 1:30 pm and we began boarding at around 12:45 or 12:50 pm. 

The gate number was 65A and the flight number was UK621. When our turn came to board the flight, there was one female Vistara staff aged 50+ years in a black coat who all of a sudden came and stood at the gate, and started instructing us that "Why did you carry such huge bags? You are not supposed to carry such big bags on air." "You will not board unless I check the weight of your bags." She pulled the bag from my mother's hand and stopped her. 

These are the exact words she used and snatched my mother's trolley bag from her hand.

Later a male baggage handler came and threatened us that he will not let us board the flight unless our bags are weighed. We told the female Vistara staff and the baggage handler that we have already checked the weights of our bags at home and at the airport before boarding at the check-in counter. At the check-in counter, we told the authority that we wish to carry our bags and that's when she checked the weight of our bags and let us take them. To this, the baggage handler said, "We are not your slaves, you are the slaves right now so you cannot board the flight unless we tell you to, and unless we check the weight of your bags." "You will need to check in the bags and not carry them. He threatened us to not board the flight."

The baggage handler said that "You people who board the flight are our slaves and you need to do as we say." These were his exact words. You will not board the flight until I bring the weighing scale and check your baggage weight. Calling us slaves and threatening us to not board the flight is unethical, illegal, and unfair as we pay charges for our flight. Is a ground staff baggage handler allowed to call passengers a slave even when we did not call him or abuse him?

I answered back at him that we have checked the weight of our bags and said that we cannot threaten to not board the flight. I also asked him to behave himself but he did not stop and the female Vistara attendant kept supporting him and did not stop him. 

We have come to Varanasi for just one day and why would we carry many things with us? Nobody would want to pick up heavy bags and place them above the seats on the flight. People don't carry the entire household with them everywhere they go via a flight that is just 2 hours away from a certain destination. Our bags were of the accurate size and we always carry these bags while traveling through Indigo, SpiceJet, and other airlines, but no airline staff has ever told us to weigh the bags during boarding at the gate and threatened us to not board the flight unlike in Vistara.

On the morning of 28th May 2023, a Vistara staff member called my father. He handed the phone to me and the Vistara staff told me that the airport authority of Mumbai airport addressed my complaint to Vistara ground staff appointed at gate 65A on 27th May 2023 and the deputy manager of Vistara Airlines. Instead of telling the truth, the deputy manager of Vistara, as well as the baggage handler and the female Vistara staff at gate no. 65 at Mumbai airport accused me of abusing them. I asked her do you have proof of the abuses and told me what abuses did I use? She said the ground staff did not give them the proof. I told her to pass on my message to the ground staff of Vistara at gate 65 which was appointed there on 27th May 2023, that I will reach the higher authority of Vistara Airlines and complain about the incident as well as the baggage handler and the Vistara female staff. I had to argue with the baggage handler and the Vistara female staff because they threatened me and my mother that they will not let us board the flight unless they weigh our bags. If it was somebody else was in my place even they would have argued with them because we pay for our flights and not letting us board is a crime on behalf of the airline ground staff. But in the process of argument, I could not abuse because my parents were with me and I cannot abuse them in front of them as it is unethical. Rather, the ground staff called us a slave and told us that we have to listen to what we said.

A baggage handler had no job at the gate. His job is to only handle the baggage of the passengers yet he interfered in our conversation with the Vistara female staff member, and was at the gate and threatened us to not board the flight unless he brings the weighing scale. 

My mother was carrying her small purse as well as one handbag which only had food and one trolley bag which is of the size that always fits in the compartment above the seat. She cannot check in the handbag which had food and yet was forced to stop and not board the flight until her bags are weighed. I was carrying one trolley bag that also fits in the compartment above the seat, and my father was carrying one trolley bag only. We always carry these many bags only when we travel by indigo and SpiceJet, but nobody told us to check in the trolley bag, purse, and handbag which has food. Telling to check in trolley bags is ok, but commenting on the size, and forcing others to check the weight of all bags at the gate is wrong. They are not supposed to do that at the gate, because it was already done at the check-in counter and we were allowed to carry our bags with us because it was under the permissible weight and food cannot be checked in. 

It is unfair to accuse passengers of abuse without proof. When I asked the female staff today on the phone call, she said they do not have proof of you abusing them. Then on what basis can the deputy manager not take action against the ground staff and accuse me of abusing them?

If I had to abuse somebody, I would have done that many times in the past as I am a frequent traveler. But, I never felt the need to complain about any ground staff at Mumbai airport because they are all good and kind to us. This is the first time I got this experience with the ground staff at Vistara gate no. 65.
Travelers do not plan at home that they will take hold of a staff member at the airport, blame them for no reason, and then complain.

I have never complained about any Airline before this, but baggage handlers calling passengers a slave is not at all right. I do not recommend flying with Vistara if families or even an individual wants to fly peacefully.

title: Review - 1st International Trip by Vistara to London from Mumbai via Delhi.
text:
I am a frequent overseas traveller due to my work and for few reason decided to try Vistara for a flight to London via Delhi while I reside in Mumbai.
Travelled on 29 May via UK994 and UK17
1.	Unlike BA or AA they don’t have a minimum 3 day stay rule for reduced fares for travel, so got the tickets at a decent price as I had to go for a short business trip.
2.	The return timing was good and am scheduled to reach Mumbai ~ 3pm with a changeover in Delhi. BA has cancelled the night flight from London on few days ☹

To share my experience on the entire process/travel with Vistara to London from Mumbai via Delhi.
Mumbai Airport: I was not aware if should go to International or Domestic Checkin counters, so went to International but was asked to goto Domestic as was flying via Delhi to London, I believe the International counter could have also checked in and I was literally the ONLY passenger there.
I went to the domestic Business class counter to check-in, the person there was not so polite/kind. I was enquiring on the Star Alliance as I am a Star Alliance Gold member as well and thought Vistara was also a member airline and my United FF number was on the boarding and status not showing up. seems she felt irritated as I was asking about the lounge access being a gold member, I was then told to check this at the lounge and Vistara cannot do anything.

Delhi Airport: 
Upon Arrival, I went to the Transfer Desk of Vistara, the person checked my passport etc and was directed to the International Transfers. Surprisingly the Delhi airport transfers had only 1 person for passport control and when I asked him, said, has called twice for more people but no positive response. I went back to the long queue.
After waiting in line for 30 mins, the same person from Vistara transfer desk comes and asks us to go to 2nd floor for immigration, so not only we had a long walk but also again had to wait in line for another ~30 mins for the security clearance, if directions could have been given correctly at one go, would have helped.

Inflight to London:
The aircraft was new, nice seats, good washroom – spacious and bright with a see through window! The staff was also very polite and the meal was decent I would say with the Indian taste, which I HATE in BA.
Washrooms though nice, the quality of paper napkins needs to improve a lot! All the bottles, hand cream(Good one), mouthwash (hope can keep small separate bottles for hygiene) are oversized for the space available. The Soap dispenser had to press at least 10-15 times for the soap to come out (was too thick for the pump)
Few nuances: To activate the inflight internet service, you cannot use Domestic (India) Issued cards! Wow.. that was a first for me and on payment options you have Master, Visa and Rupay (which is only in India) and the payment is managed by ICICI Bank, no AMEX either, so how are Indian’s suppose to use it who don’t have Internationally issued cards? I enquired with the team and they said cant help on this and hardly ever received a complaint.
Don’t know how others work around this? I tried 3 credit cards, but failed as all were issued in India. 
Mid-air, the entertainment system stopped working and was reset with ~ 10-15 min process to come back and after that as well most of the movies were not working!
Vistara needs to work on their tech. and processes.

London Arrivals:
Bags were already removed and kept aside by the time I cleared immigration and was a breeze!

Final Take: If not much of a price difference, will AVOID taking Vistara, especially via Delhi
1.	Extra ~4 hours than a direct flight
2.	Immigration in Delhi and extra 1 more security line
3.	Most Indian’s cannot buy inflight internet due to card restrictions, it is essential for work on a long flight.
4.	Not part of Star Alliance or One World, so no benefits of being the Top Tier member, hopefully gets resolved with Air India merger.
5.	Poor International connectivity, so in case of a missed flight, wait can be until next day.

title: Amazing cabin crew - but poor on-time performance
text:
It was my first time travelling international with Vistara. I had flown with them only on domestic routes before & always had a good experience. However, this flight was not up to the usual standard. Firstly - the number of check-in counters at Heathrow were not sufficient for the 260+ passengers flying onboard which made the check-in process very tiresome with long queue times. Next, the incoming flight was delayed by 2 hours which pushed OUR departure time further. It was very frustrating waiting at the airport for so long and, the Vistara ground staff at Heathrow were NOT cooperative and made excuses for the delay - and took no accountability. Boarding was SO chaotic and for economy passengers - boarding was NOT done in a row-number-wise fashion which led to further delays. The aircraft was not cleaned properly, and the pillow had hair in it. The screen and the tray table were dirty too.

The star of the flight was the cabin crew. They were very kind and helpful. They had a smile on their faces and tirelessly worked for 8+ hours. Kudos to them. They really made this journey 10x better. The food was good - although - not as good as onboard their domestic sectors. 

I would not mind flying international with Vistara again provided they improve their punctuality a bit. A lot of passengers were connecting onwards from Delhi and feared they would miss their onward flight due to the severe delay. This stresses out the passengers unnecessarily.

title: Poor ecommerce and technical functionality to support policies
text: It is a painful experience to deal with Vistara's self service applications. Have no such problem with any other airline. Upgrade policy is very poorly supported with poor technology. If you use name in lieu of letter or v.v., the system will reject request and no God can seem to authorize it against a very inadequate functional logic. Many a times I have booked on other airlines because I could not deal with Vistara's lack technical functionality. And I refuse to deal with no-can-do call centers. Damaged checked bag resolution is despicable. Airport refers to customer care who refers back to airport. Then customer care proceeds to close the case because they don't read their emails. Now the merger with Air India will likely create more pain points before it gets better - for a country that outsources tech help, surely the airlines should do better by hiring better decision makers who can think global to match with airlines ambition to be global. Indian airlines often have the worst websites...  Further, instead of serving inedible food on board, it is better they not serve and let people bring their own.

text:

title: Organised Fraud & Cheating by Vistara
text:
Harrowing experience with the airlines - booked my parents on a 9hr Vistara flight from Delhi to Frankfurt (PNR 5YAZIQ). Pre booked & paid Rs. 13,000/- over & above the air fare for Emergency Exit Row Seats that werwe confirmed on portal (46J & 46K). Upon boarding my parents realised that seats  were wrongly assigned at check in counter at airport (43C & 43B - unpaid seats)

Ground staff firmly asserted that we were mistaken or payment did not go through & hence seats were not booked. They could do nothing about it as seats were assigned to other passengers.

Post providing them with relevant proof of payment & screenshots of  booked seats on the CV portal - instead of gracefully accepting the mistake at their end & resolving the matter the ground staff mentioned that as per them my parents requested the staff at Check In counter to NOT allocate the pre booked Exit Row seats and insisted they be given unpaid middle seats. 

Rather than being apologetic - the ground staff mentally harassed my parents by not giving the seats they duly paid for, and suggested they simply claim a refund on email and settle with the given seats or simply de board the flight and take the next one as an ultimatum.

Not only were they denied the seats without any reason whatsoever but were also misbehaved with and spoken to with utter disrespect as if they were asking for something extra. Let alone allocating the right seats or providing with an upgrade as a token of apology, the ground staff refused to even share their names or the reason for not allocating them the booked seats. I thoroughly regret my decision of booking with Vistara instead of its counterparts that fly to the same destination at similar times and lesser prices. 

What is the point of pre booking seats when eventually the airlines will allocate as it pleases. We paid in advance so we do not have to “request” for exit seats / aisle seats while checking in. 

Equally disappointed with response on the helpline number - was casually suggested to "claim a refund which normally the airlines is ‘not liable’ to pay and that maybe passengers were physically unfit to sit on exit seats". Wrong seats were assigned at the check in counter itself and boarding pass was issued. Seats were not changed upon boarding or due to being "unfit". Neither do my parents have any physical disabilities / health conditions making them fit to sit on the emergency exit seats and neither were any questions pertaining to their health / medical conditions asked by the staff basis which this decision could have been made.

A joint venture between Tata & SIA - both renowned for their incomparable hospitality & service and yet the ground staff thought that asking to claim a refund would suffice and compensate for the panic and embarrassment my parents went through before boarding the flight, and inconvenience and discomfort they faced during the flight. It is due to the incompetence of your staff & lags in your back end & technical team that my parents had to face everything I stated above.

We have still not received any kind of apology from your airlines or staff on the matter despite countless calls and mails since morning.

title: A Disastrous Experience with Vistara:  Highway Robbery in the Sky
text:
I cannot put into words the utter disappointment and frustration I experienced with Vistara. This is the first time I am booking a flight with them and it is very unlikely I will ever book with them again.  My trust in their services has been shattered, and I feel compelled to share my experience in the hope that it might save others from a similar debacle.

First and foremost, I had paid for an upgrade on my flight, a simple transaction one might expect to go smoothly. However, that was far from the case. The airline deducted the funds from my account, but failed to actually upgrade my seat as requested.

Hoping that it was merely an oversight, I contacted their customer service to resolve the issue. It was at this point that I became truly disenchanted with Vistara. I was met with a barrage of delays, excuses, and empty promises. The customer service team was unresponsive and evasive, making no effort to correct the problem. What is worse and this is where I am pissed of and what I feel should be a class action law suit against them is the fact that they knew the website has a problem, they offer upgrade when checking in online, and when we pay, we are not given the option to upgrade. It will take us back to the economy and then money is deducted, we are left with the extremely frustrating job of contacting them and getting a refund. 

 It felt like I was being robbed in broad daylight, with the added insult of the airline's seeming indifference to my plight. And they freaking know about this. I wonder how many people are experiencing the same issue. 

In summary, my experience with VIstara has left me with a profound sense of disillusionment. I am astounded by their lack of professionalism, their inability to provide the services I paid for, and their abject disregard for customer satisfaction. I cannot, in good conscience, recommend this airline to anyone, and I will certainly be looking elsewhere for my future travel needs. Steer clear of Vistara, if you value your time, money, and sanity.

title: A new low.....Vistara Business Class...Lowest Priority in delivering checked-in luggage at Guwahati Airport
text:
Travelled Vistara business class with family on a leisure trip in Chennai-Delhi-Guwahati sector. While the in-flight service was exemplary in all the sectors, the ground services were poor, starting from check-in at Chennai, lounge facility in Chennai & the baggage delivery at Guwahati airport. Here is my account of these:

1. The lady manning the business class check-in counter was so grim faced & could not even offer a welcome smile to us! We checked in two luggages that she tagged as PRIORITY, being business class, and told us they will be delivered on prority basis at Guwahati. Our boarding passes had an invitation to the TFS Lounge facility near Gate no.3.

2. Upon showing our boarding passes at tge TFS Lounge, we were immediately guided to the Copper Chimney restaurant & told to use that as lounge as well. They were allowing credit card holders & other airlines passengers into the lounge. Anyways we had our breakfast in Copper Chimney. It was too crowded & it certainly was not like a lounge. The tables & chairs were placed too cramped as they do in mediocre eateries. No newspapers were available. After breakfast I approached the lounge staff again & asked them why they were discouraging many people from entering their lounge. At this, they reluctantly allowed us in. Inside it was not crowded & plenty of decent sofas were available. Vistara should seriously look into this discrimination by TFS Lounge staff that may discourage business class travellers.

3. Worst experience was yet to be witnessed by us at Guwahati airport. One of our luggages marked PRIORITY was the last to arrive on the conveyer belt, long after all economy class passengers left with their luggages. We realised Vistara has a new definition for PRIORITY, by prefixing LOW  & making it LOW PRIORITY for business class travellers. The ground staff were clueless & unable to help us out as we waited close to 30 mins for our PRIORITY luggage. Finally the manager came to our help just when the luggage arrived on the belt and all other passengers had left. She was apologetic & extended a nice gesture of escorting us out of the airport, talked in local language with a taxi driver & seeing us off. Vistara should train their staff better to handle PRIORITY luggages of business class travellers.

 Nevertheless, as mentioned above, the in-flight service, well curated menu, etc. were excellent and on this account, I would give another chance to Vistara to rectify the above with respect to the ground staff.

title: Not trustful, bad service,
text:
By description of Vistara Premium Economy seats should have been wider, more comfortable, more seat tilt, more seat adjustment options with adjustable leg rests, differentiated armrests, a larger screen and 2/3/2 seating. All of this is promised on the website when flying on a Vistara Dreamliner.
None of this existed in reality.
There were normal economy class seats, in a different color, a little more legroom, the same screens, etc. It's not really clear what the surcharge was for. Could have been saved. I and other passengers reacted correspondingly irritated.
The staff was far from being friendly and helpful. It looked tense.
Vistara only responds to letters with a complaint with automated reply letters and a note that the mail has arrived and a case number. That was it already! There were no further replies or an interest in clarification even after 2 weeks. Service is definitely a foreign word at Vistara! One lags far behind one's own published claims, as well as the provision of service descriptions. Beautiful words, pictures and videos on the Internet are not enough to move in the circle of well-known airlines. What counts is performance and service in order to win and keep the trust of customers. Vitara does not currently have this willingness/knowledge.
The apology received in the meantime includes that due to Vistara's internal changes, services may no longer be available. That's it, no refund of the overpaid amount, no suggestion of another solution. I should only take note of the service that was not rendered, apologize and accept it as a unique situation. Now courts have to decide. Bad service, Bad performance, Vistara is not recommended.

title: Avoid Vistara- Awful Customer Service
text:
Our experience with Vistara Airlines was one that was extremely unprofessional and unpleasant. Upon arrival at the Hyderabad international airport, we waited in line for almost 1 hour to check-in & drop off our baggage. The bag drop line was not excessively long. However, the Vistara check-in workers on duty around 7PM at HYD on 2/11 showed no promptness or care for their passengers. Several passengers expressed concerns in line and the male manager wearing a gray coat did nothing to help until several passengers finally shouted at him.

After waiting for an hour to reach the check-in counter, the lady assisting us was messaging on WhatsApp in the middle of checking-in our baggage. This lady was sitting on her phone texting in the middle of weighing my bags and giving me my boarding pass. First I assumed “oh maybe she needs to send a quick message”. Then after a few minutes of seeing her texting, I finally said to her “can you get off your phone and do your job, I need to finish checking-in, I have a flight to catch.” The worker looked at me with no response. She stopped texting and finished checking me in. What kind of customer service is this?

What kind of worker texts in front of customers? Especially in an airport where punctuality is extremely necessary.

After all this, the worker asked me to keep my carry on baggage on the scale and told me that I had to check in my carry on luggage. When I asked why, she said “we are only allowing passengers who have an international destination to keep their carry on luggage.” I said “you can see that I am international. My final destination is DTW, why are you asking me to check this in?” She again had no response. I took my carry-on bag off the scale and said “I am keeping this with me.” I took my boarding pass and left.

More than 1 hour of my time in the airport was spent dealing with the disrespectful and unintelligent Vistara staff just for baggage drop. 

To top it off, boarding for the Vistara flight was delayed. After a long 24 hours of traveling from India to the US, one of my bags did not reach. During my journey, I flew Vistara, KLM, and Delta. I went to the Delta desk and filed a claim. Both Delta and KLM said the bag never left Hyderabad (Vistara). When I called Vistara, they told me they can’t track my bag. What kind of airlines is this? After endless phone calls, I finally received my baggage.  

Moral of the story, don’t fly Vistara. They have no courtesy for their passengers, and their staff in HYD is careless, inefficient, incompetent, and ignorant. 

I flew IndiGo 6 times within 3 weeks in India and they were perfect. I would suggest choosing them instead.

title: MISSING BAGGAGE FROM VISTARA
text:
I recently returned to Edinburgh from Ahmedabad, India via London Heathrow airport, which arrived (18/01/2023) at 11:00PM at Edinburgh Airport.

My luggage, which was supposed to be checked all the way through to my final destination, baggage tag No. (5E795161) has apparently been completely miss-placed and possibly off-loaded at London Heathrow Airport. My both bags were missing but fortunately one bag got delivered in 4 days but the bag tag 5E795161 is still missing for 13 days.

The ground staff at the EDINBURGH lost luggage counter wrote down my missing luggage report, where the staff informed me that they would be in touch within (24) hours to inform me of where and when my luggage would be tracked down and arriving. The reference number for the report is EDIBA18246.

It has been 13 days now; I have spoken to your call center numerous times a day since my arrival, and they have absolutely no information for me as to the whereabouts of my luggage and hear completely different answers in each call!

I find it completely unprofessional how in our world today with the security and technology available to you as a large airline can completely miss-place baggage.

I have certain items inside which are completely irreplaceable. I hope that the bag will be located and sent back as I have my clothes, personal items, valuable items and more but should it never turn up and be reported missing indefinitely, I believe that I am entitled to some form of compensation from the airline.

I am in contact with British Airways and as per their continuous correspondence to me that baggage is already on T3 with Vistara and they are still waiting to receive it at T5.  Can i please have clarity and have the case expedited as its been 2 weeks i have no answer from VIstara. Just for your information the services of Vistara are so crap that it's very hard to get hold of any customer service agent nor there is any reply on any of the email communications.

title: Poor quality overall
text:
I recently travelled from New Delhi to Frankfurt in Vistara for the first time. I felt that the overall travel experience was poor and in fact I would rate Vistara as one of the worst international flight I have had.

The food they server on board was not good. They must be trying to tailor the menu to serve the Indian customer. But, I felt that the quality and taste was poor.

I felt that aircraft was a relatively smaller aircraft compared to the other airlines that fly on the same route. The configuration of the aircraft was such that it felt very cramped and felt a bit suffocating. Leg space was also below average.

The entertainment system really needs an overhaul. First of all very few movies/shows to opt from compared to what is offered by other airlines. Even the ones that are available are really out dated. Some really old Hindi movies like the DDLJ. Seriously? No good live flight tracking information.

Did not manage to get any sleep on this flight. There were people playing loud music for their kids on their phone at night when most were trying to get some sleep. The airline staff did not bother to ask them to lower the volume or did not interfere in any way.

They ran out of toilet paper and paper towel in the bathrooms midway and the bathrooms were a mess. Had to decide not to use the bathroom till I landed. It was that bad.

I wouldn't opt for Vistara for any international travel in the future.

text:
Hi,

I have travelled HYD-MUM enroute to Toronto on 28th December 2022.

My booking reference is 3QUVWR.

I faced many issues with your airline which are concerning.

1. I had three pieces of excess baggage and I was willing to pay the fee as stated in my ticket document which was CAD 100 per each extra piece ( 23kgs). Your staff at the airport charged me 200 USD per piece. When I asked them to show me a document which states that I must pay 200 USD, they said they donot have any and they cannot provide any supporting document. We were subjected to massive stress at HYD airport. Your staff extorted USD 200 from us without providing us any supporting document. I can provide you an evidence that I have to pay only CAD 100 per each extra piece.
Inline image

2. We were assigned seats 16A,16B and 16C on HYD-BOM segment by Vistara. On boarding the aircraft, we found that seat belt on seat 16A was installed incorrectly and cannot be used. This was brought to the attention of cabin crew immediately and sought help. However, after few minutes, I was flabbergasted to see that the departure is being commenced without fixing the seat belt which is a safety violation. When I expressed my displeasure,  One cabin crew said that they will look into this after DEMO and another said that that they will look into this after take-off !!!! How did the departure commenced without fixing the seat ? I tried to speak to the captain of the flight on arrival in Mumbai and asked him if he was aware of the unsafe condition of the pax before he commenced pushback of the aircraft for departure. His silence acknowledged he may be aware of the unsafe condition. This implies that he commenced a departure knowing very well that a pax is not in safe condition which is a serious safety violation putting my son's life/safety at risk intentionally. This also can be treated as an action with criminal intent.

title: DON’T TRAVEL BY VISTARA
text:
If there was an option for zero stars, that’s what I would give Vistara. 

Nope, please do not travel by Vistara. 

We traveled from Mumbai to Bangalore on Dec 9th by Vistara. I was traveling with my mom who is 85 years old. We were on our way to attend my nephew’s wedding. 

We loaded 2 bags first at the check in counter. The Vistara employee was highly inefficient and under trained. He told us that the system is showing the bags are overweight although the 2 bags weighed exactly 30 Kgs. He also told us that the system is showing boarding has already started and he is unable to checkin our bags though we were checking more than 2 hours before the flight departure time. The employee was totally confused and had to get help of fellow employee. The fellow employee hurriedly started helping us. He looked at my carry on bag and mentioned the dimensions are larger than the allowed. 
I gave him the specifications and told him that it is within the allowed dimensions. Since I didn’t want to have any further issues I checked in my carry on bag. I also checked in my mom’s carry on bag. So we had total 4 bags that we checked in 

In the chaos and the rush, I forgot to check if the tags were attached to all 4 bags. I also overlooked the bags tags that were provided to us. 

When we landed in Bangalore, we found out that my mom’s bag was missing. And I realized that I didn’t have the bag tag for this bag. 

We stopped at the Vistara baggage tracking center at the airport and filed a complaint. We did not get a complaint number. Since my mom was not feeling good, we left the airport. 

Until today we have made several calls to Vistara. All the calls have been handled inefficiently by Vistara employees. We can’t get a supervisor or a manager to talk to. 

We are totally disappointed by the way Vistara has handled this. We have requested CCTV footage as that is the only way to track the bag, but Vistara is unable to show us the CCTV footage. My mom could not wear any of the wedding clothes for her grand son’s wedding. 

I request to my fellow passengers to not to travel by Vistara airlines.

title: Meets expectations, but when there are exceptions, Service falls apart.
text:
In India recently (live in California) and booked a few flights on Vistara. 

First flight from Mumbai to Chennai was in Economy. Vistara emailed multiple times for upgrade @ 10K Rs. Tried to upgrade online but presented with Errors - reached out to Support (Abhinav Bhaskar, who signs as Sr. Executive - Customer Relations) to describe website problems, who promised to help but did not. Seems that the only thing they are empowered to do is to "apologize for inconvenience" without no real empowerment/capability to actually do anything to resolve the problem.

Then given lack of timely support, upgraded at airport, where they could not care less about my online experience only to insist that on-site upgrades at airport were 16K (10K was online only). I reached out to Support again to a> describe the poor user experience and b> seek some recompense, but now they couldn't bother to respond.

Since then had 2 other flights - flew economy - tried to upgrade on one, again met with poor user experience - so opted against it. Since then , never tried to upgrade - so the flights were OK. Hence my review of: you follow the "happy - path" - service could meet expectations. Try to change anything, the staff acts like it will take an "act of God" to make anything happen.

title: Great trip on a Vistara
text:
My friends recommended that I use Vistara for the connections and the service. I traveled from Hyderabad to Amritsar with a change of planes at New Delhi.

Service is top class and every passenger gets a meal. On the Hyderabad - Delhi fight the aircraft had screens on the front of the seat. I watched a nice comedy movie. Had hot breakfast.

Changing at Delhi, you go through security again and 1b hour cuts it fine but is doable.

The Delhi Amritsar flight is short , still you get a snack and cookies.

Baggage was very quick.

Return to Hyderabad was great. Even if the flight is delayed, everyone makes an effort to get you to your destination on time.

Due to weather in Delhi, the flight from Amritsar had to be in a holding pattern for a few minutes so my connection was short. There were Vistara ground staff at every place to assist and help.

Due to the short connection and the weather delay, my bag missed the transfer. I got it delivered home the next day. Lesson learned of not to pack medicines in your checked in baggage.

Oh the return flight Delhi - Hyderabad loved the chicken tikka masala with Paratha, fudge brownie ice cream and coffee.

The cabin crew were pleasant on all my flights. They took care of all requests especially for water that seemed frequently asked for. In fact they almost anticipated every need. I loved the Vistara World entertainment and watched Thoda adjust please!

Overall, when I travel in India, I'll choose Vistara. Or maybe they'll be part of Air India.

Thanks

title: Never again with the awful Vistara
text:
I have been singing the praises of Vistara since they started operations some years back.  I have flown business with them multiple times.

This time the rates were far to high to justify business and so I booked Premium Economy for my Trivandrum – Delhi flight of three hours.

A month before departure they changed the flight number and timings. The next day they downgraded me to economy.

They suggested that I call them for options.  The first call was cut off after 18 minutes and the second call lasted 26 minutes. This was 44 minutes wasted.

My options were to have a refund or fly in economy.  They would not give me the original baggage allowance of 25kg if I did. They would compensate me just over US $15 for the downgrade. Pathetic.

This kind of customer service is despicable.

I rebooked with Air India in their business class although the cost was more than double.

I have two other flights booked with Vistara and if they do not downgrade me again, I have little choice but to fly with them on those flights.

After this, never again.  I will not deal with a business that treats customers with such contempt and simply does not care. How can any business go from superb to appalling in such a short time?

Of course instead of telling everyone to fly with Vistara, I will be telling everyone not to. What a disgraceful way to deal with people.

title: Below Average Business Class
text:
I took a business class flight to London in May from Delhi. Right from the onset the service was extremely disappointing. 

Firstly, they advertised that the business class customers get free wi-fi on board. With some important emails pending which I was supposed to pick up on-board, I was left shocked as the aircraft did not have any wi-fi. Surprisingly, there was no apologies by Vistara either. I am a platinum member. 

Secondly, as a business class customer, for the first time I did not get the food of my choice despite pre-booking it. By the time I was served, the chicken options were over. They tried compensating by arranging an equivalent from premium economy, but they ran out of food there as well. I was left with a only one food option, which was my last preference. Again, the staff was very casual about it. 

Thirdly, the seats are not the most comfortable for full recline. You end up stretching your legs in the rear portion of the seat in front of you, as a result there is little room to move the legs while lying down. 

Lastly, there is no concept of priority. At Heathrow we had to wait 2.5 hours at immigration despite flying business. 

I have never had such an awful experience with the business class of any other airlines, where in particular the staff is very friendly and is always looking to go above and beyond to ensure best service. In Vistara, neither was the staff apologetic, nor did they reach out afterwards to amend the situation despite leaving a terrible on-board feedback. 

Despite being a platinum member, don't think I am taking Vistara again after this awful experience.

title: SCAM Airline. Worst service. Unprofessional employees.

title: Made us unhealthy, stressed and breathless due to carelessness of ground staff and insulting behaviour of Canbin CrewK-8
text:
We had a day tour from Mumbai to Hyderabad and return on same day. Our morning flight form Mumbai had an excellent feel of usual services of Tata's Airline, but Hyderabad to Mumbai flight at night made our experience extremely worst. My 79 yrs. age mother and my self-suffered a lot with breathless stress to board the flight after a full day busy travel to a temple darshan. 
Even though we had confirmed wheel chair booking and email from Vistara confirming that we can use our own wheel chair, Hyderabad ground staff insisted to use their wheel chair and check-in our wheel chair as luggage. We took no objection, though in morning Mumbai staff allowed to use our own wheelchair up to flight cabin. Unfortunately, after dropping us at Plaza Lounge at about 7.30pm, no one came to pick us for boarding till about 9.20pm though as per boarding pass time of boarding was 8.35pm. I tried contacting various sources to get the wheel chair and reach gate. With all failures, somehow, I found some wheel chair at lounge and rushed to Gate 18 where I saw the red warning display "FINAL CALL". Flight door was about to close. I think we were the last pax to report. Somehow managed to board after great difficulties and then misbehaviour of Inflight Supervisor in front of other pax in cabin made me really feel insulted. While disembarking coincidently Captain came out of the cockpit and I thought of reporting the misbehaviour and her reaction was like "he is one of our very good staff" (as if I was the very bad person to report the bitter truth!). Seeing me reporting the truth, other paxs also started telling the truth of Vistara staff's poor services. So, Captain and Inflight Supervisor hided themselves inside the cabin.
Subsequently, when we reached Mumbai and got our own wheelchair the ground staff insisted to carry the wheelchair up to cab. And I was kept busy on call with their Customer Service on mobile and a shift in charge near belt was talking to my mother. Therefore, I could not check the condition of our wheelchair. When I reached home and carried it from ground floor to home, I found it's left side break is damaged. Of course, they will say it was not reported at airport, so they are not responsible.
The calls with Vistara team at midnight was disconnected (unable to digest the bitter truth because their Hyderabad ground staff and Cebine crew will of course not accept their own mistakes to protect their own jobs!) informally (near to similarity of the informal behaviour of crew inside cabin). Seriously, we had several flights in our life, but our experience on 18-Sept-2022 Vistara flight was worst of our life.

title: Lost baggage with Vistara, never fly them. Save your money avoid anxiety
text:
This review is being written for awareness - general public, avoid flying Vistara if you want to save your money, items and keep your peace of mind and sanity. I was an international passenger traveling from Chennai to Delhi to Amsterdam to Boston in July 2022. Chennai to Delhi segment was in Vistara. Checked bag at Chennai with intention of collecting it at Delhi for additional shopping at the airport. Come to baggage claim, bag is missing, waited for an hour, still no bag, went to Vistara customer service desk, they called a few people, weren’t able to trace it. The agent took my complaint, filed a Property Irregularity Report (I have the file reference number and picture of the signed report), told me not to worry, the bag will be located and I will be receiving it in the States within a couple of days. As of today it is about 2 weeks since the incident happened. In the meantime my family in India and I have been trying to get info from customer service, but nothing

We even wrote to the Nodal Office Bhatia requesting his office to investigate, still nothing happened. I am completely frustrated by the whole experience that I am exploring my next options.

Montreal Convention from 2003 gives passengers certain rights in such circumstances, including financial compensation from the airline that I am looking for filing the claim. That process too I found is not straight forward. There is no information on Vistara website about this. Perhaps they do it intentionally, in order to make life even more difficult for the passengers.

Warning to all! Save your time and avoid troubles. Fly Indigo and have peace of mind. Avoid Vistara.

title: Horrid airport experience
text:
I booked a flight online for my boyfriend on Vistara. I am a seasoned traveller and know the rules, so because I would not be travelling with him, I gave him a photocopy of my credit card and a photocopy of my ID both attested by me (the card holder) as per Vistara policy (indicated on their website). But when he tried to check-in for his flight at the Delhi airport, they said his ticket was suspended. They didn't care that he had the correct document (the photocopy of my credit card). 
So he ended up calling me on my mobile and he told me they wanted me to call the Customer Service number. I called the Customer Service number and the agent said the computer was showing him as a "no-show." 
I said, "How could he be a 'no-show' when he is at the airport right now???" So then she put me on hold and came back and said that he needed to show the physical credit card that was used to purchase the ticket. I told her that's not what the Vistara website says and I read her the policy straight from the website. She then asked me the web address, so I told her. (Unbelievable that Customer Service does not know their own policy, which, incidentally, is the same policy as Indigo and Air India.) I guess she read it and learned something because she then said his ticket was no longer suspended. I thought she "unsuspended" the ticket in the computer, so with relief I called back my boyfriend at the airport and told him that everything was resolved. But then to my horror he said the check-in agents still wouldn't let him check in. Now, they said, he had to go to the Reservation Desk at the airport! Also, the check-in agents refused to speak with me to verify the ticket or explain what Customer Service said. 
Now, I'm not sure if my boyfriend found somebody helpful, or if something showed up on the computer, because they finally allowed him to check-in. But they had been giving him the runaround for close to two hours, so he said there was no way he was going to get through the large security line and make his flight, which was leaving in 45 minutes. Luckily an intelligent and customer-oriented Vistara agent finally took charge of the situation and escorted him through security, and he made his flight just in the nick of time. But I am still dumbfounded at the incompetence and ignorance of these Vistara check-in agents at the Delhi airport. The inconvenience and stress they put us through was unwarranted and absurd.

title: Delayed Baggage
text:
I am writing this review to voice out my experience and issues incurred during my first ever journey with Air Vistara. I travelled from Heathrow airport, London to New Delhi airport on the 12th of January. My flight was delayed for more than an hour and when I reached the airport my check-in baggage never arrived at the belt. After inquiring for half an hour at the airport I was able to find the person I could share my concern with. The person told me my baggage hadn't arrived on the flight today and will arrive tomorrow on another flight. I can understand the issue but in all of this situation, I lost my connecting travel to home (another city) which was planned according to the average time airport procedures usually take. Additionally, I was assured that my baggage will be delivered to my home within the next 24hrs which also didn't happen. I did not receive any reference number to even track my baggage and I was just given a photograph of the document I filled out at the airport. Today is the 19th of July (7 days) and I haven't received my baggage yet. I have important documents in the bag and some other necessary things for the work I need to do urgently in India but I do not have access to them as well. I don't know if this is how generally the delayed baggage situation is handled by Vistara, I had a quite good image of the airline, hence I booked with them. This experience has caused some real damage to the plans and scheduled tasks I had and I am feeling highly disappointed with this. 
I sought the airline's support before putting it in the public domain but no help was received even after writing to five different email addresses multiple times, calling the customer care services, and reaching out to the numbers given at the airport. I really wish that nothing like this ever happen to someone. Please be cautious before making the selection of your next airline for travel. I have no hope of receiving my baggage and going to seek legal action for the loss of Money, Time and Effort during this whole travel.

title: Will not be using this airline ever again.
text:
I have many issues with this airline. Travelled with my husband and 10 month baby. 

1. Selected economy flexi for the outbound flight and economy value for the inbound flight. 
Economy flexi included no extra charge for changing date (for more money) of outbound flight which was perfect as our plans for outbound date were not concrete and may need to travel earlier. 

Indeed we needed to change the flight date, was informed by email there would be charges as the “most restrictive rules apply” which means as I selected econemy value for the inbound flight, the rules were based on this ticket despite pay exta money for three people for the economy flexi! Therefor this airline advertises services for more money that is not given to customer when requested because in there FAQ it states quite slyly the rules - but not at the time of booking! I paid more money for a service that was not provided as when I contacted to change to earlier date I was told I had to pay approx £400 to change the dates for the three of us. 

2. It was my first time travelling with a baby on a long haul journey. I emailed customer services to ensure I understood rules around liquids as my baby drank 260mls of formula milk three times a day - over the limit as liquids can only be carried in 100mls. 

I was advised that I could not carry liquid more than 100ml in bottle and had to buy premade formula bottles of 100 ml to ensure my child didn’t go hungry and cry. When got to air port it was clearly stated that baby milk could be carried in more quantity. 

The emails I received from customer service were not sympathetic. The only thing this airline cares about is making conning money from customers. 

3. I was receiving contradicting information from reps about how much baggage was allowed as It was not clear on the ticket. It was confusing as econemy flexi  allowed more than economy value. In the end I opted to take less baggage as I knew it was another way of conning me for extra money. 

4. E-tickets for individual family members for same booking reference provided rather than one e-ticket with all family member names. This is not environmentally friendly. My 10 month old baby does not need her only e-ticket. 

5. Air vistara do not send an itemised receipt for what had been paid for. Instead send amount paid in total on the e-ticket without the different fares paid for! 

There are other issues I had with being told wrong information regarding stroller for baby and baggage transfer. So many issues and probably haven’t remembered them all. 

As a mother on maternity leave I’ve paid a lot of money for a service I did not receive. I have lost out on money which I can use for my 10 month old baby and towards her quality of life. This airline trades under UK Laws and this is illegal.  

I have emailed custrelations@airvistara.com as suggested by the reps as I am unhappy and want the difference between economy flexi and value on the day of booking refunded back to me.  I have not received a reply. 

My original email was sent on 6th May. Automated email was sent to say I’ll receive a reply within 3-5 working days. 
I forwarded the email to them again on 17th May requesting confirmation that they received the email. I have not yet heard from them. I have forwarded the same complaint email 5 more times today and will give them a further 5 working days to respond and act. If I do not here anything I will be escalating complaint to the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) regarding The Operation of Air Services (Pricing etc) Regulations 2013 regarding Consumer Protection. 

Below are pictures of some of the emails with contradicting information from the reps and e-ticket with no mention of type of fare paid for. 

I do not advise anyone to book with this airline they take your money at any given chance illegally.

I am disappointed to say that I was not allowed to board the flight yesterday at Delhi airport with Vistara Airlines. The booking reference is 4ZITB9.

I came back home disheartened and started checking on Vistara website travel instructions and German govt website thoroughly and  it clearly mentioned that Canada PR holders and the US visa holder do not need a transit visa and I couldn’t find anything that should stop me from boarding the plane. Then I decided to talk to Vistara customer  care representatives. I talked to them for about 3 hours and my matter was still not resolved. 
On call with the first agent, she said that I should have booked my tickets with Vistara airline itself instead of booking it with a third party agent. And when I requested her to show the rule for transit visa she failed to provide it. And when I requested her to connect me to the supervisor, she disconnected the call.
I called again, on call with the second agent, she understood my problem and she herself knew that I shouldn’t be denied boarding pass, and when she further digged in she found that my baggage contained some hazardous material, hence denied boarding, which is not true because my bags were not checked in the first place.
I was denied boarding because I was found carrying harzardous material in bags. It totally swept floor out of my feet. I was shocked to know that I was fooled at the time of boarding. So to assist me further she connected me to the supervisor.
Finally on call with the Supervisior, I was told that I was carrying all the right documentation for travelling, and also I was not required a transit visa. The supervisor asked me to raise a complaint to the Vistara website email and asked me to patiently wait for 24-48 hours for the revert. 
I am hoping that Vistara Airline will refund because it’s a huge mistake from their end which caused me inconvenience and lose of money and time.

title: Continues to be disappointing
text:
The airlines claims to be Indias best, and on a per mile basis business class tickets are as expensive or more than compatible flights in Europe or USA. The onboard experience is okay. But everything before stepping in and after stepping out of the flight is nightmare. 

First of all, no clear announcement of how long the delay is or status at boarding gate. Secondly the gate changed 4 times from one end of the airport to the other - leading to substantial difficulty for elderly passengers as I have noticed. Thirdly, the finally allocated gate number on the board was incorrect - leading to people rushing from gate to gate at the last moment. Lastly, onboarding is a chaos - no group or line - it’s like an open street market.  Somehow the airlines absolves all responsibility of passenger experience outside the door of the aircraft. 

On arrival, experience continues - no gate was assigned and it off-boarded the passengers in the middle of the airport, and elderly passengers struggled to carry their handbags over a stairway bridge to the bus downstairs- which btw is loaded to the full capacity with people next to each other in the middle of the peak of omicron! 

 Not sure what would happen to anyone on wheelchair.in such deplaning system.  It would definitely be unlawful to operate this way in a developed country to disregard  accessibility to such an extent, but probably these do not matter in this part of the world!

title: A great airline gone down the drain
text:
VISTARA used to be a great airline - now its down in the dumps - much worse than some of the cheapest airlines in business.

I had booked an international ticket to Colombo and back in business class with the reference number KDAA5J and canceled the same on 6th January. To date, I haven't received any communication nor my refund of 62,710 from Vistara. Their websites and apps are not working, (which I have complained several times but to no avail also), and despite repeatedly calling them since the day with a minimum hold time of at least half an hour, the customer care keeps on dilly-dallying the matter by saying the refund is delayed due to covid and will come in 7 days- Despite 10 days being passed (the ticket was canceled on 6th January 2022) and yet there is no communication or news of refund from them. 

I have even written several emails to them which they are obligated to reply to within 48 hours but I am yet to receive any phone call or communication from them. 

I tried speaking to the customer care today also - first time I held the phone for 40 minutes and had to hang up in frustration and second time finally when I got through a customer care executive, he again promised me a call back in 15 minutes and my refund to be issued within today's date. Neither of which happened.

title: Good with minimal  issues
text:
Check in for business class is quick at both Delhi and London Heathrow. 
Three bags of 32 kg each are allowed as check in baggage.
Lounge at Delhi airport is situated at level 4 approached by an elevator from the ground level. This is called Plaza Premium Lounge at level 4.
Lounge at London Heathrow is a shared lounge and is situated at level 2 section F  approached from the duty free area.
The food spread in both the lounges is minimal. London lounge served Indian curries and rice also.
Bar is well stocked at both places.
Sanitizers are available and the wait staff is using masks.
The business cabin has seven rows of four seats each.
In odd number seats, the passengers on either side sit close to each other and so is suitable for couples travelling together. There is a screen between the passengers for privacy which can be lowered. In even number seats there is a distance between both the passengers.
All the window seats are single.
The entry to odd numbered seats is very narrow and the lower part of the body is compressed considerably when you enter your seat.
The seats are cushioned but have only a recline and flat bed option. No in seat massager.
Socks, eye pad, sanitizer bottle, face screen, surgical mask, blanket, and a headphone is provided.
There is a table top for storage and a small shelf with a door too for storage.
Phone charger is available by the seat.
Reading lights are good and positioned well.
Complimentary WiFi was available throughout the flight between take off and landing and had good speed.
Big screen TV with good basket of programs .
The overhead bins were placed quite high and so they have provided a slot in the seat on which one has to climb to use the bins comfortably in case you are of average height. But the crew always came for help when they saw you using the overhead bin.
Sleep quality was good and cabin noise was moderate.
Non vegetarian breakfast/ food choice was continental and vegetarian choice was indian. Both were good in taste. Bar had limited choices.

title: Forceful de-boarding without valid reason
text: International flights on Air Vistara is a nightmare as their ground crew is usually without a clue of foreign immigration policy and arbitrarily de-board passengers without valid reasons. Although all other documents are there, except the second dosage certificate of one of the passengers, they de-board all three passengers citing Maldivian Immigration issues. After the boarding gate has closed and on being quizzed by the Indian Immigration Vistara staff forced us to sign a document stating the other two passengers had voluntarily de-boarded. title: Worst Ground Staff in Delhi Airport, Terminal 3
text:
I booked 3 seats in Flight number UK 721 from Delhi to Guwahati for 19th December, 2021 with Vistara in Premium Economy for me , my wife and my 5 year old son . The departure time was 15.00 pm; we reached Delhi airport Terminal 3 on the 19th at around 13.00 and proceeded to the Premium Economy checkin counter to give our luggage and get the boarding cards. The personnel at the counter informed us that only 2 seats are available in Premium Economy and one will have to seat in Economy. The reason he gave was one of my Premium Economy seat was already given to someone else. I obviously didn’t agree and we kept going back and forth and him saying all the while that it was not possible to give all three seats in Premium Economy. He called two of his seniors and we went through the same process of they saying my Premium Economy seat was given to someone else and I not agreeing to it.  This continued for around 30-45 minutes and I and my family stood all this while at the checkin Counter with our luggage. The reason why I had booked all three Premium Economy seats together way ahead in advance is because in these Covid times I wanted me and my family to sit together and also we reached from Germany early morning of that day which is currently a high risk Covid country and it is safety concern for other passengers as well. And for an Airline which does marketing saying it takes Corona safety measures to keep passengers safe, one of the staff asked me ‘What Corona?’ when I told him we came from a high risk country. The Manager was finally called and he told me that we either fly in whichever way they want or miss the flight. He made it very clear that we comply to whatever they say. Eventually I had to agree to this bullying because it was already 14.30 and I had a small 5 year old boy who was tired after having flown from Germany early morning. I requested him to give an Economy Aisle seat to which he agreed. He explained  how he had to come all the way from some other part of Airport to take care of our matter as if he did a great favor to us. After reaching the boarding gate, he asked us to board the flight and I ended up in the middle seat in Economy class. I had to request the Air Hostess to give me a PPE kit since they didn’t even bother to take into consideration the safety concerns of me and passengers seated next to me. 
Vistara is so called best airlines in India and is this their service? They have the most unprofessional, arrogant, rude Staff who lie and also bully the customers to get things done the way they want. The Staff do whatever they want and take advantage of the passengers’ desperate need to reach their destination on time and that too after having paid full fare. I have travelled extensively both within and outside India in many different airlines and I can definitely say that this has been my worst experience in terms of Ground Staff service.

title: Bad experience by ground staff
text:
I travel frequently within India and abroad. This particular incidence was not a major disappointment by an airline, however the attitude of ground staff made it one of the most memorable bad experiences. 
Date & Time: 21st November, 2021 around 4AM
Place: IGI Airport, Terminal 3, Domestic transfer
I just reached Delhi from a long-haul international flight and went to Vistara airline counter for my next domestic flight check-in. I had pre-booked all my access luggage and I was well within my purchased weight limit of 45Kg. However, the ground staff person handling the check-in process was so unaware of his own airlines’ rules and policies that all he cared about was charging me more money. Do they get a commission on the extra charges??? On top of that, this guy, let’s call him Mr. A, was so adversely trained in customer service, was very arrogant and adamant. He just didn’t care what I was explaining him. 
I literally had to bow down to his unfair demand, without which he refused to pass my luggage. Next, I went to cashier’s counter at the upper floor to make the payment. But luckily, I met this nice lady, Ms. L, who knew the rules and told me I don’t have to pay any more. She called Mr. A, downstairs and had to explain the rule quite a number of times. She also had to guide him how to navigate to the right screen in his system. Later I got a word that my luggage was released. However, least I knew, another round of bad experience was waiting for me.
After I reached my destination, Ranchi, found out my luggage was damaged. Why should I not assume that Mr. A had a role to play for my damage? Anyway, I made a complain of this and got a copy of Property Irregularity Report (PIR). For next two weeks, I was waiting to hear from the airline. But do you think the ground staff cares about travelers? So, I called the customer service. Found out, they had no information of the PIR so I explained them the situation again and my another wait begins.
What is so disheartening is, an airline which claims to be awarded with Best Airline, Best Domestic Airline and Favourite Domestic Airline etc. doesn’t train they ground staff well. The staff whom your customers meet first, even before experiencing the flight. 
Mr. Sia, Senior Vice President – Ground Services & Projects, should take a note of this. How can you have such ill-behaved people representing your business unit and the airline? People who hold grudge against your own customers. In a country where customer is regarded well and that too in a service industry? Have you ever experienced your services without letting the staff know of your position? Try it my Sia, you will be surprised.

title: An Unexpected and Pleasant Surprise!
text: I don’t normally write reviews of airlines as normally I view flights as something to be endured rather than enjoyed. For starters, the system automatically provides the details you used to buy the ticket. Hurrah! No endless typing of information the airline already has. So refreshing. Secondly, the baggage drop desk was so smooth. Vistara open the maximum number of desks to ensure short queues and have staff available to deal with difficult issues such as visa and COVID documentation checks. We breezed through in no time. Finally, the flight itself was very pleasant. Helpful cabin crew, modern decor, decent food and a good movie selection. I enjoyed the flight so much I have cancelled a flight next week with another airline and rebooked with Vistara. Highly recommended!

title: Horrible Customer Service, Like to Steal Money!
text:
I want to preface this and say I understand that covid and new restrictions have caused a whirlwind of changes and I understand that mess-ups can happen. That being said, this has to be the worst treatment I've ever received from an airline from their customer service and sales department. 

I booked two tickets via Expedia since we live in the US to fly from Pune to Delhi in premium economy. A few days earlier I received an email saying that my flight time I had changed, and I just ignored it. I was getting there earlier than I needed to so why make a big deal out of it.  This morning I receive an email saying that not only my flight times have changed again, but now they've lowered by class to economy. They did not attach a refund, or offer any type of explanation for it. I called Expedia, and the poor agent tried for get in touch with Vistara Customer service for over 2 hours and 30 minutes and finally told me that she couldn't get through to anyone at Vistara and I have to wait for a call back for a refund that Expedia may or may not be able to do.

So for next try I called the number Vistara provides on their website for Customers in the US. The first person I spoke to was named Marina, she told me she was not responsible for customer service issues and can't do anything and I needed to call an  Indian number. I tried to explain to her that considering I am calling from the US, I cannot call the Indian number as I would rack up International Fees and considering this process is taking hours of my time, it should not be on me to spend additional money fixing their mistake. I asked her to speak to a manager or someone else who could find another way to get this fixed promptly and not via email. She proceeded to yell at me, refused to transfer to a manager, and disconnected. Called again, as soon as she heard it was us disconnected again. Called again, another member of the vistara team, continued to yell at us, and refused to listen or help us in anyway. Finally for the 4th time Marina, came on the phone and told us she had emailed someone who will reach back to us and that was that. No sort of apology or understanding of the fact that Vistara is actively currently charging us a hire fare for our current seats.

So for my third attempt, I thought it would be just best to cancel/refund the reservation. Having traveled for work and leisure all over, I'm starting to feel as if this airline may not be the best and quite possibly is a scam. This time I called Expedia again. Again the agent spent over 1 hour and 30 minutes trying to get anyone from Vistara to talk to him so he could help process the refund. He could not. After trying for that long, the furthest he got to was talking to Marina, who once again ignored all of his requests and told him to "write an email". When he asked for a quicker solution, as this ticket would need to be rebooked and whatnot she didn't care.

I'm over 5 hours deep into this now, and I feel completely exhausted. I feel like this airline has stolen my money and has no remorse for it whatsoever. I've never had customer service reps treat me as badly as Vistara's have. I've never had an issue so simple need so long to resolved/at this point who knows if it will. For any international customers looking to book, stay away!! This airline is not interested in helping you fix their mistakes, it only wants your money.

title: Too much hype
text:
Heard so many great things about Vistara, but my first experience with them - AVERAGE....   

Bags check in - Since i was traveling from international location, i had to recheck in my bags after immigration. The lines were super long and chaotic. Covid times or not - it was inexcusable. Thankfully they let me jump the queue after requesting

Inflight - Not impressed at all. Boarding was a mess as usual. No food provided. Just a bottle of water. Seats were really tight with not much legroom. Even Air India got more legroom. There was no wifi...or i wasnt aware of it. 

Customer Service - Initially i was booked on business class, but then they changed the flight to be all economy. Since i was connecting after international travel, sent several emails about clarification on why am moved to economy and also if that impacted baggage allowance. Terrible customer service. All they did is sent standard template responses to go look at baggage rules !

Overall - just another average airline.

title: An utter disappointment
text:
Truly a disappointment - they don't live up to the name they have created via marketing campaigns. Except for the free WiFi (which will only last up to Nov 30), absolutely nothing about the experience was good.

Check-in queues are serpentine, with only two counters working, took over an hour to check-in. Food was pathetic, and the crew is least interested in making your flight comfortable. They are only there to serve you two stripped-down bare bone tasteless meals. NO snacks/savouries on the flight, no soft drinks, and no tea or coffee. When asked for soft drinks - the only response was we serve only beer or orange juice.

Coffee? No we don't serve hot beverages on this flight. And their website mentions proudly serving Starbucks at 35,000 feet. Clearly a sham!

Their seat pitch is on the lower side too - 31 inches. They have managed to cram up 299 seats across all three classes. (compared to Air India's 33-inch seat pitch and 239 passengers on the same aircraft type)

IFE selection was very limited and only a handful of movies was available.

I have had much better and warm experiences with Air India, never again flying Vistara on international routes. Too bad they might end up degrading Air India's in flight experience as well.
