title: Poor time compliance, poor boarding staff
text:
The flight was late by more than an hour, the handling of the delay was truly poor by the boarding staff. I wonder what makes the airline staff so rude and arrogant - perhaps it is the lack of a performance rating system so prevalent in ride-hailing services like Uber, Ola and most e-commerce retail and so completely missing in the airline industry.

The cockpit announcemeny by the pilot as well as cabin crew was unitelligible. In India, at one time, Kingfisher airlines did set the highest standards for such announcements, something that every other airline should have adopted as a good practice.

The quality of cutlery (provided in the food tray) was poor grade, the same tiny little bottle of water, the same rustic inflight experience that every economy class traveler has now come to tolerate in absence of a better standard.

I am disappointed and would not recommend Vistara as a preferred carrier.

She was very arrogant and argued continuously with us in the presence of other fellow passengers. This was a very harrasing moment for us. We repeatedly told her to check the meal preference list but without checking she told us that we have not mentioned any meal preference. As we told her we would not have any veg meal, she was not giving us any meal and was agreed to bring the complaint book for us. To control the awkward situation the other cabin staff confirmed that she was having six extra non veg meals. In spite of this, she tried to prove that there was no meal preference mentioned in the list but after seeing carefully she confirmed that we had non veg meal preference and said she will manage to serve us any how. This type of harassment was not expected from a renowned airways. It can ruin the image/goodwill of Vistara.

title: Competent but expected better
text:
We took this flight with high expectations due to the reviews that Vistara had. Indeed the experience was one of a competent airline. The plane was clean, flight was on time. The boarding process was efficient. While other airlines simply announce boarding process, Vistara organized passengers into different lines based on seat number and the process was very smooth. The food was reasonable too. Indeed it is much better than budget airline experience.

However, overall we expected better. Occasionally we felt the cabin crew could have been a bit more polite with some of the passengers. I understand that passengers can also be difficult at times, still it could have been better. Our own interaction with the cabin crew was also not satisfactory on a couple of occasions, but another member of the crew did well and got us what we wanted (some hot water), so thanks for that! So perhaps the cabin crew can be urged to give more uniform high quality service, rather than with significant variation from person to person.

Overall: Good, but can be better (especially with Tata and SIA lineage!)

title: Grace

title: unprofessional, unhelpful - made us miss flight by giving wrong gate info, then charged Rs 7000 extra as penalty
text:
Had the worst experience with them. They had a last minute gate change at Delhi airport, and their check in staff gave us incorrect information on the gate, saying it’s gate 37, despite the fact that it had already changed to gate 45. At gate 37, there was no Vistara staff to let us know the gate had changed. We ended up reaching gate 45 only 2 mins after the gate closed and they refused to let us board, even though the flight wouldn’t take off for the next 15 minutes. We missed the flight in the process. 
Then Vistara representatives (specifically the manager Sudhir at Delhi Airport) were AWFUL about the situation, getting us on the next flight to Bombay at an extra cost of 3500 rupees per person, as a penalty for if passengers fail to make it to their gate. They refused to acknowledge the mistakes from their side, saying the extra cost was company policy. For their failure to inform us properly about last minute gate changes, we had to pay 7000 rupees extra (for 2 people), and they made absolutely no effort to try to reduce the cost. Their only interest was in saving their own skins and sucking money out of their customers, despite their own inefficiency.

Then the pilot had the guts to stay the level of flight turbulence was normal! Passengers were in tears and people were fearful of their lives. Honestly the weather was not that bad! Having been on aircraft managing stormy weather in Central America and Middle East, as well as harsh conditions in Canada and Iceland, I am severely disappointed in thr competence of this airline. Would not fly again with this airline! I would advice against it.

title: Best airline experience
text:
Being a frequent flyer I would say this trip was the best I've ever experienced. I have travelled with several airlines but this was the first with Vistara.
When I heard that Vistara was a colloboration between TATA and Singapore Airlines my expectations were high and the airlines fullfilled it.

1) They had wonderful leg space which was much better than other airlines even in the economy class

2) They served a wonderful breakfast. Being a vegetarian I was served Upma , Sambar Vada , Cut fruits , Bun with butter and Coffee/ Tea as . Though these are usual dishes served in other aircrafts Id say that this was the tastiest.

3) Smooth take off and landing. I never even felt like the flight was taking off or landing. I've had terrible experiences in some airlines where an ordinary landing felt like a Crash landing.

4) Kind and friendly inflight crew

5) They kept their time as said.

I would definitely wish to travel again in Vistara. Hope they increase the number of destinations especially in the south and start adding international destinations.

title: Mosquitoes? But otherwise good
text:
This flight was scheduled to depart Indira Gandhi International Airport (Terminal 3) at 11:10 AM, but got delayed by about half an hour. Shortly after everybody had boarded, the captain apologized for the delay and assured us that we would probably be able to land on time. He also warned us that because of the prevailing monsoon, turbulence could be expected. 

The good news? Not only was there little turbulence (some, but not as bad as I’d feared), we actually touched down in Goa about fifteen minutes before the ETA! Kudos to Vistara for that. 

Leg room was ample, and the cabin crew I interacted with were pleasant and efficient. Ticket fare included a meal: I opted for the non-vegetarian meal, which included steamed rice, rajma, chicken butter masala, a bread roll with butter, and a large cube of cake. The rajma was surprisingly (pleasantly!) homey, the chicken butter masala a little spicy but not bad, and the cake okay. 

My one problem with the flight was that I found myself being bitten by insects. I was dozing after the meal, and kept being nipped by something—mosquitoes?—I don’t know, from my neck down to my ankles. 

Other than that, a good flight.

title: Hope it remains good
text:

The service on board was excellent, Special mention for Ms. Priyadarshini and her colleagues Imli Kokla, Sarita, Mallika and Nitya for hospitality and service with a smile. Keep it up and let some of the others learn too. The pilots made a perfect landing without any jerks and bumps which are not good for a passenger like me. I hope Vistatra will progress and remain good and not resort to cutting corners which some of the other airlines are doing.
Col. Ravinder Khera

title: I recommend Vistara

title: Rude staff, no knowledge of their own policies and manager has no clue. Complaining to regulatory body
text:
Disgusting service. Rude and pathetic staff at the airport. Think they have power over customers.

I booked my flight in February 2018 before they changed their excess baggage policy in March 2018. I was reassured by their telephone representative that thee airline has a duty to honour the same baggage allowance as my onward flight from Delhi to London provided it is within 24 hours of my Air Vistara Flight from Amritsar to Delhi. I had a telephone recording of the conversation as proof.

I arrived at Amritsar Airport and they made me pay for my excess baggage despite me having proof that they shouldn't and that I booked my ticket prior to their baggage policy being changed. It cost me nearly 14,000 Indian Rupees to pay on the spot, otherwise I would have missed my onward international flight from Delhi to London.

The incompetent Air Vistara staff at Amritsar Airport had me and my mother who was travelling with me call my travel agent in London on an out of hours telephone number as they did not understand my international flight details when presented to them (that is not my fault). Their manager was just as incompetent as his colleagues I dealt with. 

I have not received an apology for the treatment I received from Air Vistate staff. They have paid my back the money charged me for excess baggage however I was charged by my UK Bank to use my card for the payment at the airport, and myself and my mother were charged by our British mobile phone providers for the phone calls to the travel agent at the request of Air Vistatra staff, as a result of their inadeqyate training.

I have today reached out to Air Sewa to recover the nearly 8,000 Indian Rupees still owed to me by the airline, who treat international customers as a joke.

Good luck competing on the international stage with your incompetent staff!

Never again would I use this airline...I have used Jet and Air India to travel from Amritsar to Delhi many times and I will be sticking to those airlines in future.

title: Luxuries Harrassment by airline staff
text:
...Though its a Big name in the industry specially when it comes to Quality of service, which in no way is BAD, but the Airline staff is Rude & at times seems Harassing Public. 

As my flight started from Mumbai, I was comfortably watching a video on my Ipad when suddenly the air-hostess came & asked me to switch off my I-phone, I-pad & MP3 music player as using it in flight is not allowed. When i told them that I-pad is wifi only & there is no network communication & I-phone + I-pad both are already on flight mode, they didnt agree & asked me to switch those off else action would be taken against me.

title: Thai Flight attendant with huge attitude
text:
I'm a regular with Vistara and prefer flying with them over other airlines due to their fabulous service and connectivity. However this time flying back from Mumbai i had the worst experience flying vistara. 

There was a Thai Flight attendant who was extremely rude and curt in her responses to not only me but other passengers as well. I had to request to talk to the Flight Purser to get the situation resolved .

Another passenger was being loud and watching movies on his iPad without headphones and was not even wearing his seatbelt. Being disturbed by the loud noise i requested the flight attendant to move to another seat that was empty and was denied it saying someone else was coming to it. We were airborne and i asked how could someone board the plane if we are airborne. She just smiled and walked away. I again requested that she either address the noisy passenger or allow me to move to another seat. She told me that if i wanted to move to premium economy i could but i'd have to pay for the seat. The manner in which she said it was taunting and then said so you wanna pay or not.  I requested to talk to the purser and got my seat changed to avoid any disturbance. 

So since when does vistara not care for other passengers and show attitude like that thai flight attendant. Also how can Vistara even take off and violate FAA rules when a passenger is refusing to put on a seatbelt and playing movies without headphones. Shouldn't that passenger be deboarded ?

title: Too good

title: Very Courteous and comfortable
text: I have travelled atleast 3-4 times now. Everytime I have been delighted to say the least. The crew have gone the extra mile, to see that we are comfortable. title: Backed by Tata and groomed by Singapore Airlines to excellence
text: This was the best flight of my life till date. Separate check in counters and boarding lanes for Business, Premium Economy and Economy. Ground services were just awesome. I suggest, travel Premium Economy which offers unmatched benefits and also the cost is little more than Economy. Foods were served for free accompanied by one soft drink and Starbucks coffee. Choice of meals were also there. At Kolkata, luggage was delivered on priority since I travelled Premium Economy. Only disadvantage is that, they do not offer On board entertainment but that too will be shortly implemented, after all they are the youngest in Indian aviation. Fly with Vistara at least once and then you will understand the difference with other carriers.

title: Vistara Economy Class from Chennai to Kolkata (MAA-CCU) Review
text:
I have been waiting to fly with Vistara to experience fly the new feeling. This tagline of Vistara brings more curiosity in me to try it. I was returning from Chennai to Kolkata so planned of booking Vistara tickets. Here Vistara Economy Class review MAA-CUU.

Vistara, the new full-service Indian carrier that is a joint venture between Tata Group of India and Singapore Airlines, took to the skies yesterday. I have been looking forward to this for a very long time, since Vistara has promised to keep differentiated service as a cornerstone of their strategy.

Vistara UK 731
Vistara UK731 at Chennai Airport

Booking- Now I started looking for tickets on different websites. At first I saw at Vistara official website but it was showing too costly than the other airline ticket booking sites. Firstly I visited Cleartrip there was no offer. Then I visited MakeMyTrip I got an offer paying via PayPal I would get discount of Rs.800 + ICICI bank debit/ credit card cash back offers. Then I quickly booked proceeded with the booking on MMT. And they emailed me the tickets within few minutes.Overall it takes less than 10 minutes and the process is really smooth.
Flight no : Air Vistara UK 731 
Aircraft Type : Airbus A320
Route : MAA- CCU 
Dep: 6:20pm & Arr: 8:40pm
Seat : 7a (window )
Meal service: Evening Snacks
Revenue ticket : Rs. 7200
I paid: Rs. 2990 ( MakeMyTrip Discount + ICICI credit/Debit card offers)
Vistara Business Class – Ground Experience:

#1. Dedicated CheckIn 

I arrived at the Chennai airport 3 hours prior to departure , which I generally do. I spend time trying Lounges facilities and roam around the airport. The checkin started for the Vistara flight MAA-CUU. I approached to the counter , there was separate counter for the Vistara Club Members . So the checkin process was done quickly and I got the boarding pass within minutes. 

#2 . Security – No Fast track lane:

After getting the boarding pass I quickly approached towards security hold , done with my security checks and then had some soft drinks from self service counter( where you put the money in machine mention which drinks you want, it automatically comes) . In the meanwhile I got message on my phone from vistara that flight has been delayed . The actual departure time of flight was 5:50pm but it was late and it departed at 6:30pm. The flight

text:

title: Commendable Service
text:
I had a last minute change in my itinerary and hence had to visit my sister in Bhubaneswar. Booked the tickets from Vistara website wherein the navigation was easy.
Arrived in T3 terminal through Air Arabia from Sharjah and breezed in to the Domestic Terminal.
The check was Super Fast and my luggage tagged to priority. The boarding pass invited us to the lounge near Gate No 41. At the Vistara Lounge the reception was Top Class with Professional / Service oriented staff ( The spoon and fork were delivered to my table with a bow). The spread was heart warming .. Hot Conjeevaram Idlis served with 3 types of chutney, Sambar and Idli podi. The buffet also featured tasty Upma, parantha with aloo, scrambled eggs, fruit platter, corn flakes and a host of pastries ( brownie was mouth watering). Ambience was quite good with all type of seating to choose from.
Departure was announced and the boarding was efficient. Yashika, Anshika and the Hostess team received every one with a warm greeting, regardless of the class of travel.
Yashika was quick to notice the weary traveller in me and hence did not waste any time to support me with a cup of water and cold towel. 
Due to the overnight travel was not interested in the breakfast offering and was inclined to doze off.. But a cursory look at the menu card tempted me to request a breakfast.. and I did make a good decision. Fruit platter included Kiwi, the paneer was nicely diced and served (not the standard cubes) along with the paranthas. Curd went off smoothly and was offered bread and croissants. Surprise addition was Starbucks coffee made from Coorg Arabica beans ( but the temperature was lukewarm).
Then I started to browse the newspapers ( as I had to update myself for my next 10 day stay in India).
Yashika offered my periodicals also and hence my day was made!!!
Himanshu piloted the A320 Neo among the clouds during descent ably and we had a safe landing on time. 
Had a rewarding experience during my Maiden Flight in Vistara.. Young and Dynamic team will take Vistara to New Heights!!!!
God Bless
Mano

title: They keep raising the bar, flight after flight.
text:
A disclaimer right at the beginning. I am a Platinum Member of their frequent flyer programme and have been so for two years now. Therefore my bias for this airline is obvious. When I share my very positive experiences with Vistara with friends and family, they invariably suggest that I write about my trips. So finally here I am. Inspite of my obvious bias, I will try to be objective as I pen these few lines. 

Vistara is the only Indian domestic airline which offers Premium Economy. Same 3+3 layout as Economy on their A320s but with a bit more generous legroom. Their Economy seats have a pitch of 31" with a recline of 3.5" although I suspect the extreme rear rows may have a slightly less pitch. The Premium Economy seats have a pitch of 33" with a recline of 4.5". Those extra couple of inches does make a huge difference.

Reached Kolkata airport at about 6 am for my 7.05 am flight to Delhi. Had checked in online the previous night. Being a Platinum Member they offer complimentary lounge access and the online boarding pass mentioned the lounge invitation. However, as happens often times, there never is time to pop into the lounge. Went straight through security and to the boarding gate. Picking up a cup of tea on the way. 

Vistara boarding is always an organised affair. I really can't put a finger on what they do different but there never is the kind of melee that you see around boarding gates of most other airlines. They started boarding at 6.24 am. We were bussed to a distant stand. Quite a few minutes of bus ride. To a very far stand beyond the old terminal building.

Now, if I have one complain with Vistara and indeed with most other airlines, is that the first flight out of the day is always from a non-aerobridge stand. The planes that come in late on the previous night are parked at stands away from the terminal. Every airline that does that, seems to avoid the expenditure of getting the aircraft to an aerobridge gate for the first flight out the next morning. Instead they subject you to an uncomfortable crowded bus ride. Vistara also does the same. 

Boarding was quick and orderly. The welcoming cold towel (hot in winters) is always a nice touch. Then they handed over the breakfast menu. Another nice touch. A round of water. Boarding complete and doors close at 6.50 am, well before scheduled 7.05 am departure. 

Then the Government owned Kolkata Airport's inefficiency took over. It wasn't till 7.06 am that we were pushed back. And another 10 mins odd before we were airborne. 20/25 mins on the ground after doors closed? Nah, that sort of thing seems to happen only at Indian airports. I don't know who is to be blamed.

I always enjoy the nice clean interiors, the new planes, very comfortable seats, the rather different purple and gold colour scheme. Even the cabin crew wears a purple and gold uniform. I always see the lady cabin crews wearing a similar metallic gold watch and pearl ear studs which go very well with the purple uniform. Haven't seen any other airline standardising the accessories that go with the uniform. That's a real neat touch.

Breakfast time a little later. Meals are always a pleasurable affair on Vistara. I am a hardcore non vegetarian but could not resist the Sabudana Khicdi and Medu Vada in Sambhar that morning. Awesome. Some of the meals I have had on Vistara were memorable. But more of that later. The Starbucks coffee they serve in Business and Premium Economy is another first. Imagine pricey Starbucks coffee on an aircraft! 

We were over Delhi well in time but were then a victim to the usual early morning congestion that's routine at Delhi. Inspite of that we were on the ground a couple of minutes earlier than the scheduled 9.25 am arrival. Aerobridge connected quickly and I was off the aircraft at 9.34 am. Very happy.

Vistara seems to be setting a new bench mark in Indian domestic aviation. I sure do hope they maintain that standard.

title: The best option available in India today
text:
As on date this low cost airline operating in India is the best available option compared to the several other airlines. 

I traveled  twice by this airline first from new Delhi to Kochi and then from Kochi to New Delhi after a fortnight both times the flight took off in time and landed in time . The airline also provides snacks and meals cost of which is included in the ticket. 

In most other similar airlines I had traveled before one had to buy one's meals at inflated prices.

The seats were spaced reasonably good and I did not feel cramped as I felt in other airlines.  However mind you many - not all economy seats - do not have lean back seats. On a three hour flight a lean back seat affords slightly improved comfort . On this flight my wife and I had seat No. 09A and 09B and both were non reclining seats.

The cabin crew however was gracious enough to shift us to another set row with reclining seats.

The cabin service was also good .

I recommend this airline all

title: Best Airlines But needs small improvements

This time i would like to say the management to improve on the meal or the snacks served during the flight. I had the Non veg puff and it was damn Soggy. it seems like it was lying with them for hours and they heated up and served us.This is not the standard of Vistara as i know. Also most of the passengers were asking for the spoon and it was not available with the inflight attendants. 
Would like to mention the name of Ms. claire (hope i got the name right)was kind enough to listen to me as she asked whats wrong when i asked for the feedback form. she was kind enough to get me the business class meal,but as i was not feeling like i did not had. also to let you know that there was a old lady sitting besides me and she was alone. the hostess Claire went again and again and kept her asking if she needs anything as the old lady didn't even had a bottle of water during the flight. this is what the hospitality is and i appreciate her gesture.
Do improve on the meal part and rest you are always the best. Again coming to your flight on 24th May to Varanasi. See you soon :)

title: Excellent hospitality
text:
Vistara knows the meaning of hospitality which others have forgotten. Airline business is an essential part of travel and tours and hospitality is key to success. 
The website, mobile app and the customer care are all excellent and customer friendly. The check in was smooth, got an upgrade to business using my complimentary voucher thanks to CV. Upgraded my son's ticket too by paying. 
Food, beverages and cleanliness was excellent too. Thanks to Kusang, Lhouvino, Chaitali, Sahiba and Burhan. 
Unfortunately the last leg of journey was troubling as in my opinion the pilot erred in landing. A major disaster was averted at the last seconds, the wheels were maybe seconds from touching tarmac when it was airborne again abruptly, taken to great height and landed back after 15 minutes. Pilot blamed the winds but it was a case of higher speed and altitude during touchdown. A major mistake in my opinion. 
All's well that ends well....Thank you Almighty

title: Vistara Airlines - A Full service alternative airline in India
text:
On 6/5/18, I took a Mumbai -Delhi flight on Vistara Airlines ( uk 902). Being a platinum member of Jet Airways frequent flyer programme for almost a decade and having used Jet Airways almost as a default choice for a quarter century ( ever since its inception), I was keen to fly on Vistara for comparative study.
Web check in through mobile app failed but was  successful  via their website opened on desktop. Lady at check in counter was efficient and helpful, the process was slightly better than usual experience with Jet.The Vistara aircraft appeared slightly more tidier and specious. It was probably due to less than 100% occupancy. Seats appeared a bit more comfortable.
Food quantity and quality was similar. Quality of in flight announcements was similar and uniform and smartness was similar and mediocre.
Overall marginally better experience than Jet Airways.

title: WOW

title: Love Flying with Vistara!
text: This is the fourth time I flew with Vistara and I must say the experience is incredible each time. Their focus on passenger comfort and customer service is commendable. The flight  departure and arrival was on time and included smooth take off and landing. Our flight to Delhi was via Srinagar and the weather was pretty cloudy. However, the plane was capable enough to handle the turbulence level. I'm a frequent flyer and I can very well recognise this technical difference. The plane was clean and smelled good with mild fresheners they must have used. There was ample leg space and that really matters for tall people like me and my brother. The food was amazing in taste and quality. The staff was polite and on their toes to help people. Vistara will always be my first choice in flying. They're doing a fantabulous job! :)

title: The Brand Promise Seems to have a Problem!
text: Flew to Kolkata on 10th April under the Senior Citizen Category( no discounts or special rates there) thinking that some seating consideration would be shown to people of our age. But Surprise Surprise what we got in Row 9 was non-reclining seats which are just not mentioned on the Reservation System. That together with tiny seats, probably among the world"s smallest meant that I would break my back by the time we got to the City of Joy. So had to beg our Cabin Attendant to shift our seats even on extra payment. A couple of helpful fellow passengers helped out. But what is this talk of Luxury in the Skies by Singapore Airlines and the Tatas when the seat in Economy is so tiny. Watch out Seniors! I will travel on Vistara only in Premium Economy where the seat is small but comfortable. And Seniors, book without saying you are a Senior because they're not giving you any special consideration for that.

title: Love to fly Vistara but is it slipping in service?
text: Its always a pleasure travelling Air Vistara.  The experience is great right from check in to arrival at your destination.  Polite and helpful staff, great meals and comfortable seating whether in Economy or Business Class.  However, during this flight I somehow got the impression that something was lacking during the inflight service.  The stewardesses were either ill equipped to handle the crowd.  The meal was also somehow not up to the mark.  There was a big corporate group travelling and the meal was most probably customised for them.   Many airlines start in a great way and then slip in services.  Hope this doesn't happen to this airline.  The flight prices too are also rising very rapidly and the promised points for members are not always added

title: UDF refund
text: I traveled from delhi to pune on vistara. I got my tickets from make my trip, I have been asking for UDF refund for last app six months, make my trip is putting on Vistara and Vistara says, contact your travel agents. I am being asked to wait more. It was not a good experience with Vistara and make my trip. Still waiting for my refund.

title: A pleasant flight
text:
Mumbai Delhi is a regular sector for me and for a change I pulled up Vistara instead of Jet Airways due to timing preference. Since both operate from T2 at Mumbai and land at T3 at Delhi (both international airports) made sense to me. 

The seats in economy class is descently spaced with legroom enough for a person to rest. 

The food served was much better in quality than Jet Airways. The landing and take off was smooth too. 

Would love to travel by Vistara over Jet instead of the better miles I carry with Jet.

title: Good flight experience
text: Restaurant style food, extra leg space, packaged drinking water, humble air staff, easy booking facilities, premium economy class for business class and easy web check in facility are some of the key factors why Vistara airlines stands out among other Indian airline brands.

title: good but delayed experience :)
text:
Vistara is a wonderful airline, the staff is cheerful and helpful. This was the first time i booked this airline because their flight timings were better compared to other airlines though it  was more expensive than the others.I was flying Bombay-Delhi-Srinagar  and back. My only problem with them was THEY RESCHEDULED THE FLIGHTS 3 TIMES, that too only one sector. It was like i haven't reached Delhi yet and my connecting flight has already taken off. This was very stressful for me.
 But i am going to give them one more chance. I will fly Vistara again and hopefully my experience will be better :)

title: Enjoyed our flight
text: This is the first time my wife and I flew with Vistara Airlines, and we loved it. The lounge at the Delhi airport was excellent (we wish they had something available at the Amritsar airport for the return flight). The seats in business class are very comfortable. We were delighted with the food and quality of inflight service.

title: Mismanaged traveller information on meals. Rude hostess.
text:
Everything went perfect till boarding gate. The staff was helpful and adjusted our requirements as we were a large group of 7 people including women and children.

The guy on the boarding gate was rude and irritated when asked that would it be possible to board the plane on priority as we had cranky children with women in our group. Secondly after mentioning child meal plan and getting written and oral confirmation from your airline still there was no child meal. 

The hostess didn't even offer us water for 20 mins including the time where service was conducted. Coffee is worthless as creamer based black coffee  made into brown coffee is the worst I've had in years.

The person from north east of Indian origin presumably the senior hostess had rudeness written all over her face and actions. Some alter ego she had. Didn't get her name or would have surely mentioned it here.

All in all a below average experience compared to indigo and spicejet. 

The only plus was the aeroplane type, design and seating. Also for the same price as an indigo in the same sector it was worth it. The pilots ability to handle the plane was good but sorry to say no ability to have a dialogue with his / her passengers.

I didn't like it.

Thanks a million for keeping me alive mid air.

title: Best domestic airline !!!
text: Vistara like my last trip from Pune to delhi was amazing even this time.The flight was very relaxing,great service and lovely food .The timings especially are very convenient since it's let's you spend half a day and a wonderful lunch in Amritsar and then head to airport to board the flight to mumbai !!!Try taking a seat on the left hand of aircraft to get an Ariel glimpse of the Golden temple !!!

but the connections to major cities are still not there, kindly keep same seating which is really convinient

title: Better then Competetion but improvement is needed
text:
Onward flight to BLR was good but the return flight staff was less copperating. In case of turbulence the flight staff normally suspends the distribution of the food/drinks but they continued to serve everything to Premium Economy and Business but in the Economy, we had to wait for 30 minutes just to have water. Same goes when the plain was on ground, requested water during the onboarding but received the same post the flight has taken off.
As i did not had any food, requested for a cup of tea, but even after asking multiple times, i did not even receive the same for the entire duration of the flight.

title: Very good Airline with untrained cabin crew
text: I am Jet Platinum member and usually travel by Jet.  This is second time I traveled with Vistara. Airline is very good with best food and service compared to other Airlines. However I was completely astonished and disappointed with Cabin Crew attitude. I being thirsty wanted water, which was not given instantly. Not a big issue as during take on and take off it may be possible. However when cabin girl came with food cart I just picked up a bottle of water from cart top, which is usual and followed by a smile of cabin girl. To my utter surprise the cabin girl virtually snatched water bottle from my hand and said you can not take like this and then gave me after some time when cart came to my seat. Although I can not say she misbehaved with me but Vistara need to train its cabin staff for proper and decent behaviour.

title: Best Airline-Setting Benchmarks-Unbeatable & Unmatchable & Unparalleled
text: Thank you Vistara for awesome experience. Ms Priya issued me the boarding pass. She looked into every minute detail like whether the luggage contain any fragile items. Such was the check in counter experience. The boarding and in-flight experience in the industry is unparalleled and this level will act as the benchmark for other airline companies in India to follow. We thank you Mr. Ratan Tata who has taken the initiative with venturing with Singapore Airlines to commence the airline operations and provide highest standard of service. The food, ambience and the courteous & politeness of the crew like Ms Bhumika, Payal and the inflight supervisor (cannot recall her name) were exemplary.

title: My first Vistara experience to Leh!

title: The best airlines I have travelled so far!

title: Good feeling when you fly with Visatara, excellent Food

Inside ambience is dark, feels heavy. title: Never Fly Vistara Airlines if You Can Help It!
text:
From beginning to end- this airline was a complete nightmare. 

1. Rude, inefficient, could-care-less counter agents
2. Because I was slightly over the 24 hr periods since my international flight, my 30 kg bag cost an addition $185 because of the 15 kg domestic weight limit (try flying with 2 weeks of suits for business for 15 kgs)
3. Having to go to a separate cashier to pay for the excess baggage took an additional 45 minutes to the long check-in; barely making it to the flight;
4. Rude clumsy security guards opened my carry-on spilling two gifts to the floor shattering them- not even an apology;
5. Cattlecall boarding with rude people butting in line and gate agents not caring at all

And to top it off- 
6. They LOST my bag on a direct flight with all suits and shirts and toiletries for my work the next day. Baggage claim was horrific and bureaucratic and I still don’t have my checked suitcase (for which I paid extra). No offer to bring my bag to my hotel the next day when it was scheduled to arrive “you’ll have to pick it up at the ticket counter.”
7.  After involving US Embassy to get Vistara to bring my bag from Dehli to Bungaluru; the bag arrived at the hotel - it looked as if it had been turned completely upside down and emptied out.  Missing were my extra iPhone case, power cables, my waterproof iPhone case.  My extra kit for medicines had been gone through and antibiotics taken.  The zipper of the suitcase had been pried open and the zipper broken so you couldn't seal the suitcase completely, and one of the four wheels had been destroyed (I had to throw it away).  Our belief is that this probably occurred because the suitcase sat overnight in the Delhi airport and Vistara had not locked it away for safe keeping.

NEVER ever again. We took Indigo and Jet Airways for other flights internal to India and had none of these issues.  You have several alternative airlines to use for these routes in India. I would recommend using them.

title: Good experience

title: Comfortable

Menu was more suitable for lunch rather than evening snack as it was a 4:15 pm flight. the best part was the leg room in the economy class! title: Great Airline

The crew of the airlines was helpful.  Breakfast meal provided in flight was average in terms of taste and the quantity was just adequate.

title: Does Two Cookies make Vistara a "Full Service Carrier" ?
text:

If food is the differentiator between a  " low cost airline" and a "full service carrier" then I think two cookies is all what differentiates Vistara from Spicejet / Indigo & GoAir !! 
Maybe Vistara management can read this review with  "A pinch of Tata Salt" !!

title: Service with a Smile

title: One of the best Domestic airline in India

title: Rude behavior of Vistara's Ground staff
text: We travelled from Kochi (Cochin) to Delhi on Vistara Flight UK 882 on 25.03.2018 . We had a consumed Chivas Regal liquor bottle in our check in baggage, which had around 150 ml of alcohol. At CIAL (Kochi) airport, as per the direction of a Vistara ground staff, when we scanned our check in baggage in the Vistara X-ray counter, he did not allow us to carry the liquor bottle. We told him that it is not in our hand baggage and we have tightly sealed and secured the bottle, so that it won’t spill. We also had perfume in a glass bottle. He did not create any problem regarding that. He only had a problem with the Chivas regal bottle. He asked to put it in the dust bin. We suspect that because it was an expensive liquor, he wanted to take it from us. If he wanted that, he could have asked me for a new bottle and I would be happy to buy him a new one. I told him that I have carried open liquor bottles several times in both domestic as well as international flights and there was no problem at all. Another CIAL staff told him that it is permitted to carry the bottle. But he was so adamant and arrogant and did not allow us to take it. Later when we checked with CISF staff as well as other Vistara staff in Kochi and Delhi, they told that we can carry consumed liquor bottle in our check in baggage in a manner that it won’t spill in our baggage. The Vistara staff at the Kochi airport X-ray counter unnecessarily created a problem for us. We lost so much time because of this and created unnecessary tension in our pleasure trip. Is this the way Vistara treats their customers. This type of rude and arrogant staff should be thrown out of the organization. Please take necessary action so that this kind of issues won’t happen again.

title: The best domestic airline in India
text:
The premium economy is great value if your travel dates are flexible. Excellent food and service. Lounge access in Delhi T3 and Mumbai T2 at Rs 600 is worth it. 20 kg check in baggage allowance. Priority baggage clearance a big plus.
Only downside is the limited flights and route options.

title: Satisfactory service

title: Good seating...

title: Worst. Experience

title: Ontime, excellent cabin service
text:

title: Flying High with Vistara
text: New airline, great service well maintained and had a very fresh look. Food service was there though short flight and was upto the mark. Staff was very cordial. Can be your option if you choose to fly their route.

title: its normal airline, with a new taste
text: airline service is good, along with descent complimentary meals, but the segregation for air vistara members, they only have preference if you have gold membership, the lower tier are just ignored

title: Good Choice for Traveling in India
text:
First time trying out this 4 years old airline which also happens to be a joint venture between Tata and Singapore Airlines. Besides this leg, was also on Mumbai to Delhi leg 2 days prior. 

Compared to Jet Airways, aircraft seems comparable though the last time I took Jet Airways in 2016 on domestic, the aircraft seems newer for Jet.

Service wise, obviously the staff are trained by SIA/Silk Air team and it feels like you are on Silk Air. 

Food wise, portion bigger than Jet Airways if I remember correctly. Taste wise is quite normal for economy. 

Being a Krisflyer member (just normal level), my baggage was tagged priority as Premium Economy passenger. The ground staff at Mumbai even stamped priority on my boarding pass and told me I could board with the Premium Economy group. Although this did not help much as most already boarded when I was at the gate. 

Interestingly, from Delhi to Bangalore, I did not get above. However, during boarding I saw the economy queue was quite long and I walked over to the priority lane and ask nicely if I could board first as a Krisflyer member and the agent say to go ahead. 

It will be nice though if I can get points for my booking class which I checked sadly no.

title: Good leg room tasty food Good service
text: The seats were good.leg room was better than normal flights.food served was tasty but i thought the quantity could have been a little more.although I saw people ask for more and were given if they had any left.Tea coffee was served in the end.I had one stop between Lucknow to Chennai (Delhi) Service was good as well.

title: Maiden flight on Vistara

title: Sandeep
text: Very very disappointed with the way staff behaved!! I travelled with my 76 year old mother in business class from Goa to Delhi on Uk 884 on 13th March 2018. We were seated on 1A and 1C. I completely fail to understand the reason for this behaviour. It has left such a bad impact on us and I don’t have words how I felt despite spending so much she did  not even a basic courtesy to a senior citizen. The crew in general was very very slow and were just busy chatting. I have never experinced anything like this before where the crew was so lazy and completely not bothered. I pressed attendants button atlest thrice and no one turned up. It’s unbelievable how careless the crew can be. I sincerely hope a reputed airline like your will take some serious action and in future no senior citizen will go through the humiliation which my mother did today.

title: Perfect in every aspect
text:

Aircraft was clean and borading was done smoothly. Cabin crew came first and personally explained safety procedures as there's an additional belt for infants.

Very smooth landing and prior info about baggage belt. Since I availed Vistara direct services (applicable when you book on their site or app) got priority service and baggage came quickly.

Overall a breath of fresh air in service. Much better than jet airways and others. 

Will only use them for future trips !!

title: Excellent
text: I travelled in the premium economy segment and it was a pleasant experience. The meal served was tasty. Leg space provided is excellent. They also served Starbucks coffee on-board. Moreover the crew was very cooperative. Just loved the experience.

title: Good Value, Nice Cuisine
text: Good legroom with comfortable seats, hospitable staff and nice service with good options for food on board. The delay in getting the Frequent flier registration which was done at IGI by the staff could be improved..

text: Travelled from Mumbai to Delhi recently. Feasted on more than sufficient quantity of food and was so delicious too. The flight attendants greeted me with a warm and pleasant smile. I truly had a great time

title: Excellent service
text: Excellent service. Caring and considerate staff. We were pleased with the generous baggage allowance policy for international travellers. Within 7 days of international travel, baggage allowance  for international travel still applies on the domestic travel.

title: " Very comfortable"

title: Deceptive behavior, refrain from travelling
text: Quite deceptive airlines, call center staff advised we can carry weight that we carried from with Singapore Airlines - Premium economy (which was 35kg) and despite booking premium with Vistara "Crook" Airline, airport staff ask for extra money and say call center staff do not know the rules and irony is call center staff do booking over the phone and the airline rules do not sync up. title: Really comfortable
text:
Totally loved my experience with Vistara Airlines. The seats are comfortable. They provide complimentary meal to all their passengers ( the price is included in the ticket fair ) the food was good. 
The staff is always ready to assist with a smiling face. The whole vibe was comforting.

title: Truly it's a new feeling
text:
When flying on domestic routes my first preference used to be Jet Airways but when I tried Vistara for the first time on a Delhi-Pune route everything changed and I have been choosing Vistara as my preferred airlines on domestic routes.

Vistara is a Tata-Singapore Airlines joint venture and one can expect both class and competitive pricing. Vistara has an all Airbus 320 fleet and are introducing the 320 Neo and Bengaluru to Delhi is one such route where Vistara flies their new 320 neo aircrafts.

Check-in and Boarding Experience:

The best part is that I had Vistara Silver club membership which came with a complimentary class upgrade so at the check-in counter I got an upgrade from economy to premium economy. Now premium economy has it's advantages like priority luggage tags applied, priority boarding etc. 

Vistara flight was on time and got quick access to the plane through priority lane and was greeted by cabin crew. 

On Board Experience:

As expected premium economy seats had extra leg rooms, came with a soft pillow as well. The new 320 neo had mood lightning so it truly was refreshing.

Vistara has a menu for premium economy and offers some really good dinner on board. They also serve Starbucks coffee in this class which was good. Food quality and quantity were both appreciable. Good job in that department.

Overall a nice experience on board and we reached before time.

Deboarding Experience:

The best part is that in Delhi Vistara operates from T3 terminal and on this terminal arrival experience is like a cake walk. Due to priority tags the luggage arrived too early that it was taking a second round on the conveyor belt. 

Final Thoughts:

Flying Vistara was truly a new feeling and I am waiting for Vistara to start its international operations soon. Also, I have seen that it seems to be the only airlines which provides special assistance to female travellers in terms of allocating good seats and helping with the baggage pick-up to arranging a taxi.

title: Emerging airline with has much to improve
text: Less leg space. Average breakfast. Upma was slightly burnt. Inexperienced cabin crew who were always running for time. Nowhere close to Singapore Airlines crew efficiency. Not sure how they will manage in an emergency. I will prefer Air India for leg space , food and cabin crew efficiency.

title: comfortable flying

title: Best flight for any domestic fly zone
text: Vistara is best flight available on this route. The legroom & seat cushions provided in the flight make your journey comfortable and joyful. Also, the staff is courteous and serves lovely food. Last but important is that they are almost always punctual.

title: Excellent

title: The New to Fly in India

title: Very good service
text: It was my first time with vistara and I was amazed at there service and the quality of comfort. Cabin crew was very kind and helpfull. Over all a very good company and will suerly book a international travel with them.

title: Feel Premium! Fly Vistara!
text: The class of service offered is amazing. The food served is also awesome and different from traditional buns & butter.The flight punctuality is maintained. The journey is worth its price.

title: Taj in Air

title: Nice flight

The service was good. Food was good as well. We got pita bread with cheese paneer in veg and in non veg there was chicken.

title: UK 975, Delhi - Mumbai.
text: This is an early morning service of Vistara from T3 of Delhi. From checkin to boarding, everything was smooth, barring the delays in security screening. The flight was ontime, the onboard services were excellent and the vegetarian breakfast was compact, adequate and tasty.  This was my travel in Vistara almost after a year, it was nice to see that the freshness of an enthusiastic startup airline is still alive !! Was a nice way to start the upcoming busy day. At Mumbai, the aircraft was docked on to the aerobridge right across the baggage belt #1 and the bags arrived on belt #1. Was out of the terminal in less than 10 minutes after deplaning, something very rare at CSI T2  Arrival !!!

title: India's most young airlines
text: It was my first ever flight with Vistara and it was foggy, winter morning in Lucknow. Due to the late arrival of the aircraft the flight was delayed for more than 2 hours but unlike other low cost airlines, they offered all the passengers refreshments at the airport itself. However, the flight timing changed twice but the ground staffs were also clueless for the departure which I found little weird and hence I given them 4 stars instead 5. But during our return journey the ground staffs in Delhi were extremely helpful and offered me help as I was traveling alone with a kid. The fare was quite comparative and on that particular day the fare was less than Indigo also. The on flight complementary refreshment was also nice. Hope they should have more connectivity in other cities as well without affecting the quality of the services.

title: my favourite air line
text: vistara air line bht he aache air line h to cabin cru member is very decent and on time but meal service is not better .

title: Good, with a little bumpy landing
text: Despite the early morning timings, the flight is a welcome addition on the Pune-Kolkata route. The arrival time in Kolkata enables one to freshen up and then start with the business of the day in the city. The leg space in the economy class was more than what one finds in most carriers. The refreshments served was not stale, something we have got used to having mid-air. However the bland coffee spoiled the good taste of the croissant a bit, and could have been better. There was some mid-air turbulence, but the pilots managed it all right. The one thing that definitely needs to improve is the landing at Kolkata which was anything but smooth.

title: Very pleasant flight
text:
Saturday 10th February and we are booked on Vistara flight UK856 to Delhi from Goa and due to depart at 12.15 and arrive in Delhi at 15.00, 2 hours and 45 minutes flight.

We were travelling as Premium Economy passengers so we had extra legroom and the seats were comfortable. The cabin crew were very polite and efficient.

Once seated were were given a drink of water and a menu detailing the food and soft drinks available  (no alcoholic drinks) also a wet hand/face towel.

About 20 minutes into the flight we were offered a drink of either a Cola or orange juice. Roughly 30 minutes later we were served lunch, there were 3 options available, we chose the Oriental vegetable dish. A chicken curry dish or a veg biryani were also on offer. There was nothing wrong with our meal, however it was not to our taste, everything else was fine.

Once lunch was over we were offered tea or coffee. We were certainly kept well hydrated 

We airborne at 12.35 and it was announced that it would be a 2 hour flight, however did not land in Delhi till 15.00 which was the scheduled landing time

Ignoring the fact that we possibly chose the wrong meal, this was a very good, comfortable flight with charming staff

title: Very good flight

title: Wonderful Experience
text:

title: Odd circumstances lead to excellent services

This was due to intense fog and the republic day preparations in Delhi. Further to air traffic in Mumbai the flight got diverted to Ahmadabad ad I finally reached Mumbai at 12.30 in the night, a good 4 hours delayed. However, the attitude of the staff was amazing and the calm manner that they handled the passengers was very professional. That is why the excellent review

title: A MUCH BETTER FLYING EXPERIENCE!
text: Flew in January. A good airline by all yardsticks comparing the Low Cost Carriers who charge money to literally jam you into a seat where you are stuck for the journey. Vistara makes a difference and we were glad to fly this airline. Very good cabin crew and pilots, and very good departure and arrival arrangements. Would be happy to fly Vistara again. When an airline projects itself as a luxury carrier the seat size becomes important- Vistara should improve its seat size in Premium Economy!

title: Vistara- My most enjoyable flight experience..New feel indeed!!
text: Delhi airport ground staff were very helpful and courteous. The crew was very efficient, helpful and warm. The cabin crew ensured placing of luggage with those having difficulty especially in the latter part of the plane. Every one was seated well in time and the pilot's greetings was comforting. The flight was full, all passengers seated hence the flight started for the runway a bit in advance. Towards the takeoff bend it was held up by the air traffic controller giving priority to Air India flights. Due to this we landed a bit late, however the exact time of landing was informed about 30 min in advance and the Captain was very accurate. Fantastic experience with tasty meals.. indeed a new feeling ..this was my second enjoyable experience. (Club Vistara 115969641) I only wish the Govt of India would have given permission to Tata SIA much earlier.

title: My Favourite Flight
text:
I recently travelled with my family in Vistara  Flights. It was a round trip  From Delhi to Portblair and return trip. I was really lucky that I got good deal in this Premium flight. 
Interior is awesome. Staffs are good . The best part is their experiments with the foods. We had been served food for 4 times and there were no repetition in the food. The packet of food is also very awesome. I had never seen such a good packaging for food. The tag line on the food box is “what is inside the box is out of the box”. Really the food is out of the box.
Besides food all other aspects of flight is at par. 
Vistara is going to be my preferred airline.

title: Great experience !

title: Very good airline!

title: Bizarre rules
text: It's challenging to fly and even more challenging when airlines or flight attendants make up new rules.  After dealing with a chaotic check-in process in GOA, we got on a completely full flight.  Service was similarly chaotic with carts repeatedly going up and down the isle multiple times for no apparent reason.  Special meals were handed out in random order - some before the main meal was served - some after the main meal was served.  Sleeping passengers were woken up to ask about their meal options - which seemed crazy.  If people are sleeping - let them sleep.  When all calmed down - I peacefully continued reading my book on the iPad.  All was well until landing when Philo. the flight attendant, decided I needed to completely power off my iPad.  This is the rule she said.  Well it wasn't the rule on Vistara three days ago when I headed to Goa.  Completely annoying.

title: Please choose other airlines ! This is a total rip-off!
text: Vistara on ground staff at Bangalore we’re really sensible and customer friendly but at Delhi they were not considerate & were not ready to upgrade the seats until 1 hr before the take off and it turned out that all the business class seats were empty and they did not agree to upgrade !  They tried judging by our looks if we were flying premium !?! Excess baggage was charged at Ra.350 / kg and they had the audacity to tell that we took things for granted without even asking the reason for our excess baggage ! At Bangalore airport they told it was 25 kg allowance for premium economy but At Delhi they told its 20 kgs . I would not recommend or fly again with the same airlines !

title: One word - ''Impressive''
text:

title: Pleasant journey

title: Nothing special
text: Had traveled Vistara when it was relatively new, and then now, and found it has degenerated into 'just another airline', supposedly full-fare. "Lunch" seemed marginally better as a bun was provided. The dessert was not worth eating. I remember airline food being better than this, at least Jet airways used to. Traveled with kids but no one seemed to care, air hostesses seemed too hassled and busy handling the serving, and made faces even if you needed to go to the washroom with a kid. This wouldn't be my choicest airline for sure.

title: One of the very good flights I took in the recent past
text: One of the pleasant things was an upgrade from Economy to Premium Economy. The other, which needs special mention is the fact that the Cabin Supervisor Ms.Kim was extremely courteous and helpful. One of the passengers had a panic attack sort of condition and she was, I learnt , wanted to land immediately, about 15 minutes after the flight took off from Delhi.  Ms. Kim sat with her, almost through out the flight, kept speaking with her, giving her comfort, diverting her mind, etc. until such time the passenger was prepared to go back to her seat and felt comfortable enough. This is perhaps one of the rare occurences, at least for me, though a frequent flier.

title: good for Economy Class,too
text: An economy class ticket as a good fare. It was late only due to the fog situation in Delhi. The food they served was better than any I have eaten at any other airline on a similar flight. It was hot and tasty. the staff was polite.

title: OK experience
text: we upgraded to premium economy at check in and were glad of the extra legroom on the flight. Also it was good to be able to board the plane first instead of waiting till everyone had boarded to avoid the crush. Not sure that we got any different food but it was also good to get the priority luggage so once again you arent elbow to elbow trying to get your luggage off the conveyor. Flight was delayed but once in the air it was smooth with a great touchdown.

title: Rude Ground staff
text:
I have travelled on Vistara on couple of occasions and have traveled in all its classes of operations. Their service level onboard is outstanding for all classes. After good old Air Sahara, I think there's is the only airline currently in India ,with pleasant cabin crew members. Their checkin staff at counters is also good and provides you all help needed. I have never ever had any problem with the airline's staff other than this one incident that happened on my way back to Delhi from Amritsar.
Checkin was smooth and it was only while boarding that all chaos happened. So basically when boarding was announced, there were 2 lines made by the crowd and it was difficult to see the priority boarding board as there were a lot of people ahead of us in groups. We were total 8 of us,including 2 kids and 4 senior citizens. So our parents  were ahead of us and were sent thru the same line in which we had lots of other passengers also. I was stopped rudely by the ground staff Puneet Sharma(who told his name also so rudely when asked), and was told that I was in wrong line as this was priority boarding line. He shouted at the top of his voice for this and honestly I don't think that was needed. I was traveling with a 2 year old in my lap and a 10 year old, so even if the airline does not gives priority to families with kids(I was told this by the same guy and confirmed by the duty manager that vistara has policy not to give priority to families with young kids), still all this guy could have done, was to be polite. People are returning after a small holiday and he is just at the right place to ruin it. Extremely rude and arrogant guy. Duty manager should realize that sending the flight off at right time is not the only responsibility but he also has to make sure that same people travel again with their airline by training his staff well. If people don't buy tickets,unfortunately you guys also will stop getting paid. Taking sides for rudeness is absolutely not acceptable. Thumbs down for these 2 people from otherwise marvelous staff of Air Vistara.

title: Beware the web site
text:
When I tried to book directly, it looks like the web site isn't working after you've put in your card details because it seems to wipe the numbers. Assuming my purchase had failed I moved to ClearTrip and within seconds had my tickets. To my horror, I also had tickets in my email inbox for the same flights from Vistara. Ever since, I have been trying to get my money back from Vistara because I would have been charged a big penalty by ClearTrip. After almost two weeks of me sending emails, making calls and enlisting the support of their office at Varanasi, I have not had any written communication from them that confirms my refund (actually, the only email I received was within an hour of my first email asking for a copy of the ClearTrip ticket which I did, immediately). Their customer service is non-existent. Beware.

To be fair, the planes I flew in were good but fog delays were very bad.

title: Dealt with poorly through-out
text:
At the end of our time at the Andaman Islands, all we wanted from our economy seats was to take off with the view of beautiful islands below. Honestly, domestic flights give a unique view of India (try Varanasi to Jaipur, for a view of the Ganges)

Arriving very early for the flight as one of the first to check-in we were told that we could get Business for the price off premium economy. Shown the picture of the fancy seats and all we thought, 'Why not lets treat ourselves' Thats £20 not £100's, no brainer

We were told to wait next the counter until they allocated our seats. However, after the airport police, immigration and even members of Vistara had hassled us about our nearly missing the flight, myself going to teh desk three times and being told to wait 2 more minutes, we got our boarding pass.

We were then pushed through the airport like we had arrived super late. Marched on to the plane past the business class seats into premium economy... which is rubbish. Its economy seating with a food option.

Furthermore we had aisle seats two seats away from any view.

Having been hassled I quickly made a point of telling someone there had been a mistake. I was told to sit down and the head of the ground crew came to talk to me. I expressed my concern that we had been pushed around and given the wrong seats. He told me he would be back and left the plane. Before you know it we were rolling on to the runway.

I was so annoyed to have payed more to get less and be treated poorly that I talked to the head of crew cabin.... who were helpful and professional.

I was told that it had been logged and that I could enjoy the free food. My details taken and that i could have a refund of sorts.

After teh flight I emailed Vistara and they took a month to get back, told me that it was very bad what had happened but nothing of a refund. At this point I should say that the refund is only small but it was the principle of the thing. I was still annoyed at the treatment by the staff on the ground. Being lied to about the upgrade, made to wait, pushed around and then not listed to and left on the plane.

I kept on asking about teh refund and did not get a clear answer. They used peripheral wording to drag my attention from the matter.

This is the most expensive option you can have. I would use spice jet ever bit of the way. For a domestic flight they are cheap, efficient and run to and from nearly everywhere. You can upgrade for a fiver for extra leg room with window seats and they give you some snacks as well.

Vistara, would rather hold on to a little money in anyway they can instead of except their own blame. I was told that we had used teh service, but I had been told to except it by way of a sorry on the plane.

title: fab food service seating  - everything

title: One of the best in the Indian domestic market
text: This domestic airline formed as a joint venture between Singapore Airlines and TATA is the best in its class. It brings all the right elements from SIA, one of the leading airlines companies in the world and the indian business expertise from one of the biggest companies in India. Everything starting from the booking process to seat selection, which is free by the way, and goes a long way in providing customer satisfaction, to on time departures and efficient boarding process and most importantly, lavish seating and leg space. They are also probably the only airlines in the domestic indian circuit which serves meals on board free of charge and they have a wide variety to choose from like vegan, religious and the likes. The baggage collection doesn’t make you wait either and here is a little secret, even if your bags are a little over the capacity, they are very accommodating if you are in their frequent flyer program and that too even without asking. In short, this was by far the best domestic travel experience I had in India. Flights may be a bit on the expensive side and the airline is pretty new and as result is absent from most of the sectors in the domestic route but I hope they expand their reaches soon. In short I will close my eyes and fly with them again and I don’t mind shelling the extra buck for their service.

title: Worth Mentioning!
text:

I had this opportunity to experience the warmth of Vistara courtesy during my last flight from Chandigarh to Delhi where in Vistara's Airport manager Mr.Gautam Mehta and his colleague Priya (Check in /  boarding Incharge) left no stone un-turned to assist me and my other overseas guest who were travelling along with me.

The overseas guest were so impressed with not only the hospitality of the ground staff but were amazed the moment they stepped inside the cabin to experience the Vistara's 5 star service. 

What was noteworthy was one of the overseas guest shared that this was one of the best domestic flight that he has taken in recent times. 

SIA & TATA you definitely deserve huge credit selection & training of your staff and also for enhancing travel experience of thousands of travelers.

Kudos to Vistara!

title: No international card, and no courtesy regarding baggage issues
text:
This is the first time I chose Vistara, being an NRI we used my international card to purchase two way tickets on July 15 for my travel on 21 December 2017. On Sept 17 I believe all information regarding the card as requested by your team was sent. I got all alerts regarding flight changes on my phone. I also got sms regarding checkin online, however that didnt work, and when i called the customer service they said it was coz of the international card. Inspite of all this when we reached the airport, we had to wait for 20 minutes to get the boarding pass. When we got in the plane we were assigned the last available seats which we could not recline back hence an uncomfortable for me.  

On our return journey, once again we could not do the online check in, once again we waited another 20 minutes for the same international card to be verified, again we got the last seats available, which could not be reclined. To top it all, there was a bag which was held due to a battery in it, we were strolling in the airport for 2 hours during which they could have called us to inform about the stranded bag, and finally when we were about to board they tell us about the bag and that the bag cannot be sent in the same flight. we had to travel back to the airport the next day spending 7 hrs on the road two way to get the bag. I am so disappointed when I know the airport could have called to inform about the bag and they didn’t, and could have given a better service to an international customer. So tourist coming from abroad please avoid this flight. especially if you are using an international card.

title: A Excellent Treat
text:
My first flight on Vistara and what an absolute delight it was. Check in was smooth - the flight was delayed due to the plane coming in being late but regular announcements was made.

On boarding, beep-beep on the scanning and dear, sir, you've been upgraded to premium economy with my partner. Wow, the seats was nice and the service excellent. The presentation of food was good with real cutlery. My only regret was that it was such a short flight.

Vistara is a joint operation between the mighty Tata Sons and Singapore Airlines and the quality shows.

Will try to fly with them more often.

title: Rescheduled domestic flight by 7 hours
text:

After being stranded for 3days in Srinagar, we manage to fly out but to our surprise meals order during our booking were not served. title: Good legroom
text:
The main reason for me to book this flight is the timing of the flight - 08:15 hrs arriving at Ahmedabad at 10:00 hrs and suited my business appointment. 
There aren't many good options in the morning from Delhi - Ahmedabad so this makes it a good choice for business travellers.

This also makes it usually an expensive and crowded flight in the morning. Most of the passengers were business travellers and had done web check-in leading to a long queue for baggage drop-in. The good part is that the staff was responsive and diverted few of us to the premier check-in (very thoughtful and appreciated) to save time. 

boarding experience at the gates is average. 

The inflight experience is good mainly due to the legroom which makes the journey quite comfortable and you can discount other inconveniences due to this good factor. 

The food was average. portion size was small and could have been better.

Having flown with other airlines as well, this is obviously not the first choice but still a fairly acceptable choice.

title: Great Experience and Hospitality
text:
Vistara is a premium economy airlines in India owned by the TATA Group. One of the first things you'd notice about the airlines is the refreshing energy of their ground staff, right from the check-in counter, all the way to de-boarding the plane after your journey.
India is quickly reaching that saturation stage where due to the high number of frequent flyers, the airlines industry is become less and less customer-centric like in other developed nations like the US & UK. Amidst all this, flying with an airline that still considers its customers as guests and treats them with complimentary warm food and beverages is a welcome step. Added to that, the pleasant legroom space in their new Boeing A320s fleet and multicolored ambience inside the plane is bound to relieve you during the tiring journey.
I now make it a point to fly Vistara as much as I can.

title: Routine flight
text: The flight left on time, without a fuss. For a short domestic flight, that's about as much as you can expect. You get a snack and a drink and the seat is pretty standard. You get what you pay for and that's OK.

title: On-time performance but not very comfortable seats
text: Check-in was smooth. Departure and arrival were on time. Served Poori sabzi and scrambled eggs in the meal. However, the aircraft had smaller seat and limited leg space as compared to other economical airlines. Ticket prices are on the higher side.

The food was exceptionally better with more choices and served with care. Would prefer to fly with Vistara if the timings and destinations are matching my itinerary.

title: Cochin to Delhi on the A320Neo with Vistara
text:

Speed of boarding and great seating combined with a tasty in-flight meal each get my vote. The A320 Neo is the latest offering from AirBus, new next generation engines, whisper quiet, power you along and save 15% fuel over the previous current generation model. 

Staff aboard the aircraft were really helpful and friendly. We were in Delhi for one week and yes we took the upgrade option on the return flight!

title: Fantastic Experience
text: Without any doubt Vistara is The Best Domestic carrier in India. Aircraft is well maintained. Excellent on board meal served were simply fantastic. Flights always on time when ever I travelled... truly a great experience every time

title: Excellent Flight
text:
We were booked on a consolidated ticket through BA from Home to Goa. The connecting airline in Delhi was Vistara. As we had booked Premium Economy with BA we were graded the same with Vistara. We had priority check in as well as boarding. When the flight was first announced there was a call for business customers. I usually find that people do not listen to this announcement and get up ready to board and there is a lot of jostling. Not this time. It was well managed by the airline team. When they called for Premium Economy we went forward and to our delight we found we had been upgraded to Business. Very comfortable seating, menu provided for lunch and a nice meal was served. 
I recognise this is a fairly new airline but I have to say both my husband and I were impressed by the cleanliness of the aircraft, the hospitality of the staff and unlike our usual internal flights in India everything was very calm and relaxed. We will definitely fly with Vistara again.

title: 5-Star service
text:
OMG peeps... I never imagined an Airline that's so comforting, I felt at home. Vistara, I hereby, give you a standing ovation for such a fabulous service. Right from Baggage Screening to Disembarking and Carousel, you guys were absolutely fabulous. I don't think I frowned even one bit.  The crew were smiling at all times. Make-up was right on point. And their galleys, spotless. Even their ovens were spick and span. 
You guys must be wondering how I know so many technicalities in detail. Well, I'm from an Aviation background and I understand the minute details. It was a 02 hour flight. But, the services commenced right from boarding. I personally loved the on-ground services. After Take-off, the carts were rolled out in 15 minutes(I mean WOW). The menu cards were distributed on-ground. It had our choice of meal for that particular time of flight and it was Hot Snacks. 

The food was piping hot, just like it should be and no shortage. Having complimentary food service is a wish come true for travellers. I know Jet Airways does it too, but Vistara had a personal touch and no frowning crew. It beat Jet and I'm very sure since I'm Ex-Jet crew. They have a tie-up with Starbucks for Tea/Coffee service. Now isn't that amazing? I mean which Airline does that. For those of you who could never afford/got the chance to sip Starbucks' Coffee/Tea, have thanked Vistara dearly.

I miss Kingfisher Airways, but now since Vistara has come up, I don't miss it that much. Vistara is clearly rising like Kingfisher did. The only thing missing is the IFE(In-flight entertainment) systems. To add, I'm Ex-Kingfisher crew too. It was my first airline and I still love it dearly.

Vistara, bravo to the entire team. You, practically, are number 1 Airline of India. And no sooner, Jet will realise that and up their game. Loved, loved, loved you guys. Please maintain the same standards. And if you guys are wondering who am I, then all the people who're reading this review, please note, I am not from Vistara. But, I did fly for other Airlines. And now, I'm a successful Interior Designer. Anyway, do fly Vistara, whenever you get s chance. Much love.

title: Singapore Airlines replicated with India Girl
text: When we walked into the plane, it felt like Singapore Airlines replicated. Vistara, after all, is a joint venture between Singapore Airlines and Tata, and it was a good experience when compared to some of the Indian airlines we have travelled on previously.  It was a new plane, smelt fresh and the seats were comfortable. The flight to Srinagar was short - one and a half hours - but the crew was attentive and helpful. We could not get sparkling water as apparently the plane only stocks still water; still they tried to be helpful, suggesting alternatives which we declined. The vegetarian food was nice. The only thing we found a little unsettling was that the crew allowed someone travelling in economy to stuff our overhead baggage compartment with a large backpack and a carry on bag, forcing us to find baggage space. Fortunately, the business class was not full and we managed to squeeze our one backpack in. When the plane landed, again, the crew did nothing to allow business class passengers to disembark first. Passengers from the economy section crowded the aisle as soon as the plane landed and it was a mad scramble - almost like travelling on Ryan Air or Airasia. When passengers pay extra for Business Class, they expect a little bit extra comfort. Other than that, it was a great airline.

title: refined experience
text:
I was very interested in my first experience with Vistara, on an A320 between Hyderabad (HYD) and Delhi (DEL). I was seated in premium economy (PE). 

Check-in was smooth, and the agents were very polite and warm. PE comes with priority boarding, which was branded under the name of Vistara Priority, with a dedicated line at the gate. 

The aircraft had two rows of business class with 2-2 configuration, and several rows of PE just behind it with a 3-3 configuration. I liked very much that the aircraft had a fresh, new feeling. The seats were leather and very comfortable. 

A hot meal was served, which was more like a light snack. I chose vegetarian, which was tasty (unlike the mush that I frequently see in airplane food). The plate had a nice touch, with a golden thread tied around the napkin and utensils.

One thing I noticed different from other airlines (at least those that I have flied), is that passengers in economy were allowed to use the restroom in business. This is definitely not the case with my major carrier in North America, and I have rarely  seen this in other airlines as well. I liked this very much (although I did not capitalize on the opportunity). 

It seems that with PE comes priority handling of luggage. My luggage came out super quick, and I was off to my next flight in literally no time. All this for only CA$160, one-way!
