title: Our aborted Trip to Srinagar
text: We had meticulously planned our trip to Srinagar and made all reservations well in advance.Just two days to go,we had to call off the trip due to adverse travel advisory arising from a sudden law and order situation in Kashmir region.We were holding non refundable promotional fare ,but the airline promptly made us a full refund.

title: Good first experience
text:
Flight was pleasant, smooth journey from check in to check out. Food could have been better, tried the non veg fare, contained egg omelette, Taste was bland as per Indian standards, but condiments were available and were given when asked.

Staff was courteous and professional throughout the flight.

for inflight entertainment you could use their internal wifi on your personal device but choices in terms of content were limited. also personally i would try to avoid using my phone/laptop for in-flight entertainment as i would need the battery to last my whole working day.

title: A refreshing experience
text:
It was really a refreshing experience. From check-in to boarding it was pretty smooth.
The moment I boarded I was offered a lemon mint drink & water followed by a cold towel, I would have liked a hot towel instead. 
The seats were comfortable yet the legroom I found in the front row wasn't anything great especially after the lower half extended for leg support.
The attendant asked me what would I like to have after she showed me the menu which just had 6 items including beverages which I feel is disappointing. Out of which she did not have Paneer wrap. But she managed some been chat from the captains cabin for me showing that they really did try to make it up for the gap in all of that.

title: Excellent flight
text: This new airline is really awesome, The premium economy provides real luxury and food is very nice. The hospitality provided by airline crew is awesome. They are very nice.

title: SHIRDI TRIP
text: New but good airline however small network but surely expend time by time aircraft are new and interior are also good,food quality is good and service standards of staff are excellent on board...All the best for future

title: Excellent service in Premier Economy
text: Service though slow was good and impressive. The planes are well maintained and clean and fresh. The curtains separate you from the business class. Upholstery is of good quality. Lack of inflight entertainment system is noticed.

title: My current favourite airline
text: The king of good times at its peak would be jealous of the service Vistara today. Yes, they do not offer porch side pick up, etc but vistara get its basic right. Ive flown in all their 3 classes - economy, premium economy and business at different times and the service was impeccable in all 3 classes. Quick efficient staff, smooth check in process, minimal waiting time in economy queue, a good lounge at Gate 41 and the airline seats, from economy to business are the best in domestic sectors. refreshing change is their food. Reminds me of the quality of the old jet airways in flight food. Cant wait for them to start flying international and increase their domestic connectivity.

title: Was a pleasing experience
text:
I am a frequent flyer and mostly prefer flying Jet Airways. It was my 1st flight on Vistara and i was booked on Premium Economy. 

1. The color theme they use - Purple - makes the overall experience lively and Up Class
2. The Aircraft was well maintained and very clean
3. The food and beverages served again made a difference but the Dessert served by them during this flight was extremely non-eatable (Dry Sweet Seviyan)

Overall a good value for money

title: When Tatas enter any business .. they do it with Heart
text:
Great Service, Well Mannered Staff, and served Hot Delicious Indian food. 

Airline is not so old as others in India but surely is a future star.

title: Good Quality Airline!
text: That the Tatas are flying once again gives me immense pride and happiness! Vistara will surely carve a niche for itself with the kind of customer experience they are offering. They have an amazing lounge at the T3 airport. Boarding and checkin was smooth. One thing that really stands out is the legroom in Economy Class! Not much in-flight entertainment options though. Just a magazine, when they could have video screens with full entertainment system easily. Food was limited to cookies and an appy fizz since it was a short haul flight to Chandigarh. But I will give them prompt and friendly service and flight smooth and on time. Overall enjoyed flying with them and would consider again for flying.

title: Disaster airlines. Not worth a single penny
text:
Crappy airlines the legroom and cushioning off seat was  less than Indigo.The premium economy buisness class all had the same seats. The buisness did not have entertaintment system.The food was same for all passengers.They charged 2000                           
more for premium economy because they would give you a wet towel and juice and a coke if you wanted to buy.Coming to the buisness class as I told you seats were same just a bit more cushioning . The service was same.The Seats just reclined more .It was the buisness class the worst I had ever seen .The kids on the plane shreiking and shouting. There was a 5yr old boy who was crying because he had a wet diaper the parents did not bother to take him to the restroom.They infact changed the diaper there.The whole flight was stinking of poo and pee .My mom infact felt like puking.
The food was very bad if you took the veg or non veg the matatar paneer was stale the bread was bad the sevayin were also bad the chicken and rice were  also stale. the service was average for buisness bad for premium economy and terrible for economy.I even tried to ask for water I pressed the button and no one replied .
 Never take this disastrous poo poo airline !!!

title: vistala is a new but top of the line airline
text:
This is new but really top of the line airline. Its punctual and meals offered are creative.
The airport counter also helped me out at the bagdogra airport. The seats offer good legroom space.

title: Felt full service in budget
text:
On time, polite staff, clean aircraft and good food. Handled baggage well... Good Going... 

We only had one issue where we were asked to collect the checkin baggage at Delhi Airport before we board next leg in morning as they do not have lockers at Delhi Airport. But I would discount that for now as they are in process of settings up.

title: Romance of air travels returns with Vistara
text:
Vistara brings back the romance and thrill of air travel with its excellent service quality. Option of 3 separate cabin class give the customer much desired choice. I personally traveled Economy but was presently surprised with the leg room and quality of food on offer. The fleet consists of all brand new planes which are well maintained.
Overall it was a pleasure travelling with Vistara which provides a welcome change from uncomfortable cattle class offered by airlines like Indigo and Spicejet

title: Changed my Vistara!
text:
Travelled business class in this 3 class service from Bombay to Delhi. 

Excellent service & very clean aircraft with leather seats and plenty of legroom. No personal tv screens but they do give you a pre-programmed Samsung tablet and headphones. 

Fabulous dining options and delicious banana smoothies on board! 

Very impressed indeed! Used to fly only indigo on domestic routes but this airline has definitely got a new fan. 

Keep it up Vistara!

title: Pleasant Journey
text:
Very Pleasant Travel, I Traveled from Pune to Delhi & Delhi to Pune. Both side journey was good. Staff, cleanliness, comfort everything was good.

Food served was really good. While on return journey I asked for some snacks instead of proper food as I was on Fast, & they did served me with Fruits & Juices.

title: Great In flight experience
text: if you ever have a choice to fly with an airline with cheap airfare vis a vis Vistara- choose Vistara. So happy am i with their overall experience that i make it point to schedule my travel date and time as per vistara availability. On the domestic front- vistara is a clear winner in terms of their timings , announcements, attendant courtesy, food, consumer interactions and basically everything that has to do with flying. the only piece lacking is the absence of any audio visual console that could have been a boon especially on long flights but even that does not take away from the rich user experience the vistara crew provides. keep up the good work guys!!

title: Warm hospitality & amazingly comfortable
text:
It was my first flight with Vistara and I was truly in for a surprise. My fiance had booked my tickets to visit my family in Delhi for my birthday. We had got an economical fair and I thought it will be similar to the other budget airlines but I must say, Vistara is a class apart. I often fly to Delhi to visit my family and also fly for work to domestic locations.

Vistara was my best journey. Classy, comfortable seats, good food, warm service and hospitality. It was amazing and I also got a gift since it was one of their first flights to New Delhi. I guess I was lucky to get a good inaugural deal but I would still respect them for the service.

title: Budget carrier with the facilities of a Full-service carrier!
text:
After Kingfisher airlines stopped its operations, I was eagerly waiting for the next best airline which would go out of its way to please their customers and Vistara has filled in the shoes, and pleased even more than Kingfisher ever has!
The service is great and their on-time performance is commendable.
The in-flight meal provided is tasty and filling and the staff is extremely amicable. 
I would definitely recommend one and all to try Vistara in the future.

title: comfort @ low cost

Very comfortable travel with tea n breakfast served in nice packing .Punctual in timings .One feels little pampered by nice service. Absolute politeness and a feeling of valuable guest of the Airline.

Very good travel experience. Try yourself n feel good.

title: Experience was good

text: Well from where do i begin with, its very difficult to mention the great service / facility and hospitality provided by Vistara family. we really had a good time flying with them. Aircraft is very Spacious and equipped with good facilities and has simple yet elegant interiors. seats were very comfortable, even for kids. Pilots and crew members were much professional. they knew their role perfectly, and living upto the expectations. be it safety instruction / warning, serving meals, providing any help to kids or adults, older people. Pilots were very proficient that while our journey from delhi to Srinagar, climate wasnt good due to thunderstorm and flight was lil shaky, and we all were very nervous and scared to death. but the way they handled the situation and made our journey worth and safe by taking care of it very nicely. Eventually our trust grew for the airline and their staff. title: A review of flying the new feeling
text:
I had originally booked myself on an evening flight on another airline but decided to take a morning #AirVistara flight instead. I took the decision one day prior to departure and found that the #AirVistara economy class pricing to be much lower than competition – about 15% lower approx. I made my booking on #Cleartrip of course – there is just no other site that is as well designed and intuitive. I put in my FF number on #Cleartrip while booking – usually the airline systems pick this up. The #AirVistara systems didn’t seem to, though.

Web-check in – I had to go to the #AirVistara site to do a seat assignment and check-in. The #AirVistara web-site is really slow and not built keeping the slowness of Indian internet in mind. Too many clunky images that take far too long to download. Once I was inside the web-checkin flow I felt that the flow was not intuitive. I had to first update the FF number – which is a separate funnel from the seat and meal selection. The seat selection is also not intuitive – there is a small box that logically looks like the place to click, but it is not. I was web checking-in about 14 hours prior and noticed that there were hardly any seats that were available – I counted less than a dozen. Is that because the airline system auto-allocates? I know from experience that so many people could not have checked in by themselves so much in advance. The exit row is not available for selection. This, for me, is a big negative as that is the seat that I select all the time and have no qualms about paying the extra charge for that comfort. After I finished checking-in I saw multiple options for delivery of the boarding pass (including an Apple Passbook feature) which I felt was well thought through. I couldn’t print the boarding pass as I didn’t have access to a printer and thought that I would do that at the airport kiosk.

Airport check-in – At the airport, I couldn’t see #AirVistara enabled in the kiosk. A big miss in my opinion, esp. if the core target audience is corporate & business travellers who have probably forgotten what it is like to stand in a check-in queue. At the check-in counter, I checked if the 11F that I had been allotted (thanks to someone in the #AirVistara team allotting this when we called them) was an exit row – and the agent was a bit confused, probably because of the LOPA changes currently underway (the airline is changing to a different seat configuration across their fleet). The service was, however, polite and courteous – definitely a few notches better that my recent experiences with other airlines.

Before the flight – The boarding process was smooth. Not sure if it was because there was no queue and I could walk straight through. The aircraft had a nice clean and fresh look to it and the welcome was warm and friendly. The exit row instructions were delivered personally rather than like a classroom that some airlines do these days. It was delivered well except that the attendant didn’t really make eye-contact all the time – doesn’t leave the right impression if the delivery is to be personal. Asked for some water before we took off and didn’t get it – maybe I was too close to push-back. Even if it was, would have been good to hear from the attendant that I would get it once we take off. I have never been a big fan of leather seats – feel that the leather makes the seat feel very hard, which is how the seats felt to me on the #AirVistara aircraft. The seats needed to be pushed very hard to get them to recline – not sure if that is the way they are designed or if it needs some looking into.

In the air – We pushed back ahead of time and were taxiing on the runway at the STD. That is something that one expects of a base departure anyways. There were only 7 exit row seats occupied which meant that I would have no one in the seat next to me – on a 2:30 long flight that was a luxury. This was in line with the occupancy in the Economy Cabin (I counted about 75 people) – which for a prime-time, week-day, inter-metro flight is a big commercial red flag. With extremely competitive pricing, why was it that #AirVistara was not able to fill the economy cabin? Is there a brand / marketing issue? Did they bank too much on last-minute demand that they forgot to get their share of the advance-booking travellers? Can’t really be an awareness issue as they have now been around for more than 15 months.

Food service – Carts were promptly rolled out as soon as we were airborne and I was served a veg breakfast as requested. My first impression was “Oh my god, the packaging is way too excessive”. Well designed for sure, but there must be other ways of delivering this that is far more ecologically responsible. The cutlery says “oxo-biodegradable pouch & cutlery – contributing to a sustainable planet’. Come on, we are just fooling ourselves if we seriously believe this. The poha and rava kesari/sheera for breakfast was really nice. A welcome change from the unexciting airline food that I have been having every week for the last several years.

The rest of the flight was quite uneventful as I decided to catch up on some sleep after I wrote this blog post. The landing was on time and quite smooth. There was an airport snafu when we got off the plane though – the gates to the terminal was shut and we had to wait for a few minutes before someone could open then.

Will I fly them again? I reckon so if their schedule is convenient for me – for which they will need to add more frequency on the routes that I usually fly every week.

title: One of the best in flight services i have experienced in my more than 20 years of travelling
text:
I was travelling alone, returning from a business trip. The ticket was booked by my wife and as this happened to be the only flight meeting my time requirements-It was going to be Vistara (a tie up of TATA and Singapore Airlines).  I was expecting an uneventful flight and it was. The check-in staff were well spoken and well dressed as is the case with all airlines. (I might have generalized a bit about all airlines having well spoken staff.) Boarding was also carried out in sequential order of seating of course giving priority to women, children and elderly. Again now a days most airlines conduct their boarding in this manner so nothing new here. One thing which caught my attention was that in their announcements they referred to us (passengers) as "customers" which felt sort of depersonalized and distant. As I boarded the flight, it was obvious that they had acquired new planes-it felt clean and fresh. Found my seat and buckled up. After take off, they started the refreshment service. The food was good both in terms of quality and quantity. A lot of the passengers were fasting for navratra so they refused the food. The stewardesses could have cared less-they offered, the passengers refused-end of story. But this was not the case here. They kept asking them with a sound of genuine concern if they would like something else or if they would like to take something to eat later. This is what touched me most about this flight. Singapore airlines is known for their excellent service and hospitality and the staff at Vistara is doing a good job of upholding that tradition and this is why i believe it is one of the best domestic airlines I have flown till date. Their prices tend to be a bit on the pricier side and it would be nice if something could be done to make them more competetive so everyone would be able to get the Vistara experience and not just go for the other airline only because of the cheap air fare.
Its been more than a year since I have flown Vistara but my wife happened to travel with them recently and she assures me that they have maintained their hospitality even now.

title: Best domestic route flight in india
text:

title: More leg space !!!!
text: This was my first experience with Vistara , and I was pleasantly surprised with the Leg space they offer compared to other airlines. Food though was just average.

title: The best airline in our country.
text:
When I saw that my husband had booked a Vistara flight for me I was curious. I hadn't heard of it before but soon found out that two big names, Tata and Singapore Airlines have come together to form Vistara. The word 'Vistaar' in Sanskrit means 'expanse'. Apt for an airline.
Vistara? A friendly face asks and guides me in Delhi airport even though I didn't need it. Inside, I think...hmm, that's nice! I asked for a window seat and got one. Early bird, I know but with the times I have had to travel sitting in the middle seat!! This was bliss! As soon my luggage is checked in I am guided towards the gate. Midway, another friendly face. Vistara? I'm liking this!
Once inside the aircraft, the difference is obvious. Friendly smiling stewards. Not the plastic smiles that do not reach the eyes with the perfunctory reluctant greeting before you reach your seat. Everyone is courteous. A welcome drink of coconut water arrives soon after we are seated. And after that wet towels were distributed. This airline cares!
Mine was a 2-hour-ten-minute flight. Midway between the flight meals were served.I'm including a picture of my non-vegetarian meal of 'Kheema pav" along with one savoury accompaniment and dessert. It was good! I asked the lady who was seated next to me how hers went and she said she liked it. She had opted for a vegetarian meal. The air steward was very attentive and it was over all a very good experience flying this airline. I'd surely opt for Vistara the next time I travel.
As we reached Guwahati, I left the aircraft feeling that this is the best airline in India!

title: A Good alternative to Air India
text: They offer great cushion seats which are now seldom seen on budget airlines. All seats have great Legroom and they also offer very good food. The Staff at Check In counters are also very courteous. The Plane was very clean too. Though nothing beats the comfort of Air India but Vistara is surely my second choice.

title: The best flight in the Indian sky
text:
I booked Vistara for my father, traveling from Bangalore to Delhi. I had few concerns on the airline as it was my first booking with Vistara. However, everything just went perfect as follows:

1. The airlines website does not charge you convenience fee for booking tickets unlike all other no-frills airlines (Indigo, Spicejet).
2. Price of the flight was almost same as budget airlines.
3. Food was good, service was courteous.
4. Flight was on time, was schedules on a convenient time.
5. The communication from airlines was cordial and appropriate.

I would try to fly with Vistara provided I get good deals with ticket price.

title: good experience
text: I travel on 11 April 2016, from bagdongra to Mumbai via Delhi,journey was very long but the service was too good that just time passed away very quickly, food serve was very tasty and fresh, it was my returning journey.

title: Its Actually a New Feeling
text:
If I had to describe Vistara in one word it would be - REFRESHING.

Everything about Vistara is different from other airlines and the staff do take pains to ensure that it stays that way. I believe it is the fact that its a Tata enterprise.

The use of violet as a colour make you feel royal. the uniforms of the air hostesses are very well designed and suit and Indian context. The F&B menu boasts of dishes from around the country and items that I have generally not seen in other airlines or many restaurants.

The use of technology - preloaded Tablets with AV content and live streaming of AV over a local wifi loop (in testing phase) is also something that is a first in the Indian Airline scenario.

All in all, a most wornderful experince and I hope that they grow to be the country's best airline.

title: Just awesome
text: Just awesome service. Great Flight. smiling people. Clean chairs & the paper pocket. Very friendly and out to help Air hostess. Food packing was out of the box. The grosund staff @ Bagdogra was extremely helpful & guided us absolutely perfect. Will travel again for sure.

title: First time - blown away
text: Having flown all the various airlines in India, thought it about time to try out the newest. On booking, noticed that premium economy was only a few pounds more than economy, and despite it being only an hours hop down to Goa, thought why not. Seamless check in, helpful staff offered me extra leg room (which i declined as wanted to see what standard leg room in premium economy is like). Boarded on time, all staff from ground to crew all immaculate and professional. Immaculate aircraft, spotlessly clean, nicely cooled, being in premium economy, extra few inches of legroom made all the difference. Cold towel and juice offered before take off, hot meal service during flight. Flight on time and the pilot greased the landing!! Faultless from start to finish. In general more expensive than the rest, but worth every penny!!!

title: Vistara ....Good Domestic Airline
text: I travelled Pune to Delhi with this flight . Service , Ambience was fantastic .Comfortable seats , Good leg room .On time flight & Great food

title: Wow Experience!
text:

title: The Star In The Indian Sky!
text: One of the classiest airlines in the Indian sky, Vistara combines the service of Singapore Airlines and the quality that you can expect from a Tata company. Its aircraft are spanking new and clean, with ample legroom and great service! The food is amazing, though the frequent flyer programme could have been more lucrative. On - time performance is almost a given and this is one airline that is really going to shake things up and create a niche in the Indian skies!

title: Vistara- refreshing
text: The trip got off to an encouraging start- I got upgraded to Business class from premium economy. On an earlier occasion, my first flight with the airline, I was upgraded to premium economy from economy class. So up-gradation, wherever and whenever possible makes for a value added, enjoyable experience to the flyers and something to look forward to. Separate check-in counters and queues for even premium economy; slightly better airline food served more artfully (though food quantity was small); more leg room and spacious seats (I must admit I am small-framed but the difference is noticeable, nevertheless); gracious staff; on time departure and arrival; the unusual colour of the uniform- royal purple adds to the overall impression of being distinct and different. Despite being a full-service airline as opposed to budget ones, the fares were competitive. It is a shame that the airline does not fly to more destinations. I would travel Vistara more frequently if it were to.

title: Doesn't get better than this in India yet.
text:
I'm 6'2 and one of the first things I tend to as I book my ticket is to make a bee line for the emergency exit rows.. you know... because, height and I don't like the feeling of having my knees cramming into the first seat for 2 odd hours!

The vistara seats are VERY comfortable even in lo-economy. Ample leg room.  The food served is well cooked, well packaged and of course, this is true for most airlines except our faithful air india, the staff is extremely polite and well behaved.  

The aircraft smells fresh and in the three flights that I have taken with the airline yet, Twice between Delhi - Mumbai and once from Delhi to Hyd, the pilots have been excellent with effortless landings that were very smooth.  

Great airline over all, I just wish the rewards system was a little more rewarding!

title: Expensive but unparallel Royality
text: Vistara, the Vistar of the star of Indian sky, with an exception after all time favorite Kingfisher Airlines, the only airlines brought changes in terms of luxury in mid sky. Vistara is trying to be like kingfisher, which is appreciable.

title: excellent start

title: Truly top in quality
text:
All those established airlines including Govt airlines, have a lesson or two to learn from Vistara Operations, care, planning, communication etc in the entire ticketing - to - arrival luggage belt life-cycle of a normal middle class economy air traveller.

Pushing & messing up passengers for a cruel on-time statistics is definitely going to be detrimental to some airlines, for sure. Ownership changes and top management changes do not reflect on the arrogant staff who behave as lala customer care agents to travellers also are about to see those passenger sentiments sooner or later.

Hope & Pray Vistara can maintain the same and hold on to the same quality or a better one in the future.

title: Good flights with average service
text:
We were a group of friends travelling from Mumbai to Bagdogra in the first week of March 2016. Vistara do not operate a direct flight from Mumbai to Bagdogra, we were booked Mumbai to New Delhi UK970 and then New Delhi to Bagdogra via Gauwahati UK765.

The best part about the check in with Vistara is that you get to see the Mumbai T2 Terminal. The overall check in procedure with Vistara is poor. We were asked to move from one counter to another for check in. May be this was due to we being a large group, but we have never faced any such situation before with any other airline operator.

The boarding procedure went on smoothly from Mumbai. However, the arrival gate at New Delhi and Departure Gate were really far from each other. This caused a great inconvenience to the group.

All the seats were booked with seats allotted togather at the time of booking. However, different seat allotted at the check in counter while issuing boarding passes causing the group to sit differently in flight from New Delhi to Bagdogra. We found it surprising that Mumbai New Delhi flight had proper seats allotted to us (same as booking) while New Delhi - Bagdogra had this issue. The cabin crew could not do much as the seat were allotted to other passengers.

The food served in flight was warm and good to eat. Even Jain food that was pre booked for 2 of our passengers was warm and good. The cabin crew was cheerful and helpful.

The landing and take off at all destinations were comfortable.

Overall, we found the experience average and value for money. We would not recommend this airline for Mumbai to Bagdogra, as it takes too long a time.

title: Best short range airline with excellent service
text: I flew more than a dozen different airlines over the past two years and this short distance flight experience was one of the best. The flight attendants genuinely cared about the passengers. They also served a decent meal in the short flight. The check in process was also quick, efficient and courteous. It has now become my most preferred airline in India. I hope they will expand their network and keep up the excellent work.

title: A very pleasurable flying experience
text:
From check-in to boarding, in-flight service of an excellent lunch by smiling hostesses to comfortable seats and periodic update announcements by the Captain, our experience was most pleasurable. The flight took off 15 minutes late due to VIP movement (it was on the day of 'Make in India' week in Mumbai and a lot of VIPs were coming in for the inaugural function). However, the Captain made up the time and we landed on time. The only facility that is not present id the ability to choose your own seat on the website at web check-in. 
I would certainly prefer Vistara anytime over other airlines.

title: The Dark Horse!!
text: I am a frequent flier and have made innumerable trips last year. Since I travelled twice with them during their first anniversary celebrations, they offered me a premium economy ticket. Right from the quality of service to the menu, everything is aimed at delighting the customer. While everyone has been taking about Jet-Indigo-Spicejet, this airline has quietly made its foray and went onto provide A class service to its guests without much ado. I just hope that they expand to every sector possible and keep up the good work

title: One airline whose first priority is the guest!
text: We were travelling to Lucknow and were carrying heavy luggage. Reached the airport very late due to a massive traffic jam at the Delhi Gurgaon border. Initially, the airline staff refused to allow us boarding, but then they relented and let us check in. Special word for Ms. Aanchal, who was very helpful. The airline staff ran with us carrying our cabin luggage, right upto Gate 52 (IGI T3) and ensured that we managed to board the flight. The interiors of the aircraft were clean, seats looked royal, stewards were courteous, and food was good too. We were pleasantly surprised when we collected our luggage at Lucknow as it was marked fragile and eventually loaded in the aircraft at Delhi. Absolutely loved the experience of flying Vistara, and also the airline which gives so much attention to their guests. Thank you Vistara!

title: wonderful airline
text: a brand new airline , cabin crew and a simply great new experience ! sadly for the stupid ground staff of SATS who are far below the international standards . i guess tata and singapore airlines should take a call on this issue.

title: A true test passed with flying colours, Love the new feeling
text:
It was my first on Air Vistara, A true new feeling retaining the trust of Tata and the Experience of Singapore Airlines. Highly professional, courteous and swift service with a smile. They know their job well and the way to do it. 

Though my 6 am flight was delayed for almost 6 hrs due to fog departing at 12 but the efficient management and skilled staff never let me feel the crunch. They were well Informed and updated us regularly along with timely meals at 6:30 at the food court then on board at 9 then in the air with some snacks. 

Cabin has a fresh interior with all leather seats, adjustable Headrests, enough legroom even in the last row with reclining seats.

The pilot covered the distance in a short time and landed smooth, a very rare experience from a domestic flyer in India.

I look forward towards new flights and hope the feeling stays new forever.

Thank you team Vistara for this amazing experience.

title: Great new airline
text: A great no nonsense airline. Very professional staff. They serve decent food (no need to purchase). Love their disposable food boxes which are well designed to make them practical for use and yet very economical i guess! Staff is professional and courteous.

title: Best airlines in the domestic sector but they need to increase their fleet.
text: I have used Vitara for the first time after its launch this year. It has been an amazing experience flying with them since the air staff makes sure you have a comfortable journey and provide you with hot towels during the landing and take off which ensures that you look fresh by the time you get off the flight. The food provided by them were upto the International Airlines standards. The only airlines in domestic sector which provides you with in-flight entertainment through a tab.

title: A most comfortable ride
text: The airline lives up to the reputation of Tatas and Singapore airlines. It is a huge improvement on other airlines flying the route , in the same class.

title: Trendy full service airline
text: A trendy full service airline is how I would describe this airline. Being a Singapore Airlines joint venture with TATA, you could only expect a classy service and its bang on. Right from the way they treat customers to the actual experience of flying with them, the airline was by far a very good experience. The food, especially, was very good in quality and in line with what one would expect from airlines when flying in the 1980s-1990s. The general aura of the plane and the smartly dressed air hostesses can only be described as trendy. Leg room was adequate, seats were comfortable, air hostesses and staff were courteous, price was right for the service offered. There was no in-flight entertainment probably due to the short flight time (<1 hour).

title: Airline to watch out for!
text: Air Vistara is a true hallmark of the Tata and Singapore airlines brand. It has totally disrupted the Indian airline sector and offers extra value for money at competitive prices, good quality food, service and planes. I cannot comment on the timeliness of the airlines as the flights to and from Delhi are delayed in the winters due to heavy fog conditions. Also, the fact that it takes the international terminals in both Delhi and Mumbai, just add to the overall experience of the journey!
